DruidGuard002.synopsis: Maggran, one of the druids guarding the Grove, reacts to its successful defence. He also reacts if the tiefling refugees finally leave.

AD_Grumpy.synopsis: Goblin warchief complains about the raid on the den after the victory. It was too easy - he wants more.

AD_ChefAndSon.synopsis: Player eavedrops on arguments between Okta and her son Ikaron. Dialogue changes depending on whether or not the player has spoken to Ikaron about the missing tieflings.

Servant003.synopsis: Orran spent the attack locked inside the druid lair. We only speak to him in the victory state. He thanks us for our help, but is still keen on us leaving, though he stays polite.

AD_TrainerAtOilBarrels.synopsis: Asharak is doing the rounds, speaking to tiefling civilians in the area. Sergeant rallying the troops/manning the defences kind of feel.

AD_LoversWithoutGuard.synopsis: Bex is tending to an injured Danis after the successful defence of the druid grove. Elated to survive. Danis, a little whoozy from his injuries, decides this is a good time for a romantic gesture.

AD_FillingOilBarrel.synopsis: Guex and Pandirna are filling oil barrels in preparation for a goblin attack. Pandirna is worried and venting, Guex is pretending he can't wait to fight.

ProdigyTrio.synopsis: Rolan (the prodigy) bickers with his Cal and Lia. The player can choose to weigh in or not. Soldiers, rangers or fighters can give some specific advice on their battle formation.

AD_LookingForDoni.synopsis: A worried Rikka is looking for Doni so that she can lock up a shelter before an imminent attack.

AD_WarchiefBraveVictory.synopsis: Rozzak walks around the Den after the raid, stopping to call out praise and support to nearby goblins

AD_ViolentAtPool.synopsis: Raider taking a piss in the Grove sacred pool.

Tiefling004.synopsis: A tiefling on the eve of the goblin attack. She's not quite allowing the gravity of the situation to sink in, focusing instead on busywork to keep her mind off it.

RobberKid.synopsis: Cheeky and disrespectful child - player may have previously encountered him stealing from someone.

AD_HideoutLeaderScolding.synopsis: Mol scolds Lim and Meli and tells them to get back to packing..

ParentB.synopsis: Marricko is hidden away as the attack appraoches. She's afraid, but determined to keep it together.If her daughter is alive, she's worried about her but also knows she can take care of herself if needs be.If her child is bad, she laments when she even survived. She is despondant and grieving.
ParentB.how_to_trigger: Repro steps:1. Start the game2. loadlevel WLD_MAin_A3. oe readyattackonden4. speak to zevlor5. Blow the horn6. killcombat to kill all goblins7. goto 206 4878. speak to Marricko

RaiderMurderous.synopsis: a goblin participating in a large raid - speaks maliciously about killing the youngsters at the raid target

Refugee002.synopsis: One half of a couple the player may have spoken to previously. He's mentioned working as a guard before, but when it comes to actually fighting he's a little scared. Cheerfulness masking real fear and doubt.

AD_KidStory.synopsis: The bard is telling a story to distract the children from the impending battle. She herself is barely holding back her own fear.

AD_BardDefendsKids.synopsis: The bard takes a last stand to defend children from goblins who've gotten past the gate. We might have discovered her backstory - where her mentor and other travelling companions were recently slaughtered in similar fashion.

AD_DrowArrives.synopsis: The drow commander is leading a group of goblins in an attack on some tiefling refugees. If the players have chosen to side with her and are already killing the tieflings when she arrives, she is amused that the player has taken the initiative; they're excellent evil allies.

BackupLeader.synopsis: Cerys is a tiefling ranger who has been out scouting the road ahead for Zevlor/Asharak, trying to find a way through the goblins on the road. She returns just after the attack on the den to discover her leader is dead, and that she'll have to take his place. She seeks player out immediately and forces a dialogue..
BackupLeader.how_to_trigger: Repro steps:1. Start the game2. loadlevel WLD_MAIN_A3. oe readyattackonden4. blow on the horn to start battle5. betray the drow (wside with the tiefling)6. CRT+SHFT+K on Zelvor and Ashrak7. Kill combat (make sure kill everyone)8. go down and up the ladder9. scene will trigger

AD_HideoutLeaderSighing.synopsis: Mol is muttering to herself while listening to the bard's tale in the back of the cave..

Sapper_004.synopsis: a goblin carrying explosives into the attack on the grove
Sapper_004.how_to_trigger: oe readyattackondenteleport S_GOB_AttackOnDen_Sapper_004speak with Goblin Sapper

RitualDruid005.synopsis: This dialogue takes place after the player has successfully fought back an army of goblins that attacked the druid grove. Tahani blames the player and the tieflings for bringing a fight to their door, and she's not shy about telling them.
RitualDruid005.how_to_trigger: Repro steps:1. Start the game2. loadlevel WLD_Main_A3. oe readyattackonden4. speak to zevlor5. Blow the horn6. killcombat to kill all goblins7. goto 237 5198. speak with Tahan

TrainerVictory.synopsis: Asharak is triumphant and emotional after his people stood against impossible odds.
TrainerVictory.how_to_trigger: Repro steps:1. Start the game2. loadlevel WLD_Main_A3. oe readyattackonden4. goto 195.23, 34.85, 441.72 and skip through the entreance cinematic.5. Kill Zevlor (CTRL-K)6. Blow the horn and side with the tieflings.7. Killcombat8. Wait for the cinematic to start.

GrieflingFriend.synopsis: Memnos, a tiefling, is praying/hiding while the goblins attack the Druid Grove. He admits that he's lost his nerve and doesn't want to fight off the attackers. We can try to persuade him and give him courage; if we succeed, he'll join the defences. Fail, and he'll continue cowering.

HalsinAndDruidLeader.synopsis: Halsin meets with Kagha after returning to the grove. He chastises her for her actions during his absence. Depending on Kagha's demeanour, he may soften his tone or not.They disperse after this dialog.
HalsinAndDruidLeader.how_to_trigger: Repro steps:1. Start the game.2. loadlevel WLD_Main_A3. oe readyattackonden4. Blow the horn and side with the tieflings (kill all goblin).5. goto 260.71, 14.82, 523.326. talk with Halsin.

Pickpocket.synopsis: Child is sitting listening to a story - aware of the chaos going on around her but confident it will turn out alright because that's what her sister has told her.

RaidersArriveBeforeFight.synopsis:
Takes place immediately after the player blows the horn at the gates of the grove, beginning an attack on the refugees hiding there. The surviving tiefling leader rallies his troops, then the drow commander arrives with her retinue of goblins. She mind-melds with the player. She expects them - as True Souls - to betray the tieflings, and players must choose whether to side with her OR with the tieflings as the attack begins.

This is a huge fight and a decisive moment for the tieflings, the drow/goblins, AND the players.

AD_WarehouseLooters.synopsis: Two goblin raiders are looting the Grove Storehouse.

AD_GrumpyAndArrogant.synopsis: Two goblins talk after a victorious raid at the druid grove.

AD_WarchiefAndLooters.synopsis: The warchief hassles two other goblins, demanding why raiding the nearby storehouse is taking so long.

Refugee003.synopsis: Bex and her partner Danis have been roped into acting as medics for anyone wounded during the attack.

LairDoor.synopsis: NOTE: the 'lair door' speaker is supposed to be Marcoryl, one of the druid servants (though he is unseen throughout, behind a locked door)Doni the grunting tiefling kid stands by the sealed entrance to the druid lair. A voice from with warns both player and Doni away. It becomes apparent that the druid servants have sealed themselves in the inner sanctum before asn impending goblin attack, Efforts by the player to get them to open the sanctum to others fail  - the servants just want to ensure their own safety.
LairDoor.how_to_trigger: Trigger:- oe readyattackonden- goto 224, 527- Talk to the door

Grunting.synopsis: Child is listening to a story - player is interrupting. It's the eve of a battle and children are being distracted.

AD_CoweringRefugee004.synopsis: Goblins have broken in and started killing civilians. Toron shouts with fear and panic.

Tiefling005.synopsis: Guard nervously awaiting the start of a battle. Player may have met previously, when her legs were immobilised by a potion.

AD_ApprenticeLastStand.synopsis: The druid's apprentice prepares to make her last stand against the player, who has betrayed her and the grove she swore to protect. She's shattered by the betrayal.

AD_DrowCommander.synopsis: Minthara looks at the map on the table at the den where the leader is after the plea at the gates. She is communing with her god - the Absolute - quietly, as she plans her next move.

RaidersArriveAfterFight.synopsis: the drow commander and goblins arrive during the attack on the grove to find the player has already gone hostile to the tieflings by attacking them. The drow is amused that the player would start the slaughter without her and either joins them to finish off the tieflings, or gives futher orders if all are dead
RaidersArriveAfterFight.how_to_trigger: Repro Steps:1. Start the game2. loadlevel WLD_Main_A3. oe readyattackonden4. Enter the grove and go to the top of the gate.5. Attack any tiefling.6. killcombat.

RaiderArrogant.synopsis: archer attacking the tieflings at the grove

Pet004.synopsis: A boar has just survived an attack on its home and is strutting about the place proudly

DruidGuard003.synopsis: Mino, one of the druids guarding the den, reacts to its successful defence. He also reacts if the tiefling refugees have left and if victory was secured owing to the assassination of the goblin leadership

Servant002.synopsis: Marcoryl spent the attack hiding in the lair, refusing us access. Now the attack has been repelled he's opened it up and is keen to see the tieflings gone. A sanctimonious and unrepentant bad host to those in need.
Servant002.how_to_trigger: - Be far away from Den, then use: oe readyattackonden- Activate the horn above Den gate to trigger Goblin raid- Side with Zevlor in dialogue and kill all goblins. (CTRL + Shift + K) or “killcombat”command is useful here - Talk to Marcoryl (ServantIntolerent002) down in the druid's underground Den at X:-470 Y:-11

Bard.synopsis: Alfira is trying to distract the children from battle preparations going on around them.

BirdSender.synopsis: This dialogue takes place in two different states. The first is after the player has successfully fought back an army of goblins that attacked the druid grove. In the second state, the goblin leaders have been killed and the tieflings in the grove are leaving. She's aware of the hard work ahead required to make things go back to normal, but she's hopeful all the same.There's an extra node to acknowledge the missing idol, if it went missing before one of those two states were triggered.

AD_BickeringTrainees.synopsis: Gan and Ide are guard trainees "defending" one of the two hideout entrances together and bicker about which one will kill more goblins.

AD_GrieflingFriendAtGrave.synopsis: Memnos is burying his friend, Arka, if she died while defending the druid grove. He refers to another tiefling, Kanon, who died during a previous attack.

Refugee004.synopsis: Refugee on the verge of panic with a battle set to take place outside. Quietly furious the player is not up on the walls protecting them.

ZenBear.synopsis: After a huge fight at her home, this bear is either depressed and tired because she can't find her master, or happy and content because she's finally found her master.

AD_Refugees.synopsis: Okta, Ikaron, Danis and Bex are standing around the shelter area waiting for the attack to begin..

Stargazer.synopsis: The region is under attack by Goblins; she's taken shelter with the rest and is nervous and afraid.
Stargazer.how_to_trigger: From crashsite:in reCon: oe readyattackondenteleport S_GLO_Stargazer

Trainee002.synopsis: Child who's been trained to fight - swelling with pride and confident they can handle whatever's coming.
Trainee002.how_to_trigger: from crashsite:oe readyattackondenin reCon: teleport S_DEN_Trainee_002

Sapper_002.synopsis: goblin carrying explosives into the attack on the grove

Adventurer2.synopsis: Remira is an adventurer we've already met - she dislikes tieflings but is staying to defend because they gave her injured friend shelter when they didn't have to.

RitualDruid003.synopsis: This dialogue takes place after the player has successfully fought back an army of goblins that attacked the druid grove. Inwe is rattled to the bone by the battle. She doesn't feel safe in the grove anymore after seeing so much bloodshed.

AD_CheckingBarricade.synopsis: Lakrissa and Kaldani are going back and forth over a barricade they're building together in preparation for the attack. They're friends joking around to hide their nerves about the incoming goblins..

AD_StupidAndDummy.synopsis: A dumb raider is fighting against a dummy.

AD_PackingTraders.synopsis: Lim and Meli are packing away the valuables they've scored..

Servant005.synopsis: Arron, a druid trader, is truly relieved that the player was able to help everyone. He didn't look forward to what would have happened otherwise.

HarpyKid.synopsis: A kid in a protected area - think like a bunker during the blitz - waiting for an attack to come. Somebody has been telling him and his friends stories to distract them from what's coming. He looks up to the player because he saved him before.
HarpyKid.how_to_trigger: Repro steps:1. Start the game.2. loadlevel WLD_Main_A3. goto 299 5434. walk down to water and save the kid5. oe readyattackonden6. goto 84 777. Talk to Mirkon

SnakeKid.synopsis: Child is listening to a story - player is interrupting. It's the eve of a battle and children are being distracted. This kid is only present if player saved them from their snake death.

Pet003.synopsis: The bird returns to the Den after the tieflings win.

MindMeldAfterCombat.synopsis: A drow commander telepathically communicates with players who have allied with her to slaughter the inhabitants of a druid's grove

PrisonGuard.synopsis: NPC Dialog during and after the Attack on Den state.

Prodigy.synopsis: Rolan (the prodigy) reacts to the successful defence of the grove, in the event that he was convinced to stay.

Drow.synopsis: A drow commander leading an attack on a group of tiefling refugees. She is following the orders of a new god, the Absolute, and is zealous and sadistic. In this situation, the player has sided with her and betrayed the tieflings - a fact she enjoys a great deal.
Drow.how_to_trigger: Repro steps:1. Start the game.2. loadlevel WLD_Main_A3. oe readyattackonden4. Side with the Goblins and kill all tieflings.5. Talk with Minthara 6. Kill all Druids7. Talk with Minthara

Mule2.synopsis: Ox dialogue during and after the den gets raided by goblins.
Mule2.how_to_trigger: From crashsite:oe readyattackondenin reCon: teleport S_DEN_Mule_002debug book - useful spells - petpal (for petpal lines)

AD_CoweringRefugee003.synopsis: Player has turned on the tiefligns and is coming after them!

AD_CoweringRefugee002.synopsis: Triggered when goblins break in to slaughter unarmed civilians.

Tiefling003.synopsis: Cook - losing prospect at prospect of enduring a siege.

Kid004.synopsis: Child is listening to a story - player is interrupting. It's the eve of a battle and children are being distracted.

ScoutCaptive.synopsis: A druid we've saved twice from goblins thanks us after a major attack. This dialogue takes place after the player has successfully fought back an army of goblins that attacked the druid grove.
ScoutCaptive.how_to_trigger: Repro steps:1. Start the game2. loadlevel WLD_Main_A3. oe readyattackonden4. speak to zevlor5. killcombat to kill all goblins6. goto -461.924; 0.839; -22.413

SonOfChef.synopsis: This is Ikaron's solo dialogue. It occurs in the Attack on Den state. It can occur after his dual dialogue with Okta or if the player spoke to him before triggering that scene.

AD_BetrayedGrieflingFriend.synopsis: Memnos is outraged after the player betrays the refugees in favour of the attacking goblins.

WarchiefGrumpy.synopsis: Goblin raider before/after the raid on the druid grove.

AD_GrieflingOnGate.synopsis: Arka talks to herself while manning the Grove's defences, working herself up for the imminent battle against attacking goblins. She mentions her dead friend Kanon and all the goblins she intends to kill in his name.

Pet002.synopsis: After victory following a huge goblin attack on his home, a wolf feels satisfied with a job well done, but warns you not to ruin the peace..

AD_HalsinJoinsFight.synopsis: AD that plays when Halsin joins the fight against the goblin raiders, after the player betrays the tieflings.

HalsinReturns.synopsis: The Druid Grove has been saved (because either the attacking force was repelled or its leaders were assassinated) and Halsin returns. He thanks the player and reacts to events that may have transpired in the grove during his absence. He's previously promised to help the player with their tadpole problem, but he defers this discussion until the next morning after the victory celebrations.
HalsinReturns.how_to_trigger: Repro steps:1. Start the game.2. loadlevel WLD_Main_A3. oe readyattackonden4. Blow the horn and side with the tieflings (kill all goblin).5. goto 260.71, 14.82, 523.326. Talk with Halsin.7. Skip through the dialog with Kagha.8. Talk with Halsin again.or1. Start the game2. oe readygoblinhuntvictory3.  goto 207; 4654. Talk to Zevlor, skip the dialogue but he needs to stay.5. goto 259; 5206. Talk to Halsin and skip the dialogue.7. Talk to Halsin again.

Servant004.synopsis: This dialogue takes place after the player has successfully fought back an army of goblins that attacked the druid grove. Elwyn is shaken - she's spent a long time worried about the safety of the grove, and had given up hope once the goblins arrived. After the goblins were defeated, she realises her fear had gotten the better of her.

DruidOpposed.synopsis: Rath's dialog once the Tieflings win Attack on Den OR once the quest Goblin Hunt is completed. He provides a reward to the player if they have brought back Halsin.

AD_HideoutLeaderInstructions.synopsis: Mol is looking over the valuables that have been gathered by her underlings and advises them as they prepare to journey to Baldur's Gate.

TorturedAdventurer.synopsis: Oneliner when we find the tortured adventurer sleeping in the grove during the attack on the den.

AD_LairDoor.synopsis: The person behind the locked druid sanctum door (Marcoryl the druid servant) yells at Doni (grunting kid) to get lost.

RitualDruid002.synopsis: This dialogue takes place after the player has successfully fought back an army of goblins that attacked the druid grove. Kerrick feels ashamed for having participated in a ritual that would have driven the tieflings out, especially after having just fought beside them against the goblins.

AD_Prodigies.synopsis: The prodigy and his brother and sister are having an argument about their role in the defense of the grove.

Sapper_003.synopsis: a goblin carrying explosives in the attack on the grove

AD_TrainerAtBarricade.synopsis: Asharak is on the gate with Kaldani, before the goblins attack. Surveying her work..

Trainer.synopsis:
Asharak has been tasked with getting civilians prepared for war. He hopes having the player on their side might make the difference.
If the tiefling leader is dead, Asharak reluctantly steps into his shoes.

Trainee003.synopsis: Player speaking directly to a tiefling child who's learning to fight.

LockdownDrow.synopsis: Minthara arrives at an inaccessible druid grove with her raiding party, and punishes the player for failling in their orders to open it.

RaiderBossy.synopsis: A goblin raider celebrates upon having successfully destroyed a shelter full of refugees. Jubilant and nasty.
RaiderBossy.how_to_trigger: Repro steps:1. Start the game2. loadlevel WLD_Main_A3. oe readyattackonden4. Blow the horn and side wit the goblin (kill all tieflings at the gate).5. goto 175.70, 21.56, 529.966. Kill all tieflings.7. goto 258.42, 14.76, 525.528. Kill all druids.9. Follow the goblins to 285.38, 1.25, 470.3310. Talk with Goblin Sharp-eye

DruidLeader.synopsis: Kagha dialogue if Attack on Den has occurred. Various states included in this dialogue
DruidLeader.how_to_trigger: oe readyattackondenSpeak to Zevlor; blow the horn; side with the Tieflings; killcombat everyoneEnd Zevlor's victory speech.goto 257.41, 14.35, 519.96, and speak to Kagha

PAD_DeadKids.synopsis: Player finds dead tiefling children, killed by goblins, after assisting the goblins in a raid on the grove. NOTE: this dialog only triggers if players chose to side against the tieflings.

AD_LootingGoblins.synopsis: Two goblins are looting the area near the cook and adventurer areas before burning it to the ground.

EntranceMeeting.synopsis: Zevlor or Asharak are manning the wall of the grove, which is sealed up tight against a coming invasion. They're astonished to see an ally (the player) emerge from the trees and order their soldiers not to shoot.
EntranceMeeting.how_to_trigger: for zevlor pathfrom crashsite:oe readyattackondenwalk up to the front of the den gatedialogue triggers automaticallyfor asharak path:same as above but kill zevlor before triggering (ctrl shift k)asharak will stand in then

Griefling.synopsis: A tiefling preparing for the goblin assault on the grove - she's scared but excited about the attack because she sees it as a chance to avenge her friend, Kanon, who was killed by goblins earlier. She's trying to sound more sure of herself than she is.
Griefling.how_to_trigger: Repro steps:1. Start the game.2. loadlevel WLD_Main_A3. oe readyattackonden4. goto 230.06, 35.80, 432.905. Talk with Arka.

OpenGateBetrayal.synopsis: The player has opened the gates during a siege, allowing enemies to attack. The speakers here are leading the defense, and by opening the gate, the player has betrayed them, working with the enemy on the outside.

AD_BetrayedLeader.synopsis: Triggered after player betrays refugees in the grove and opens the gates for the goblin army outside.

RaiderViolent.synopsis: goblin raider before/after the raid on the druid grove.
RaiderViolent.how_to_trigger: From crashsite:in reCon: oe readyattackondengoto 203, 444skip through dialogue with zevlorblow the hornSide with Minthara in the next dialogue 'Obey and open the gate'killcombatgo into den and killcombat all tieflings (in cave and druid circle)teleport S_GOB_RaiderViolent

RitualDruid001.synopsis: This dialogue takes place after the player has successfully fought back an army of goblins that attacked the druid grove. Aelar is still in a bit of a daze from chanting for so long. He doesn't quite believe everything that's happened.

RaiderHardy.synopsis: A goblin taking part in a raid on a druid grove

ElevatorBear.synopsis: Dialogue for the lazy bear sleeping next to the elevator after the den has been attacked.
ElevatorBear.how_to_trigger: Repro steps:1. Start the game 2. loadlevel WLD_Main_A3. oe readyattackonden4. Go blow the horn and side with the tieflings (kill all goblins).5. goto 244.59, 15.62, 490.716. Talk with Tuffet.

AD_WarchiefAndPotions.synopsis: The warchief sees through the arsonists who failed to loot the storehouse and orders them to get to looting despite the fire.

EntranceMeetingWyll.synopsis: Player returns to den after letting Wyll return beforehand. NOTE: A NARRATOR NODE IS REQUIRED IN THE FIRST NODE BECAUSE IT IS A SPEAKER SELECTION WITH A CINEMATIC.
EntranceMeetingWyll.how_to_trigger: Repro steps:1. Start the game2. oe denraiddone in debug3. goto 324.31, 41.35, 42.19. Recruit Wyll via debugbook. He must be close by when the following dialog happens.4. Speak to Minthara. Select dialog option 1 >Wyll will interject. Pick dialog option >3 (tell him to be quiet),5. Continue dialog with Minthara >2>1>2>2>2,  Give away the Druid grove location;Wyll will protest. Select dialog option >3: The refugees aren't my problem. This will cause Wyll to leave the party6. goto 208.30, 24.70, 436.96 and enter the Druid's Groove7. goto -53.59, -12.58, 69.45 to trigger the re-arrangement of NPCs for ready attack on den.8. goto 200.37, 35.43, 445.92, speak to Wyll

ProdigyBrother.synopsis: Cal reacts to the successful defence of the Druid Grove, in the event that the prodigy and co were convinced to stay.

RaiderCrafty.synopsis: goblin raider attacking a druid grove full of tiefling refugees in a huge assault

VoloBear.synopsis: The bear is shocked by the slaughter of the battle that just happened and wants to leave.

AD_RaidersAtPool.synopsis: Raiders are having a pissing competition by the water close to the sacred grove.
AD_RaidersAtPool.how_to_trigger: Druid encounter needs to happen for these goblins to appear, and they must then survive the combat. From load, do oe readyattackonden, kill all tieflings, then go kill druids at the sacred pond. Follow the goblins to their pissing spot.

LeaderKid.synopsis: Player is speaking to an adolescent girl on the eve of battle. She's mature beyond her years and cynical about their chances of survival. They're standing on the edge of a story circle where children are being distracted from the coming battle, but she's not buying it.

AD_CaringForOx.synopsis: During the goblin attack. Trying to keep the ox calm.

ProdigySister.synopsis: Lia reacts to the successful defence of the Druid Grove in instances where she was convinced to stay around.

AD_RikkaAndDoni.synopsis: Rikka found Doni, so they can go hide together before the goblin attack.

ChefAndSon.synopsis: Okta and Ikaron are gathering food/supplies for the den's defense. Ikaron is upset after seeing several other tieflings run off in the middle of the night for Baldur's Gate.

GoblinLush.synopsis: goblin raider before/after the raid on the druid grove.

AD_BossyAtPool.synopsis: Raider taking a piss in the Grove sacred pool.

Wyll.synopsis: Wyll dialogue if he is an NPC and is in the goblin camp after attack on den victory. In paths where the attack has yet to begin, Wyll is enthusiastic for you to blow the horn and call for battle. After battle, you can recruit Wyll.
Wyll.how_to_trigger: oe readyattackondenSetGlobalOsirisFlag DEN_AttackOnDen_State_DenVictory teleport S_Player_WyllSetGlobalOsirisFlag DEN_AttackOnDen_State_DenVictory SetGlobalOsirisFlag Wyll_Recruitment_Event_RecruitedOnceteleport S_Player_Wyll

PickpocketTrader.synopsis: Young child is hustling and trying to trade with player on the eve of a battle.

RaiderStupid.synopsis: Gobin raider before/after the raid on the druid grove.

Mule1.synopsis: A speak with animals dialogue where the player can commune with an ox and get a sense of their feelings during and after an attack on the Druid Grove - fear, confusion or elation depending on who wins the fight.

Tiefling001.synopsis: Rikka is a civilian caught up in the battle at the grove, She is scared, but initially distracted by the search for an eccentric little boy she needs to get to safety before sealing up a hideout.

Apprentice.synopsis: |Dialog used:- after Attack on Den (tieflings won)- after Goblin Hunt|
Apprentice.how_to_trigger: Repro steps:1. Start the game.2. loadlevel WLD_Main_A3. oe readyattackonden4. Side with the tieflings and kill all goblins.5. goto -443.35, 1.36, -8.526. Speak with Nettie.For other permutation you will need to:1. Have already met Nettie and told her about the tadpole (good and bad reult)2. Halsin will need to be dead.

AD_ChefAndSonPacking.synopsis: Ikaron is trying to lift a heavy crate to load onto a cart with Okta packing by his side.

Gatekeeper.synopsis: She's the gatekeeper at the Druid Grove and speaks these lines before and after a goblin attack that threatens to kill everyone in the place. She's shaken and extremely surprised and relieved to have survived

AD_CoweringStargazer.synopsis: Goblins have just broken in and started killing unarmed civilians around Nadira.

BackupVictory.synopsis: Cerys is addressing a crowd of her people after a battle in which their leaders died. She's taken it on herself to take the lead, despite being uncomfortable with the duty..

Trainee001.synopsis: A child who's been trained to fight - terrified and in denial at the fact that he may just have to.

AD_BetrayedTrainer.synopsis: Triggered after the player betrays the refugees and turns on them.

RaiderBold.synopsis: goblin raider involved in attack on the druid grove

AD_KidMurderers.synopsis: Two goblin raiders are having a leisure chat after they have murdered all the tiefling children.

Sapper_001.synopsis: goblin with an explosive barrel, participating in the attack on the grove

Weaponsmith.synopsis: The tiefling weaponsmith is arming the others defending the den and checking their gear.

RaiderCunning.synopsis: A goblin participating in a large raid on a druid grove - these lines are spoken during and after the fight

AD_HalsinAndDruidLeader.synopsis: Halsin is speaking with Kagha until the players arrive for a scene. This dialog varies whether Kagha turned good or conflict with tieflings wasn`t resolved - it can be tense or reconciliary.

AD_LoversOverTortured.synopsis: Danis and Bex are a couple tending to the wounded adventurer while waiting for the attack to begin.

Tiefling010.synopsis: Tiefling refugee before/after the goblins raid the grove.

RaiderFunny.synopsis: A goblin taking part in an attack on a group of civilians, hiding in a refuge

RaiderChieftain.synopsis: goblin raider involved in the attack on the grove - some lines before the attack, one in the aftermath

AD_GrieflingFriendAtGate.synopsis: Memnos and Arka express relief upon surviving the attack on the druid grove.

RaiderHefty.synopsis: A goblin raider before/after the raid on the druid grove.

Servant001.synopsis: Ilderin spent the attack locked in a bunker and we're speaking to her after successfully defeating the goblins. Despite having been saved by us, she is pious and unwelcoming.

AD_PotionRaiders.synopsis: Two raiders are raiding Ethel's supplies and drinking random potions.

Melee_001.synopsis: goblin raider attacking a druid grove full of tiefling refugees in a huge assault

AD_Sappers.synopsis: Three goblin sappers (with explosives) are bored after a fight

AD_TrainerAndGatekeeper.synopsis: Small talk between Asharak and Elegis at the gate. They're both frightened and looking for distraction.

AD_GrieflingFriend.synopsis: Memnos prays to any god who might listen as the grove he's sheltering prepares to face an onslaught of goblin attackers.

RaiderThirsty.synopsis: this goblin has just killed a group of tiefling children - he feels pretty bad about it and he really isn't used to feeling bad about killing ANYTHING

AD_DrowCommanderKneelingOverTiefling.synopsis: Minthara is leaning over the bodies of slain tieflings in the grove after the attack in den. She is poised and pleased in her victory.
AD_DrowCommanderKneelingOverTiefling.how_to_trigger: Post attack on den Minthara is in the study, examining the dead bodies there/strolling around with idle behaviour

ParentA.synopsis: Parent is hiding away in the refuge, awaiting the attack.

Refugee001.synopsis: Refugee before/after the goblins raid the grove. She has become numb, resigned to her fate.

AD_GettingArmed.synopsis: Guex is telling some reluctant non-combatant tieflings to arm themselves for the road ahead. He speaks while looking over them picking through a pile of weapons.

WarchiefBrave.synopsis: goblin raider participating in a huge attack on a peaceful druid grove full of tiefling refugees

TieflingLeader.synopsis: Zevlor is tense - he's awaiting a long-expected attack on the grove, and the player is likely here to confirm it or perhaps even strike the first blow against him. Zevlor's usual tone is all stiff upper-lip, but at certain points we'll see the cracks start to form.
TieflingLeader.how_to_trigger: From crashsite:in reCon: oe readyattackondenteleport S_DEN_TieflingLeaderorin reCon: oe readyattackondenwalk to front on den gateskip through entrancemeeting dialogueteleport S_DEN_TieflingLeader

DruidGuard001.synopsis: Jeorna, one of the druid grove's guards, reacts to their victory in defending their home. She may also react to the tiefling refugees having left.

Ranged_001.synopsis: The goblins have just won a bloody victory over innocent civilians.

AD_CraftyAtPool.synopsis: Raider taking a piss in the Grove sacred pool.

AD_CharmedKidStory.synopsis: Mirkon is a fallback, telling a story if the bard isn't present. He's excitedly telling the story about how he got caught by the harpies and the player rescued him.

PAD_LairDoorBlocked.synopsis: The door to the druid's lair is blocked. Player can't get inside to help people get in.

TieflingVictory.synopsis: Zevlor is triumphant and emotional after his people stood against impossible odds. If you know he's a follower of the cult, he'll change his tone slightly when turning to address you.
TieflingVictory.how_to_trigger: ReCon: oe readyattackondenTalk to Zevlor and then blow the horn.Side with the Tieflings.ReCon: killcombat until all of the goblins are dead.Talk to Zevlor, then he will approach the ladder and begin the speech.

AD_InstructionsForKids.synopsis: Rikka is firmly giving instructions to children before they depart on a dangerous journey.

Tiefling007.synopsis: A novice guard who's brash and eager to fight. He's either guarding the wall or filling barrels of oil ahead of the fight.

DruidGuard002_0.speaker: Maggran
DruidGuard002_0.text: His blessings - our blessings - to thank you.

DruidGuard002_1.speaker: Maggran
DruidGuard002_1.text: They could have cleared up after themselves before they left...
DruidGuard002_1.context: NodeContext: Referring to the tiefling refugees.

DruidGuard002_2.speaker: Maggran
DruidGuard002_2.text: Our 'guests' are finally gone. I thought they'd never leave.
DruidGuard002_2.context: NodeContext: Referring to the tiefling refugees.

DruidGuard002_3.speaker: Maggran
DruidGuard002_3.text: His leaves to shade you. His branches to point your path. His shelter to protect you. Thank you.
DruidGuard002_3.context: NodeContext: Reciting a blessing of Silvanus for you. Should be spoken with a smile, a blessing/prayer as thakns for what you've done.

AD_Grumpy_0.speaker: Zurga
AD_Grumpy_0.text: Where do druids keep their liquor?
AD_Grumpy_0.context: NodeContext: irritated - just raided a grove and there's not a lot of good loot

AD_Grumpy_1.speaker: Zurga
AD_Grumpy_1.text: Lads were too soft - I didn't even get any good scars.

AD_Grumpy_2.speaker: Zurga
AD_Grumpy_2.text: Wish we'd raided another tavern instead of a... garden.
AD_Grumpy_2.context: NodeContext: he's struggling to find the right word for what this place is and lands on garden - he's annoyed that they've raided a grove that is mostly just trees and plants

AD_Grumpy_3.speaker: Zurga
AD_Grumpy_3.context: NodeContext: draws phlegm from back of throat and spits onto floor

AD_ChefAndSon_7.speaker: Ikaron
AD_ChefAndSon_7.text: We'll make it last. We always do.

AD_ChefAndSon_6.speaker: Okta
AD_ChefAndSon_6.text: I can't thin the broth much more than this.

AD_ChefAndSon_3.speaker: Okta
AD_ChefAndSon_3.text: If I'd known they were leaving, I would have given them an extra helping.

AD_ChefAndSon_2.speaker: Ikaron
AD_ChefAndSon_2.text: They're cowards, mother. You don't owe them anything.

AD_ChefAndSon_5.speaker: Okta
AD_ChefAndSon_5.text: But can you really blame them? After Elturel...

AD_ChefAndSon_4.speaker: Ikaron
AD_ChefAndSon_4.text: We can't run forever. I'd rather stand and fight.

Servant003_0.speaker: Loic
Servant003_0.text: The others are leaving - why don't you do the same?

Servant003_1.speaker: Loic
Servant003_1.text: You're the only one still dawdling here. We need some quiet.

Servant003_2.speaker: Loic
Servant003_2.text: You did this grove a great favour. Now leave the rest to us.

AD_TrainerAtOilBarrels_3.speaker: Asharak
AD_TrainerAtOilBarrels_3.text: Looking well, folks - keep it up.

AD_TrainerAtOilBarrels_6.speaker: Asharak
AD_TrainerAtOilBarrels_6.text: I'm not 'sir'. I was a doorjack in Elturel.

AD_TrainerAtOilBarrels_1.speaker: Pandirna
AD_TrainerAtOilBarrels_1.context: NodeContext: Repeating what her companion was saying mockingly.

AD_TrainerAtOilBarrels_4.speaker: Guex
AD_TrainerAtOilBarrels_4.text: Shut it, you - and help me with these barrels.

AD_TrainerAtOilBarrels_8.speaker: Asharak
AD_TrainerAtOilBarrels_8.text: Remember - get down to the cave as soon as you hear the horn.

AD_TrainerAtOilBarrels_0.speaker: Guex
AD_TrainerAtOilBarrels_0.text: What happens if they attack before we get the signal?

AD_TrainerAtOilBarrels_10.speaker: Pandirna
AD_TrainerAtOilBarrels_10.text: Nearly. We've ransacked the packs for anything that'll burn.

AD_TrainerAtOilBarrels_5.speaker: Asharak
AD_TrainerAtOilBarrels_5.text: Good. Reckon we can brave a few nights without lamp-light if it means burning these buggers.

AD_LoversWithoutGuard_2.speaker: Danis
AD_LoversWithoutGuard_2.text: We did it. Come on, give me a kiss.

AD_LoversWithoutGuard_1.speaker: Bex
AD_LoversWithoutGuard_1.text: Hold still! I'll kiss you when you've stopped bleeding, you lummox.
AD_LoversWithoutGuard_1.context: NodeContext: Concentrating on seeing to his wounds. Gentle admonishment

AD_LoversWithoutGuard_3.speaker: Bex
AD_LoversWithoutGuard_3.text: Yes, you are. Now stop squirming!
AD_LoversWithoutGuard_3.context: NodeContext: 'I love you and share in your happiness but you're being pain in the arse right now'

AD_FillingOilBarrel_6.speaker: Guex
AD_FillingOilBarrel_6.text: Not so bad as burning goblin will, I'd wager.
AD_FillingOilBarrel_6.context: NodeContext: With bravado, playing at experience in war.

AD_FillingOilBarrel_1.speaker: Pandirna
AD_FillingOilBarrel_1.text: It seems... cruel, when you say it like that.

AD_FillingOilBarrel_4.speaker: Guex
AD_FillingOilBarrel_4.text: Cruel? Imagine what they'd do to us, given half the chance.
AD_FillingOilBarrel_4.context: NodeContext: As if he's never heard anything so stupid.

AD_FillingOilBarrel_5.speaker: Pandirna
AD_FillingOilBarrel_5.text: Can we just get this done, please? I want to get below before -
AD_FillingOilBarrel_5.context: NodeContext: Fed up. Hands are covered in a layer of oil

AD_FillingOilBarrel_13.speaker: Guex
AD_FillingOilBarrel_13.text: Before what? Afraid you might actually have to fight?
AD_FillingOilBarrel_13.context: NodeContext: False bravado, savage - he wants to seem like he can't wait to fight.

AD_FillingOilBarrel_9.speaker: Pandirna
AD_FillingOilBarrel_9.text: Look. Asharak already picked who he wanted on the walls, right? And it wasn't us.
AD_FillingOilBarrel_9.context: NodeContext: Knows he's full of crap, but too tired to take him up on it.

AD_FillingOilBarrel_8.speaker: Guex
AD_FillingOilBarrel_8.text: You might be afraid of your own shadow, but some of us -
AD_FillingOilBarrel_8.context: NodeContext: Prickly - his courage has been questioned

AD_FillingOilBarrel_11.speaker: Pandirna
AD_FillingOilBarrel_11.text: Puff out your chest all you like - I'm going where it's safe.

AD_FillingOilBarrel_10.speaker: Guex
AD_FillingOilBarrel_10.text: Would you be careful? We're going to spill if you don't stop shaking.
AD_FillingOilBarrel_10.context: NodeContext: Irritated, trying to pour oil into a container

AD_FillingOilBarrel_12.speaker: Pandirna
AD_FillingOilBarrel_12.context: NodeContext: Annoyed, she's afraid and he's pointed it out so she's defensive. She cuts herself off before finishing the outburst.

AD_FillingOilBarrel_0.speaker: Guex
AD_FillingOilBarrel_0.context: NodeContext: lecturing, not picking up on Pandirna's mood

AD_FillingOilBarrel_3.speaker: Pandirna
AD_FillingOilBarrel_3.context: NodeContext: Bitten off, quietly insistent. She's close to snapping.

AD_FillingOilBarrel_7.speaker: Guex
AD_FillingOilBarrel_7.context: NodeContext: Backing off, as if she's being unreasonable but he's being the bigger person.

ProdigyTrio_5.speaker: Rolan
ProdigyTrio_5.text: Look at this place. Like a pen of hogs waiting for the butcher's knife. We need to act!

ProdigyTrio_19.speaker: Lia
ProdigyTrio_19.text: Quiet! Some of the children might hear you.

ProdigyTrio_7.speaker: Rolan
ProdigyTrio_7.text: Oh, perish the thought they overhear a little honesty once in their short lives -

ProdigyTrio_1.speaker: Lia
ProdigyTrio_1.text: Another word and it won't be the goblins you have to worry about!

ProdigyTrio_25.speaker: Player
ProdigyTrio_25.text: You three are making me root for the goblins.

ProdigyTrio_0.speaker: Rolan
ProdigyTrio_0.text: I'm merely pointing out this whole strategy is sorely lacking...

ProdigyTrio_4.speaker: Lia
ProdigyTrio_4.text: Oh, share your tactical wisdom with us then!

ProdigyTrio_27.speaker: Player
ProdigyTrio_27.text: Let them argue. Right now, anger's more useful than despair.

ProdigyTrio_8.speaker: Lia
ProdigyTrio_8.text: Trust me, I'm feeling both anger and despair.

ProdigyTrio_18.speaker: Rolan
ProdigyTrio_18.text: Why, I think I'm almost in agreement with you on that score.

ProdigyTrio_2.speaker: Rolan
ProdigyTrio_2.text: That's to say me at the front while the others stay back and do as I say?

ProdigyTrio_13.speaker: Lia
ProdigyTrio_13.text: Shut it just for once, you insufferable, oafish -

ProdigyTrio_17.speaker: Cal
ProdigyTrio_17.text: Stop it! Listen to someone else for once.
ProdigyTrio_17.context: NodeContext: Exasperated - gesturing to the player to continue.

ProdigyTrio_11.speaker: Player
ProdigyTrio_11.text: Rolan in back, where he has time to cast. You two are his shield.

ProdigyTrio_20.speaker: Cal
ProdigyTrio_20.text: I can live with that... I hope. What about you two?

ProdigyTrio_22.speaker: Lia
ProdigyTrio_22.text: Fine. As long as I don't have to listen to any complaints in the meantime.

ProdigyTrio_31.speaker: Rolan
ProdigyTrio_31.text: So be it. I'll take a mediocre plan over nothing.

ProdigyTrio_16.speaker: Player
ProdigyTrio_16.text: Rolan front and centre - you two don't want to get caught in his crossfire.

ProdigyTrio_6.speaker: Lia
ProdigyTrio_6.text: There you go, Rolan - the glory of dying first is all yours. Happy?

ProdigyTrio_9.speaker: Rolan
ProdigyTrio_9.text: Exceedingly happy. But I won't be dying.

ProdigyTrio_28.speaker: Cal
ProdigyTrio_28.text: That's as close to an agreement as we're likely to get. Let's keep it that way.

ProdigyTrio_24.speaker: Cal
ProdigyTrio_24.text: Let's just stick to the plan, now that we have one. Agreed?

ProdigyTrio_30.speaker: Rolan
ProdigyTrio_30.text: We could've been far away from this place by now.

ProdigyTrio_21.speaker: Lia
ProdigyTrio_21.text: Or shot through with goblin arrows.

ProdigyTrio_10.speaker: Cal
ProdigyTrio_10.text: Please! I can hardly hear myself think over the pair of you.

AD_LookingForDoni_0.speaker: Rikka
AD_LookingForDoni_0.text: Doni! I don't want to lock you outside, please.
AD_LookingForDoni_0.context: NodeContext: More quietly than her other shouts, as much to herself.

AD_LookingForDoni_1.speaker: Rikka
AD_LookingForDoni_1.text: We don't have time for this, Doni, please!
AD_LookingForDoni_1.context: NodeContext: End of her tether with this boy - he means well but he disappears and is frustrated

AD_LookingForDoni_2.speaker: Rikka
AD_LookingForDoni_2.text: Doni! It's time to come back now! DONI!
AD_LookingForDoni_2.context: NodeContext: Worried, increasingly exasperated as the child she's looking for doesn't appear

AD_WarchiefBraveVictory_0.speaker: Rozzak
AD_WarchiefBraveVictory_0.text: Good work - the True Souls are proper pleased.
AD_WarchiefBraveVictory_0.context: NodeContext: calling out to other goblins after a victory

AD_WarchiefBraveVictory_1.speaker: Rozzak
AD_WarchiefBraveVictory_1.text: Nobody and nothin' can stand in our way.
AD_WarchiefBraveVictory_1.context: NodeContext: Calling out to other goblins after a victorious battle

AD_WarchiefBraveVictory_2.speaker: Rozzak
AD_WarchiefBraveVictory_2.context: NodeContext: calling out to other goblins after a victory

AD_WarchiefBraveVictory_3.speaker: Rozzak
AD_WarchiefBraveVictory_3.context: NodeContext: Celebratory shout to other goblins after a victory - rawl-TOOSH! (Long oo, like soon, not like foot.)

AD_ViolentAtPool_1.speaker: Goblin Sharp-Eye
AD_ViolentAtPool_1.text: Hope not. That'd be kinda weird.

AD_ViolentAtPool_2.speaker: Goblin Sharp-Eye
AD_ViolentAtPool_2.text: Wonder if the Absolute can hear me.

AD_ViolentAtPool_3.speaker: Goblin Sharp-Eye
AD_ViolentAtPool_3.text: Think the gods are seein' this?

Tiefling004_0.speaker: Kaldani
Tiefling004_0.text: If you're looking for something to do, they could probably use a hand down in the cave.

Tiefling004_1.speaker: Kaldani
Tiefling004_1.text: Maybe there's a real chance that we'll get to Baldur's Gate now.
Tiefling004_1.context: InternalNodeContext: Works for Goblin Hunt and Attack On Den victories

Tiefling004_2.speaker: Kaldani
Tiefling004_2.text: When I heard they had a drow... gods, but I can't believe we did it. You did it.

Tiefling004_3.speaker: Kaldani
Tiefling004_3.text: Admiring my beautiful barricades? Might not be pretty, but they'll stop a charging worg.

Tiefling004_5.speaker: Kaldani
Tiefling004_5.text: You took care of the goblins? Nice work.
Tiefling004_5.context: NodeContext: pleased, but not gushing with praise

RobberKid_2.speaker: Meli
RobberKid_2.text: Hope you've picked your last words.
RobberKid_2.context: NodeContext: Snide - child is being a little shit about the prospect that you might die.

RobberKid_6.speaker: Meli
RobberKid_6.text: You can leave your valuables with me if you like.

RobberKid_4.speaker: Meli
RobberKid_4.text: Goblins strip the dead down to the last stitch, so I hear.
RobberKid_4.context: NodeContext: Knowingly, trying to freak player out

RobberKid_11.speaker: Player
RobberKid_11.text: No one's going to die today. I promise.

RobberKid_9.speaker: Meli
RobberKid_9.context: NodeContext: He sighs, as if the player is being unreasonable.

RobberKid_8.speaker: Meli
RobberKid_8.context: NodeContext: All but saying the player's going to die.

RobberKid_7.speaker: Player
RobberKid_7.text: Best pray they don't kill me, then - they'll get you next.

RobberKid_1.speaker: Meli
RobberKid_1.text: So you say - survived Avernus, though. More than you've done.
RobberKid_1.context: NodeContext: Dismissive. Some insane goblins don't scare him.

RobberKid_0.speaker: Player
RobberKid_0.text: If I fall today, my killer will have earned my hide as a ceremonial display.

RobberKid_3.speaker: Meli
RobberKid_3.text: Dunno what that means. But the goblins might think you're on their side - you're ugly enough.
RobberKid_3.context: NodeContext: First line quick, offhand - you're trying to make a grand statement but it's just fancy-talk to him.

RobberKid_10.speaker: Meli
RobberKid_10.text: An actual city, though. Lotta fat arses with full purses in a city.
RobberKid_10.context: NodeContext: Less grumpy, coming around to the idea of getting to Baldur's Gate for the pickings on offer to a thief.

RobberKid_12.speaker: Meli
RobberKid_12.text: Don't know why everyone's cheering. We're just going back on the road.
RobberKid_12.context: NodeContext: Grumpy, sneering at naive adults around him.

AD_HideoutLeaderScolding_3.speaker: Mol
AD_HideoutLeaderScolding_3.text: Can you two help? Anything you don't pack is getting left behind.

AD_HideoutLeaderScolding_1.speaker: Meli
AD_HideoutLeaderScolding_1.text: We can always get more stuff later.

AD_HideoutLeaderScolding_2.speaker: Mol
AD_HideoutLeaderScolding_2.text: You won't get there if we starve on the way. Gonna rob your friends when you're hungry?

ParentB_0.speaker: Komira
ParentB_0.text: I pray next time I square up to a goblin, you're there again.

ParentB_1.speaker: Komira
ParentB_1.text: I'd have let the goblins take me if it meant Arabella lived. Why even fight?

ParentB_2.speaker: Komira
ParentB_2.text: We didn't die today. Tomorrow, perhaps. But not today. Thanks to you.

ParentB_5.speaker: Komira
ParentB_5.text: None of it matters. Not anymore.

ParentB_7.speaker: Komira
ParentB_7.text: I pray Arabella is safe with the other kids. Knowing her, she's fashioned a weapon out of a rock and some string.
ParentB_7.context: NodeContext: She is looking off-camera at her husband. Not addressing the player.

RaiderMurderous_1.speaker: Warrior Rua
RaiderMurderous_1.text: Goblin kids would 'ave put up a better fight.
RaiderMurderous_1.context: NodeContext: malicious - describing a child who tried to fight back during an attack

RaiderMurderous_0.speaker: Warrior Rua
RaiderMurderous_0.text: Killed my first human when I was five years old. Tieflings are soft.
RaiderMurderous_0.context: NodeContext: malicious glee - talking about killing a tiefling child

Refugee002_0.speaker: Danis
Refugee002_0.text: Gods, it seems we might actually make it to the city now. Hope the neighbours are a bit more welcoming.
Refugee002_0.context: NodeContext: Chuckled, rueful - he's making a lighthearted joke about how you've doomed him by saving his life. He's gratefuL.

Refugee002_1.speaker: Danis
Refugee002_1.text: Thank you, truly. You've given us a chance. We'll make good on it.

Refugee002_2.speaker: Danis
Refugee002_2.text: When they see you on the walls, they might just turn and run the other way, eh?
Refugee002_2.context: NodeContext: Nervously making a joke to cover his unease. He's not fooling anyone.

Refugee002_3.speaker: Danis
Refugee002_3.text: I wish I could help on the walls, but... I wasn't a soldier, really. Just a trumped-up guard.

Refugee002_4.speaker: Danis
Refugee002_4.context: NodeContext: He gives up on trying to come up with an excuse - frightened and apologetic.

AD_KidStory_2.speaker: Alfira
AD_KidStory_2.text: ... and over the horizon they saw a ship, like some great beast bursting from the waves.

AD_KidStory_0.speaker: Alfira
AD_KidStory_0.text: The Wandering Eye, the jewel of Balduran's fleet! So named because -
AD_KidStory_0.context: NodeContext: Moment of a story where hero returns

AD_KidStory_1.speaker: Alfira
AD_KidStory_1.text: - well... because Balduran travelled far and... saw much.
AD_KidStory_1.context: NodeContext: Catching herself, realizing children might not understand concept of Wandering Eyes

AD_KidStory_3.speaker: Alfira
AD_KidStory_3.text: But he had finally come home to save the city he loved!

AD_KidStory_5.speaker: Alfira
AD_KidStory_5.text: He drove the raiders away and raised a wall to protect his people.
AD_KidStory_5.context: NodeContext: Happy ending, reassuring them that evil was defeated

AD_KidStory_4.speaker: Alfira
AD_KidStory_4.text: And so they named the city to honour him. Balduran's - Baldur's Gate.

AD_DrowArrives_0.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
AD_DrowArrives_0.text: The True Soul has already begun the slaughter. Break down the gate!
AD_DrowArrives_0.context: NodeContext: Calling out to gathere goblins under her command at the onset of a large battle - 'True Soul' refers to the player who is actively killing tieflings and allied with the drow for now

AD_DrowArrives_1.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
AD_DrowArrives_1.text: The True Soul has already begun the slaughter. Charge!
AD_DrowArrives_1.context: NodeContext: Calling out to gathered goblins under her command at the onset of a large battle - 'True Soul' refers to the player who is actively killing tieflings and allied with the drow for now

BackupLeader_33.speaker: Cerys
BackupLeader_33.text: Beshaba's black bones, I'm too late. You - where's Zevlor?

BackupLeader_27.speaker: Player
BackupLeader_27.text: Dead. He fell defending the grove.

BackupLeader_12.speaker: Cerys
BackupLeader_12.text: I find a clear path to the city, you keep everyone alive long enough to use it. That was the plan.

BackupLeader_17.speaker: Cerys
BackupLeader_17.text: No bloody heroics... But I guess heroics were necessary to survive all of this. Who are you?

BackupLeader_19.speaker: Cerys
BackupLeader_19.text: The saviour Zevlor mentioned in his last message. Well met.

BackupLeader_42.speaker: Cerys
BackupLeader_42.text: I found a path to the city - and with those goblins dead, there'll never be a better time to get on it.

BackupLeader_39.speaker: Cerys
BackupLeader_39.text: But if what Zevlor said of you is true... you have unfinished business out here.

BackupLeader_15.speaker: Player
BackupLeader_15.text: I do. We'll have to part ways here.

BackupLeader_55.speaker: Cerys
BackupLeader_55.text: Should you be heading west, be careful.

BackupLeader_7.speaker: Cerys
BackupLeader_7.text: This new god has a tight grip on Moonrise Towers, and it was a dark place to begin with.

BackupLeader_45.speaker: Cerys
BackupLeader_45.text: We've another road to walk, and it's past time we were on it. Though... I suppose some thanks is in order.

BackupLeader_41.speaker: Cerys
BackupLeader_41.text: Here. It's faint thanks compared to what you've done for us, but it's all we have.
BackupLeader_41.context: CinematicNodeContext: She hands you something off-screen. Not defined.NodeContext: She hands you something off-screen. Not defined.

BackupLeader_61.speaker: Cerys
BackupLeader_61.text: Gods above - that's the druid. Some timing you have, Halsin.

BackupLeader_28.speaker: Cerys
BackupLeader_28.text: Don't fancy being in Kagha's shoes right now. Reckon he'll be happier to speak to you, though.
BackupLeader_28.context: NodeContext: Grimly amused at the reckoning that awaits Kagha when Halsin finds her. Brightening at the thought of how happy Halsin will be to see you

BackupLeader_36.speaker: Cerys
BackupLeader_36.text: Find us when you're done. We'll join your camp and drink to fallen foes tonight - if you'll have us.

BackupLeader_8.speaker: Cerys
BackupLeader_8.text: Go on. He'll want to speak to the one who saved his grove, I expect.

BackupLeader_16.speaker: Cerys
BackupLeader_16.text: My people will join your camp tonight - a farewell, if you'll have us.

BackupLeader_0.speaker: Player
BackupLeader_0.text: I don't have time to celebrate just yet.

BackupLeader_25.speaker: Cerys
BackupLeader_25.text: Right. Just let me know when you're ready.

BackupLeader_58.speaker: Player
BackupLeader_58.text: I prefer to keep my affairs to myself, thanks.

BackupLeader_47.speaker: Cerys
BackupLeader_47.text: As do I. But you've done your part, so I suppose it's time I did mine.

BackupLeader_49.speaker: Cerys
BackupLeader_49.text: One thing - take care to the west. This new god has a tight grip on Moonrise Towers.

BackupLeader_54.speaker: Cerys
BackupLeader_54.text: But if what Asharak said of you is true... you have unfinished business out here.

BackupLeader_23.speaker: Cerys
BackupLeader_23.text: The saviour Asharak mentioned in his last message. Well met.

BackupLeader_40.speaker: Cerys
BackupLeader_40.text: Fair enough - I can see you've bled for us, so I won't prod any further.

BackupLeader_10.speaker: Cerys
BackupLeader_10.text: I take it this business of yours won't keep you with us?

BackupLeader_24.speaker: Player
BackupLeader_24.text: I'd love to stay, but I have more to do out here.

BackupLeader_43.speaker: Player
BackupLeader_43.text: I prefer not to travel with civilians.

BackupLeader_29.speaker: Player
BackupLeader_29.text: Never mind that. Where were you while we fought for our lives?

BackupLeader_1.speaker: Cerys
BackupLeader_1.text: The road to Baldur's Gate. Choked with monsters - or it was.

BackupLeader_3.speaker: Cerys
BackupLeader_3.text: As I was scouting, I found signs of someone clearing them out.

BackupLeader_6.speaker: Player
BackupLeader_6.text: I had business out in the wilds, and no one else was doing anything.

BackupLeader_32.speaker: Player
BackupLeader_32.text: Rotting with the rest of the corpses, I expect.

BackupLeader_51.speaker: Player
BackupLeader_51.text: I lost track of him in the battle.

BackupLeader_18.speaker: Cerys
BackupLeader_18.text: No point spreading honey on dung - he's dead. Godsdammit, Zevlor.

BackupLeader_62.speaker: Cerys
BackupLeader_62.text: No point spreading honey on dung - he's dead. Godsdammit, Asharak.

BackupLeader_30.speaker: Player
BackupLeader_30.text: Being judged by Kelemvor as we speak. I hope he's not found wanting.

BackupLeader_21.speaker: Cerys
BackupLeader_21.text: Trust a priest not to say it plain - he's dead, then. Gods damn it, Zevlor.

BackupLeader_52.speaker: Cerys
BackupLeader_52.text: Trust a priest not to say it plain - he's dead, then. Godsdammit, Asharak.

BackupLeader_53.speaker: Cerys
BackupLeader_53.text: Ah - there you are. No, we haven't met - but I know your work.
BackupLeader_53.context: NodeContext: Wry, distant - she wants to speak with you but also resents you a little (Though she knows it's unfair)

BackupLeader_13.speaker: Cerys
BackupLeader_13.text: Came back to report some lunatic had cleared out the goblin leaders - only to find Zevlor'd gone the same way.
BackupLeader_13.context: NodeContext: Amused at the irony, but really just covering sadness with grim pragmatism

BackupLeader_56.speaker: Cerys
BackupLeader_56.text: He was supposed to play chaperone with this lot, not me. But - moaning won't make the road ahead shorter, I suppose.
BackupLeader_56.context: NodeContext: Wry, vaguely bitter - as if Zevlor shirked left her with a task she'd rather not have to do.

BackupLeader_59.speaker: Cerys
BackupLeader_59.text: Here. It's faint thanks compared to what you've done for us, but it's all we have.
BackupLeader_59.context: CinematicNodeContext: She hands you something off-screen. Not defined.NodeContext: She hands you something off-screen. Not defined.

BackupLeader_20.speaker: Cerys
BackupLeader_20.text: Great big druid strolled in, too. Halsin - reckon he'll want a word with you. Once he's done with Kagha, anyway. When you're free...
BackupLeader_20.context: NodeContext: Grimly amused - she wouldn't want to be in Kagha's shoes as Halsin's going to take her to task for the harm she caused at the grove. The 'when you're done' leads to her mentioning she and her followers will join your camp to celebrate.

BackupLeader_26.speaker: Cerys
BackupLeader_26.text: Great big druid strolled in, too. Halsin - reckon he'll want a word with you. When you're done...
BackupLeader_26.context: NodeContext: Just recalling. The 'when you're done' leads to her suggesting the tieflings join your camp for a celebration

BackupLeader_57.speaker: Cerys
BackupLeader_57.text: Beshaba's black bones, I'm too late. You - where's Asharak?

AD_HideoutLeaderSighing_0.speaker: Mol
AD_HideoutLeaderSighing_0.text: Some dumb fairy tale is all we have left...

Sapper_004_0.speaker: Sapper Gald
Sapper_004_0.context: NodeContext: smug - just massacred some tieflings

RitualDruid005_0.speaker: Tahan
RitualDruid005_0.text: Every drop of druid blood is on your hands. Remember that.
RitualDruid005_0.context: NodeContext: She blames both players and the tieflings in the grove for causing trouble.

RitualDruid005_2.speaker: Tahan
RitualDruid005_2.text: I'm not singing your praises. You and the tieflings brought violence to this place.
RitualDruid005_2.context: NodeContext: Coolly. She blames both players and the tieflings in the grove for causing trouble.

RitualDruid005_1.speaker: Tahan
RitualDruid005_1.text: It wasn't our fight. You dragged us into it.
RitualDruid005_1.context: NodeContext: She's accusing the player, pointing at them. She blames both players and the tieflings in the grove for causing trouble.

TrainerVictory_7.speaker: Asharak
TrainerVictory_7.text: They call you outcasts. Hellspawn. Foulblood.

TrainerVictory_11.speaker: Asharak
TrainerVictory_11.text: But take a look out there, and tell me whose blood is staining the rocks.

TrainerVictory_2.speaker: Asharak
TrainerVictory_2.text: So I've got another name for you. Nothing so grand as warriors, or heroes. Something better.

TrainerVictory_5.speaker: Asharak
TrainerVictory_5.text: You're bloody survivors. It's a long road yet to Baldur's Gate, but I'm not worried.

TrainerVictory_15.speaker: Asharak
TrainerVictory_15.text: Because you know who you are, now - what you can do.

TrainerVictory_8.speaker: Asharak
TrainerVictory_8.text: I'll leave the worrying to whatever god or mortal is dumb enough to stand in your way.

TrainerVictory_13.speaker: Asharak
TrainerVictory_13.text: You. I don't have the words or the means to thank you for what you did here.

TrainerVictory_9.speaker: Asharak
TrainerVictory_9.text: But it won't be for want of trying - know that you have kin in Baldur's Gate.

TrainerVictory_0.speaker: Asharak
TrainerVictory_0.text: Gods, I'm inclined to carry you there myself - but I know you've unfinished business out here.

TrainerVictory_10.speaker: Asharak
TrainerVictory_10.text: If you're inclined, we'll join you at your camp. I mean to drink you under the table.

TrainerVictory_6.context: CinematicNodeContext: Cinematic of Halsin approaching the gate, Zevlor spotting him

TrainerVictory_12.speaker: Asharak
TrainerVictory_12.text: Gods above, is that... Halsin? After everything, he appears just before the party. Wish I had his timing.
TrainerVictory_12.context: NodeContext: Mute astonishment - someone they all thought long dead has just appeared. Wry amusement at the end, still a bit shocked.

TrainerVictory_14.speaker: Asharak
TrainerVictory_14.text: Wouldn't like to be in Kagha's shoes about now - but he'll have kinder words for you, I wager.

TrainerVictory_1.speaker: Asharak
TrainerVictory_1.text: Find us once you're done. Twice the reason to celebrate now, eh?

TrainerVictory_16.speaker: Asharak
TrainerVictory_16.text: Go on, you'd best go down and... explain. Better you than me.
TrainerVictory_16.context: NodeContext: Gently urging you on - someone has to be catch Halsin up on what happened, and he's probably not going to like it

TrainerVictory_4.speaker: Asharak
TrainerVictory_4.text: Gather your people and I'll gather mine. We can leave together, when you're ready.

GrieflingFriend_3.speaker: Memnos
GrieflingFriend_3.text: You'd do better to find somewhere safe than wasting your time on me.

GrieflingFriend_13.speaker: Memnos
GrieflingFriend_13.text: 'Lathander to light, Selûne to guide, Kelemvor to show mercy -'
GrieflingFriend_13.context: NodeContext: Praying to himself. Interrupted by the player

GrieflingFriend_41.speaker: Narrator
GrieflingFriend_41.text: *You recognise Kelemvor, the Lord of Death. The tiefling thinks he will die soon.*

GrieflingFriend_14.speaker: Memnos
GrieflingFriend_14.text: You've solved one problem for us. Guess it's on us to solve the next.

GrieflingFriend_15.speaker: Memnos
GrieflingFriend_15.text: 'Lathander to light, Selûne to guide, Kelemvor to show mercy -'

GrieflingFriend_8.speaker: Narrator
GrieflingFriend_8.text: *You realise he prays to Kelemvor, Lord of Death.*

GrieflingFriend_60.speaker: Memnos
GrieflingFriend_60.text: What is it? I'm... I'm busy.

GrieflingFriend_16.speaker: Player
GrieflingFriend_16.text: Mind if I join you in prayer?

GrieflingFriend_0.speaker: Memnos
GrieflingFriend_0.text: I do mind. This isn't exactly my bravest moment; I'd rather suffer it alone.

GrieflingFriend_47.speaker: Lae'zel
GrieflingFriend_47.text: I knew I smelled the stink of cowardice.

GrieflingFriend_11.speaker: Player
GrieflingFriend_11.text: Kelemvor judges cowards more harshly than others. Better if you die in combat.

GrieflingFriend_51.speaker: Player
GrieflingFriend_51.text: Better if you die in combat then live on as a coward.

GrieflingFriend_22.speaker: Memnos
GrieflingFriend_22.text: Mrag. Of course I'm going to die... but I might as well get my hands dirty before that.
GrieflingFriend_22.context: NodeContext: Mrag pronounced mRAG (meaning 'shit' in the tiefling language).

GrieflingFriend_33.speaker: Memnos
GrieflingFriend_33.context: NodeContext: A little more resolve than before

GrieflingFriend_6.speaker: Memnos
GrieflingFriend_6.text: Oh, I'll die today. That much I'm sure of. But I'll do it here, on my own terms. Leave me.

GrieflingFriend_56.speaker: Player
GrieflingFriend_56.text: I'll kill you myself if you don't grab a weapon and join the line.

GrieflingFriend_45.speaker: Memnos
GrieflingFriend_45.text: Mrag. Who needs goblins to be afraid of when we've you for company?
GrieflingFriend_45.context: NodeContext: Mrag pronounced mRAG (meaning 'shit' in the tiefling language).

GrieflingFriend_30.speaker: Memnos
GrieflingFriend_30.text: Fine. I'll see what I can do. It won't be much - trust me.
GrieflingFriend_30.context: NodeContext: He's been convinced to help the defences

GrieflingFriend_53.speaker: Memnos
GrieflingFriend_53.text: There's a horde coming for us all. Do you really think I care about your threats?

GrieflingFriend_25.speaker: Memnos
GrieflingFriend_25.text: Leave me spend my final moments how I want.
GrieflingFriend_25.context: NodeContext: mragreshem = infernal language equivalent of 'shithead'. Pronounced m-rag-RESH-em

GrieflingFriend_36.speaker: Memnos
GrieflingFriend_36.text: Crazy fool! Are you in a rush to see us all dead?!

GrieflingFriend_7.speaker: Player
GrieflingFriend_7.text: You have to try. We need every able body, or we're doomed.

GrieflingFriend_10.speaker: Memnos
GrieflingFriend_10.text: Damn you... fine. I'll see what I can do. Maybe I'll manage to take a goblin down with me.
GrieflingFriend_10.context: NodeContext: He's been convinced to help the defences

GrieflingFriend_27.speaker: Memnos
GrieflingFriend_27.text: We're doomed either way. Best to stop struggling and hope the end's swift.

GrieflingFriend_52.speaker: Player
GrieflingFriend_52.text: Songs will be sung for today's heroes. Do your part, and your name will live on.

GrieflingFriend_2.speaker: Memnos
GrieflingFriend_2.text: Mrag. I'd like to see 'Memnos' rhyme in some heroic verse. Fine. I'll help.

GrieflingFriend_73.speaker: Memnos
GrieflingFriend_73.text: I don't care about my blasted name. The dead don't need compliments from the living. Leave me alone.

GrieflingFriend_57.speaker: Player
GrieflingFriend_57.text: Every fighter was once a novice. Better that than a victim.

GrieflingFriend_75.speaker: Player
GrieflingFriend_75.text: My god abhors cowards. If you do nothing, your fate is sealed in his eyes.

GrieflingFriend_9.speaker: Memnos
GrieflingFriend_9.text: Damned either way then... but at least I can go out with a weapon in my hand. All right. I'll do what I can.
GrieflingFriend_9.context: NodeContext: Reluctantly getting over his fears and agreeing to fight.

GrieflingFriend_26.speaker: Memnos
GrieflingFriend_26.text: Why, because I'm not sharpening steel or strutting on the wall?

GrieflingFriend_4.speaker: Player
GrieflingFriend_4.text: Prayers can wait - you're needed to help with the defences.

GrieflingFriend_63.speaker: Memnos
GrieflingFriend_63.text: I can pray a lot better than I can use a bow or a sword.

GrieflingFriend_5.speaker: Player
GrieflingFriend_5.text: Why are you praying to the god of the dead?

GrieflingFriend_23.speaker: Memnos
GrieflingFriend_23.text: Well, seems like I'll be facing him before long. All of us will.

GrieflingFriend_48.speaker: Player
GrieflingFriend_48.text: Kelemvor's judgement is always fair. You're wasting your time trying to curry his favour.

GrieflingFriend_66.speaker: Memnos
GrieflingFriend_66.text: Prayer's all I've got right now. And best to pray to the god I'm liable to meet soon.

GrieflingFriend_28.speaker: Memnos
GrieflingFriend_28.text: This is a beautiful place - and I can't bloody wait to be free of it.

GrieflingFriend_32.speaker: Memnos
GrieflingFriend_32.text: I doubt I'd still be drawing breath without your help. Thank you.

GrieflingFriend_38.speaker: Memnos
GrieflingFriend_38.text: We won. I'd like to think Arka died happy, but... well. Perhaps now she's at peace.
GrieflingFriend_38.context: NodeContext: confused that he enjoyed killing goblins so much - think of him staring at her bloody hands

GrieflingFriend_39.speaker: Memnos
GrieflingFriend_39.text: Spare me your empty threats and go away, mragreshem.
GrieflingFriend_39.context: NodeContext: mragreshem = infernal language equivalent of 'shithead'. Pronounced m-rag-RESH-em

GrieflingFriend_54.speaker: Memnos
GrieflingFriend_54.text: We... we actually did it. We thrashed the lot of them!
GrieflingFriend_54.context: NodeContext: confused that he enjoyed killing goblins so much - think of him staring at her bloody hands

GrieflingFriend_62.speaker: Memnos
GrieflingFriend_62.text: Thank you, for talking some sense into me. I'll do my best when the fighting starts.
GrieflingFriend_62.context: NodeContext: trying to stay calm, but scared

GrieflingFriend_69.speaker: Memnos
GrieflingFriend_69.text: 'Kelemvor to judge kindly, Helm to protect -'
GrieflingFriend_69.context: NodeContext: Praying to himself. Interrupted by the player

GrieflingFriend_78.speaker: Memnos
GrieflingFriend_78.text: Please, leave me be. I said I was busy.

GrieflingFriend_76.speaker: Memnos
GrieflingFriend_76.text: Can't you just leave me be? This is my last moment of peace.
GrieflingFriend_76.context: NodeContext: Just wants to curl up and hide

GrieflingFriend_77.speaker: Memnos
GrieflingFriend_77.text: Don't... don't say any words over her. Arka wouldn't want that.

HalsinAndDruidLeader_62.speaker: Halsin
HalsinAndDruidLeader_62.text: You took it upon yourself to undertake the Rite of Thorns? To spill blood in this sacred place?
HalsinAndDruidLeader_62.context: NodeContext: Reading the riot act to Kagha

HalsinAndDruidLeader_18.speaker: Halsin
HalsinAndDruidLeader_18.text: It would have been easier if you just died, Kagha. Now I have to hear your excuses instead.

HalsinAndDruidLeader_30.speaker: Kagha
HalsinAndDruidLeader_30.text: An error most grave, Master. I beg your grace.

HalsinAndDruidLeader_19.speaker: Halsin
HalsinAndDruidLeader_19.text: Grace is bestowed by nature, not me.

HalsinAndDruidLeader_1.speaker: Halsin
HalsinAndDruidLeader_1.text: You will stay, as a novice anew. You have forgotten the ways of the druids, the natural order of things.

HalsinAndDruidLeader_84.speaker: Halsin
HalsinAndDruidLeader_84.text: It is up to you to prove the lessons have been learned once more.
HalsinAndDruidLeader_84.context: NodeContext: 'I hope you've learned your lesson'

HalsinAndDruidLeader_6.speaker: Kagha
HalsinAndDruidLeader_6.text: So as you say, and so it is done, Master.
HalsinAndDruidLeader_6.context: CinematicNodeContext: Bows and steps back from HalsinNodeContext: Kagha accepts her punishment offers a slight bow and retreats from Halsin

HalsinAndDruidLeader_20.speaker: Player
HalsinAndDruidLeader_20.text: Are you mad? Kagha's a traitor.

HalsinAndDruidLeader_31.speaker: Halsin
HalsinAndDruidLeader_31.text: A dreadful misdeed - one she will never live down. But the grove still needs her passion.
HalsinAndDruidLeader_31.context: NodeContext: Explaining his reasoning to the player

HalsinAndDruidLeader_63.speaker: Kagha
HalsinAndDruidLeader_63.text: It was an accident! She stole the idol - we were overzealous, yes, but -

HalsinAndDruidLeader_23.speaker: Halsin
HalsinAndDruidLeader_23.text: There is no we. You were the driving force behind this madness. Now it stops.

HalsinAndDruidLeader_88.speaker: Halsin
HalsinAndDruidLeader_88.text: As for the idol? It's nothing compared to a life. A mere object, next to one of nature's creations.

HalsinAndDruidLeader_48.speaker: Halsin
HalsinAndDruidLeader_48.text: I cannot absolve you, even if you are repentant.

HalsinAndDruidLeader_40.speaker: Halsin
HalsinAndDruidLeader_40.text: The girl's parents should have decided your fate, but they perished. Instead, nature will judge you.

HalsinAndDruidLeader_85.speaker: Halsin
HalsinAndDruidLeader_85.text: You are banished from this place - banished from everywhere the Oak Father's creations thrive.

HalsinAndDruidLeader_70.speaker: Halsin
HalsinAndDruidLeader_70.text: You are an enemy of nature, to be shunned until you redeem yourself or die. Now go.

HalsinAndDruidLeader_38.speaker: Halsin
HalsinAndDruidLeader_38.text: You are an enemy of nature, to be shunned until you redeem yourself or die. Now go.

HalsinAndDruidLeader_78.context: CinematicNodeContext: Kagha slinks away after Halsin condemns her, He watches her go, before acknowledging the player, his temper softening.

HalsinAndDruidLeader_43.speaker: Halsin
HalsinAndDruidLeader_43.text: Apologies for that ugliness. A more bitter homecoming than I would have wished, but at least the grove stands, thanks to you.

HalsinAndDruidLeader_36.speaker: Player
HalsinAndDruidLeader_36.text: Kagha had that coming to her. Well done.

HalsinAndDruidLeader_7.speaker: Halsin
HalsinAndDruidLeader_7.text: Well done? No... this shouldn't have been necessary in the first place. I failed.

HalsinAndDruidLeader_44.speaker: Halsin
HalsinAndDruidLeader_44.text: Consider it in the past now. We must look forward.

HalsinAndDruidLeader_4.speaker: Halsin
HalsinAndDruidLeader_4.text: The grove stands. Nature prevails. I owe you my thanks - and an introduction.

HalsinAndDruidLeader_60.speaker: Halsin
HalsinAndDruidLeader_60.text: I am Halsin - First Druid of the Emerald Grove... and I sense you have a problem you seek my help with.
HalsinAndDruidLeader_60.context: NodeContext: Knowing - referring to the player's tadpole problem

HalsinAndDruidLeader_27.speaker: Player
HalsinAndDruidLeader_27.text: Yes. I have a mind flayer parasite inside my head. I want your help removing it.

HalsinAndDruidLeader_107.context: CinematicNodeContext: Halsin raises a hand to your head, magically connecting with you (no contact). He gives an alarmed look - he knows what’s inside you

HalsinAndDruidLeader_95.speaker: Halsin
HalsinAndDruidLeader_95.text: ...That problem. You're infected with the mind flayer spawn, aren't you? Oak Father preserve you, child.

HalsinAndDruidLeader_59.speaker: Halsin
HalsinAndDruidLeader_59.text: ...It's true. I can feel it right now. Oak Father preserve you, child.

HalsinAndDruidLeader_87.speaker: Halsin
HalsinAndDruidLeader_87.text: But... something's different. You're aware of the monster inside you. You don't bow to the Absolute, like the True Souls do...

HalsinAndDruidLeader_24.speaker: Player
HalsinAndDruidLeader_24.text: I escaped from an illithid ship after being infected. Maybe the process was interrupted.

HalsinAndDruidLeader_15.speaker: Halsin
HalsinAndDruidLeader_15.text: Perhaps... but I wouldn't want to place all my faith in blind luck.

HalsinAndDruidLeader_76.speaker: Halsin
HalsinAndDruidLeader_76.text: It's no coincidence that we found each other, I'll wager? You're after a cure for this parasite.

HalsinAndDruidLeader_73.speaker: Halsin
HalsinAndDruidLeader_73.text: Someone is using very powerful magic to modify these tadpoles. They are using them to exert control over the infected.

HalsinAndDruidLeader_11.speaker: Halsin
HalsinAndDruidLeader_11.text: I'm sorry to say, I can't undo that magic. I can't cure you. But that doesn't mean I can't help.

HalsinAndDruidLeader_79.speaker: Halsin
HalsinAndDruidLeader_79.text: At the goblin camp, I hoped to find a way to remove the tadpoles. I failed - but I did find the next best thing. I found out where they come from.

HalsinAndDruidLeader_103.speaker: Halsin
HalsinAndDruidLeader_103.text: I will do what I can to help you. Let us speak tomorrow - you and I both have matters to see to first.
HalsinAndDruidLeader_103.context: NodeContext: 'I'll help - but not quite yet'

HalsinAndDruidLeader_8.speaker: Halsin
HalsinAndDruidLeader_8.text: As for what you've done for the grove, speak to Rath. He will see to your reward.

HalsinAndDruidLeader_65.speaker: Player
HalsinAndDruidLeader_65.text: I don't know what you mean. What problem?

HalsinAndDruidLeader_77.speaker: Player
HalsinAndDruidLeader_77.text: Wait - how did you get here?

HalsinAndDruidLeader_91.speaker: Halsin
HalsinAndDruidLeader_91.text: I was an unwilling guest of the goblins - but your efforts left them in disarray and I was able to escape.

HalsinAndDruidLeader_53.speaker: Halsin
HalsinAndDruidLeader_53.text: The grove stands. Nature prevails. And again, I am in your debt.

HalsinAndDruidLeader_68.speaker: Halsin
HalsinAndDruidLeader_68.text: Speak to Rath - he will reward you for your efforts.
HalsinAndDruidLeader_68.context: NodeContext: Referring to one of his underlings

HalsinAndDruidLeader_50.speaker: Player
HalsinAndDruidLeader_50.text: What about my problem? I need help.

HalsinAndDruidLeader_89.speaker: Halsin
HalsinAndDruidLeader_89.text: Soon. Remember the dangers I told you about - there'll be plenty of time to face them.

HalsinAndDruidLeader_75.speaker: Halsin
HalsinAndDruidLeader_75.text: Take tonight to rest, recuperate - celebrate. Tomorrow, we can strike out.

HalsinAndDruidLeader_52.speaker: Halsin
HalsinAndDruidLeader_52.text: Take tonight to rest, recuperate -celebrate. Tomorrow, I'll join your camp so I can help with the trials yet to come.

HalsinAndDruidLeader_57.speaker: Halsin
HalsinAndDruidLeader_57.text: Tomorrow morning, we shall discuss what is to come.
HalsinAndDruidLeader_57.context: NodeContext: This is a much anticipated converation that he's aluding to.

HalsinAndDruidLeader_2.speaker: Player
HalsinAndDruidLeader_2.text: I hope this grove of yours is worth the bloodshed.

HalsinAndDruidLeader_12.speaker: Player
HalsinAndDruidLeader_12.text: I hope this grove of yours was worth the bloodshed.

HalsinAndDruidLeader_61.speaker: Halsin
HalsinAndDruidLeader_61.text: Believe me, it is. The span of a mortal life isn't enough to grasp the importance of this place. Its roots touch everything.

HalsinAndDruidLeader_99.speaker: Halsin
HalsinAndDruidLeader_99.text: The journey to Moonrise Towers, and all the dangers that that entails.

HalsinAndDruidLeader_98.speaker: Halsin
HalsinAndDruidLeader_98.text: But that's tomorrow's problem. Take some time for yourself tonight - rest, celebrate. Come morning, I'll be by your side.

HalsinAndDruidLeader_0.speaker: Halsin
HalsinAndDruidLeader_0.text: Rest. Heal. Celebrate if you wish. Mourn if you must. Come morning, we shall discuss delivering you from your parasite.
HalsinAndDruidLeader_0.context: NodeContext: 'We've been through a lot. Take some time to gather yourself'

HalsinAndDruidLeader_45.speaker: Player
HalsinAndDruidLeader_45.text: I watched that child die because of her. She deserved far worse than that.

HalsinAndDruidLeader_14.speaker: Player
HalsinAndDruidLeader_14.text: A child died because of her? She deserved far worse than that.

HalsinAndDruidLeader_83.speaker: Halsin
HalsinAndDruidLeader_83.text: Her punishment is only just beginning, trust me.

HalsinAndDruidLeader_21.speaker: Player
HalsinAndDruidLeader_21.text: You overreacted. The child's death was an accident.

HalsinAndDruidLeader_86.speaker: Halsin
HalsinAndDruidLeader_86.text: Please. Don't sully the gratitude I feel towards you by making excuses for Kagha. My choice was clear.

HalsinAndDruidLeader_90.speaker: Player
HalsinAndDruidLeader_90.text: Neither of us saw what happened before - maybe the child's death wasn't her fault.

HalsinAndDruidLeader_16.speaker: Halsin
HalsinAndDruidLeader_16.text: Nature will determine your fate - whatever happens to you next, know that it is the Oak Father's will.

HalsinAndDruidLeader_101.speaker: Halsin
HalsinAndDruidLeader_101.text: Now get out of my sight. There is nothing more to be said.

HalsinAndDruidLeader_102.speaker: Halsin
HalsinAndDruidLeader_102.text: Now get out of my sight. There is nothing more to be said.
