HalsinAndDruidLeader_22.speaker: Kagha
HalsinAndDruidLeader_22.text: I owe you nothing. Goblins swarmed us like roaches while you stumbled after the past.

HalsinAndDruidLeader_82.speaker: Kagha
HalsinAndDruidLeader_82.text: You chose to abandon us. I chose to protect us!

HalsinAndDruidLeader_72.speaker: Halsin
HalsinAndDruidLeader_72.text: Silence. The rite has been ended.
HalsinAndDruidLeader_72.context: NodeContext: Forceful. He's heard enough from her.

HalsinAndDruidLeader_25.speaker: Halsin
HalsinAndDruidLeader_25.text: I will allow you to stay. But consider yourself a novice anew. You have forgotten the ways of the druids - our place in the natural order.

HalsinAndDruidLeader_69.speaker: Halsin
HalsinAndDruidLeader_69.text: You shall learn it all once again, right here. Backslide, and nature's fury will crush you.

HalsinAndDruidLeader_10.speaker: Kagha
HalsinAndDruidLeader_10.context: CinematicNodeContext: She gives a reluctant bow and retreats from HalsinNodeContext: Not happy. Said through clenched teeth. She gives a reluctant bow and retreats from Halsin

HalsinAndDruidLeader_74.speaker: Player
HalsinAndDruidLeader_74.text: That's all? She tried to imprison a child.

HalsinAndDruidLeader_100.speaker: Halsin
HalsinAndDruidLeader_100.text: A misjudgement - one that should weigh heavily upon her. But the grove still needs her passion.
HalsinAndDruidLeader_100.context: NodeContext: Explaining his reasoning to the player

HalsinAndDruidLeader_94.speaker: Player
HalsinAndDruidLeader_94.text: You'll have your hands full with her. She shows great spirit, to put it mildly.

HalsinAndDruidLeader_105.speaker: Halsin
HalsinAndDruidLeader_105.text: She shows great insolence. But time will humble her - and the grove still needs her.
HalsinAndDruidLeader_105.context: NodeContext: 'I'll make a druid of Kagha yet'

HalsinAndDruidLeader_33.speaker: Player
HalsinAndDruidLeader_33.text: No need to be so harsh. Kagha acted out of concern.

HalsinAndDruidLeader_5.speaker: Halsin
HalsinAndDruidLeader_5.text: Misplaced, self-important concern. She must learn to respect the balance of all things. But the grove still needs her.
HalsinAndDruidLeader_5.context: NodeContext: Explaining his lenient treatment of Kagha

HalsinAndDruidLeader_51.speaker: Halsin
HalsinAndDruidLeader_51.text: You will soon see why. But enough of that for now - I owe you my thanks.
HalsinAndDruidLeader_51.context: NodeContext: There's a little foreboding hidden in these phrases. A lot hinges on what he'll tell us tomorrow.

HalsinAndDruidLeader_46.speaker: Player
HalsinAndDruidLeader_46.text: Such mercy is a show of weakness. You're tainting a hard-won victory.

HalsinAndDruidLeader_42.speaker: Halsin
HalsinAndDruidLeader_42.text: No doubt you'd have me flay her or cast her into a spiked pit. But the grove needs druids.
HalsinAndDruidLeader_42.context: NodeContext: Explaining his lenient treatment of Kagha

HalsinAndDruidLeader_92.speaker: Player
HalsinAndDruidLeader_92.text: The fire of ambition is in her very blood - and cruel blood is a life companion.

HalsinAndDruidLeader_66.speaker: Halsin
HalsinAndDruidLeader_66.text: There is naught a clear and meditative mind cannot overcome. After we stray, we return to the fold, having learnt to do better. And in the fold, Kagha is needed.

HalsinAndDruidLeader_34.speaker: Player
HalsinAndDruidLeader_34.text: You were too lenient. There's bad blood between tieflings and druids because of her.

HalsinAndDruidLeader_81.speaker: Halsin
HalsinAndDruidLeader_81.text: Spilled blood will not right bad blood. Allow me to deal with my own - I still have need of her.
HalsinAndDruidLeader_81.context: NodeContext: Explaining his lenient treatment of Kagha

HalsinAndDruidLeader_96.speaker: Player
HalsinAndDruidLeader_96.text: You should turn her over to my kin for judgement. Bad blood still lingers.

HalsinAndDruidLeader_9.speaker: Player
HalsinAndDruidLeader_9.text: Is such mercy wise? She's strayed from your teachings once already.

HalsinAndDruidLeader_26.speaker: Halsin
HalsinAndDruidLeader_26.text: She knows now what cavorting in the shadows brings her. She will not stray again. Besides, this is no time to lose a promising druid.
HalsinAndDruidLeader_26.context: NodeContext: Explaining his lenient treatment of Kagha

HalsinAndDruidLeader_47.speaker: Player
HalsinAndDruidLeader_47.text: Kagha was not acting on her own - she was under the influence of Shadow Druids.

HalsinAndDruidLeader_29.speaker: Halsin
HalsinAndDruidLeader_29.text: I was going to show leniency, but Kagha... a child is dead because of you.

HalsinAndDruidLeader_54.speaker: Kagha
HalsinAndDruidLeader_54.text: A thief is dead - she stole the idol, befouled the grove!

HalsinAndDruidLeader_37.speaker: Halsin
HalsinAndDruidLeader_37.text: Enough. If anyone befouled this place, it is you - by sowing division, hatred - death.

HalsinAndDruidLeader_17.speaker: Halsin
HalsinAndDruidLeader_17.text: You show no pity, no remorse. I cannot absolve you.

HalsinAndDruidLeader_71.speaker: Halsin
HalsinAndDruidLeader_71.text: You took it upon yourself to undertake the Rite of Thorns? I ought to exile you from this place. Forever.
HalsinAndDruidLeader_71.context: NodeContext: Reading the riot act to Kagha

HalsinAndDruidLeader_93.speaker: Halsin
HalsinAndDruidLeader_93.text: Instead, I shall listen to the explanation that you owe me.
HalsinAndDruidLeader_93.context: NodeContext: 'I'm going to give you a chance to say your piece'

Pickpocket_0.speaker: Silfy
Pickpocket_0.text: Mattis says we should say thank you.
Pickpocket_0.context: NodeContext: Shy, not understanding that they almost died

Pickpocket_1.speaker: Silfy
Pickpocket_1.text: Sshhh - you have to be quiet.
Pickpocket_1.context: NodeContext: Helpful but serious - player's breaking the rules.

Pickpocket_2.speaker: Silfy
Pickpocket_2.text: Don't worry - Mattis says the goblins can't get inside if we're quiet.
Pickpocket_2.context: NodeContext: Innocent, danger is a game to her

RaidersArriveBeforeFight_15.context: CinematicNodeContext: ~Minthara steps up on the stone tower outside the gate to the Druid Grove, she assumes her imposing posture, arms at her back, she locks gaze with the player

RaidersArriveBeforeFight_57.speaker: Asharak
RaidersArriveBeforeFight_57.text: If I don't see you after the battle... tell the children I took out the drow.
RaidersArriveBeforeFight_57.context: NodeContext:  last phrase is delivered with a grim smile - if he doesn't see us, it's because he'll be dead

RaidersArriveBeforeFight_43.speaker: Zevlor
RaidersArriveBeforeFight_43.text: This is it. Everything turns on this.

RaidersArriveBeforeFight_44.context: CinematicNodeContext: ~The archer nocks another arrow, when the army arrives beneath Minthara and lowers the bow to watch

RaidersArriveBeforeFight_45.speaker: Asharak
RaidersArriveBeforeFight_45.text: This is it, people. Weapons ready, eyes to the front.
RaidersArriveBeforeFight_45.context: NodeContext: Addressing the defenders gathered at the gates before an attack - inspirational speech. Think beginning of Helm's Deep

RaidersArriveBeforeFight_38.speaker: Asharak
RaidersArriveBeforeFight_38.text: Anyone who takes down a worg gets their choice of cut tonight...
RaidersArriveBeforeFight_38.context: NodeContext: Addressing the defenders gathered at the gates before an attack - inspirational speech. Think beginning of Helm's Deep

RaidersArriveBeforeFight_42.speaker: Asharak
RaidersArriveBeforeFight_42.text: By Amaunator's Eternal Sun, none of us are dying today!
RaidersArriveBeforeFight_42.context: NodeContext: Addressing the defenders gathered at the gates before an attack - inspirational speech. Think beginning of Helm's Deep

RaidersArriveBeforeFight_29.speaker: Zevlor
RaidersArriveBeforeFight_29.text: I know that you are all afraid... but I also know that you have been fighting your whole lives.
RaidersArriveBeforeFight_29.context: NodeContext: Addressing the defenders gathered at the gates before an attack - inspirational speech. Think beginning of Helm's Deep

RaidersArriveBeforeFight_10.speaker: Zevlor
RaidersArriveBeforeFight_10.text: We have never been handed the easy choices, or the gentle paths. And this is no different.
RaidersArriveBeforeFight_10.context: NodeContext: Addressing the defenders gathered at the gates before an attack - inspirational speech. Think beginning of Helm's Deep

RaidersArriveBeforeFight_26.speaker: Zevlor
RaidersArriveBeforeFight_26.text: These creatures would take our lives, our children... our future. And we must resist!
RaidersArriveBeforeFight_26.context: NodeContext: Addressing the defenders gathered at the gates before an attack - inspirational speech. Think beginning of Helm's Deep

RaidersArriveBeforeFight_46.speaker: Narrator
RaidersArriveBeforeFight_46.text: *A splinter of ice works its way into your mind.*

RaidersArriveBeforeFight_52.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
RaidersArriveBeforeFight_52.text: A pretty speech. It almost brings a tear to my eye.
RaidersArriveBeforeFight_52.context: CinematicNodeContext: ~Mindmeld [reuse]NodeContext: amused, referring to the tiefling leaders inspiring speech to the defenders but talking to the player

RaidersArriveBeforeFight_2.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
RaidersArriveBeforeFight_2.text: Now slit his throat, and open that gate. The Absolute wants all of them dead.
RaidersArriveBeforeFight_2.context: CinematicNodeContext: ~Mindmeld [reuse]NodeContext: simple, to the point - killing is a very ordinary thing to her

RaidersArriveBeforeFight_39.context: CinematicNodeContext: ~The player steps in an opens the gate [Reuse from Plea]

RaidersArriveBeforeFight_41.speaker: Wyll
RaidersArriveBeforeFight_41.text: Traitor! The Blade now comes for you.

RaidersArriveBeforeFight_34.speaker: Asharak
RaidersArriveBeforeFight_34.context: NodeContext: dawning horror - he's doomed and the players have betrayed him

RaidersArriveBeforeFight_0.speaker: Asharak
RaidersArriveBeforeFight_0.text: You're siding with that monster against your own people?
RaidersArriveBeforeFight_0.context: NodeContext: this is a horrible, terrible no-good realisation. He's taken aback by how bad things are right now. He's going to die

RaidersArriveBeforeFight_20.speaker: Asharak
RaidersArriveBeforeFight_20.context: NodeContext: furious; the players just betrayed him and are going to kill the people he swore to protect

RaidersArriveBeforeFight_62.speaker: Zevlor
RaidersArriveBeforeFight_62.context: NodeContext: despairing, the players have just betrayed him and doomed the people he swore to protect

RaidersArriveBeforeFight_31.speaker: Player
RaidersArriveBeforeFight_31.text: At least you'll die before the goblins find the children.

RaidersArriveBeforeFight_64.speaker: Asharak
RaidersArriveBeforeFight_64.context: NodeContext: furious, lots of venom on that 'monster'

RaidersArriveBeforeFight_49.speaker: Zevlor
RaidersArriveBeforeFight_49.context: NodeContext: can't believe how awful we are - we just told him we're going to massacre the children he's been protecting

RaidersArriveBeforeFight_7.speaker: Player
RaidersArriveBeforeFight_7.text: I'm truly sorry. I need healing - and the drow and her god are my best chance.

RaidersArriveBeforeFight_24.speaker: Asharak
RaidersArriveBeforeFight_24.context: NodeContext: furious, shocked - 'impspit' delivered as a strong swear

RaidersArriveBeforeFight_21.speaker: Zevlor
RaidersArriveBeforeFight_21.text: You're mad. How did I not see it?
RaidersArriveBeforeFight_21.context: NodeContext: He's realising that he just doomed his people by trusting us, but he blames himself. Quiet. Shocked.

RaidersArriveBeforeFight_55.speaker: Player
RaidersArriveBeforeFight_55.text: Die in fear, afore a waking nightmare.

RaidersArriveBeforeFight_16.speaker: Zevlor
RaidersArriveBeforeFight_16.text: Gods forgive me... I've doomed them all.

RaidersArriveBeforeFight_9.speaker: Player
RaidersArriveBeforeFight_9.text: My people? I'm loyal only to myself.

RaidersArriveBeforeFight_50.speaker: Asharak
RaidersArriveBeforeFight_50.text: You'll burn in the Hells for this.

RaidersArriveBeforeFight_63.speaker: Zevlor
RaidersArriveBeforeFight_63.text: What are you doing? They'll kill us all...
RaidersArriveBeforeFight_63.context: NodeContext: shocked, genuinely doesn't understand what's happening - context: the player has opened gates allowing enemies to invade

RaidersArriveBeforeFight_58.speaker: Zevlor
RaidersArriveBeforeFight_58.text: ...Hells. You're siding with them, against your own people?
RaidersArriveBeforeFight_58.context: NodeContext: dawning realisation. We've betrayed him and he's going to die along with his people

RaidersArriveBeforeFight_54.speaker: Player
RaidersArriveBeforeFight_54.text: No. This grove is under my protection.

RaidersArriveBeforeFight_14.speaker: Player
RaidersArriveBeforeFight_14.text: I serve Shar, not the Absolute. The gate stays closed.

RaidersArriveBeforeFight_35.speaker: Player
RaidersArriveBeforeFight_35.text: Your god has no power here.

RaidersArriveBeforeFight_48.speaker: Player
RaidersArriveBeforeFight_48.text: New plan - I tear out your throat.

RaidersArriveBeforeFight_51.speaker: Player
RaidersArriveBeforeFight_51.text: There's been a change of plan.

RaidersArriveBeforeFight_27.speaker: Player
RaidersArriveBeforeFight_27.text: I will not. Boo will not. And if you think to triumph here today, drow - you will not.

RaidersArriveBeforeFight_33.speaker: Player
RaidersArriveBeforeFight_33.text: Not so fast. You've just walked into my trap.

RaidersArriveBeforeFight_18.speaker: Player
RaidersArriveBeforeFight_18.text: These people are under my protection - but I'll see you in the Hells.

RaidersArriveBeforeFight_1.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
RaidersArriveBeforeFight_1.text: Traitor! You think you can stand against me and the Absolute?

RaidersArriveBeforeFight_5.context: CinematicNodeContext: ~With a gesture Minthara orders the attack.

RaidersArriveBeforeFight_30.speaker: Player
RaidersArriveBeforeFight_30.text: Of course - as does my god.

RaidersArriveBeforeFight_8.speaker: Player
RaidersArriveBeforeFight_8.text: No. I'll show the Absolute the power of a true god.

RaidersArriveBeforeFight_59.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
RaidersArriveBeforeFight_59.text: You cower behind a doomed god when the Absolute promised you such power?

RaidersArriveBeforeFight_17.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
RaidersArriveBeforeFight_17.text: You will die here. And your god will die with you.

RaidersArriveBeforeFight_36.speaker: Player
RaidersArriveBeforeFight_36.text: This place is sacred to Silvanus - the Absolute has no power here.

RaidersArriveBeforeFight_28.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
RaidersArriveBeforeFight_28.text: Sacred? It is filth. It will burn, and you will burn with it.

RaidersArriveBeforeFight_37.speaker: Player
RaidersArriveBeforeFight_37.text: They still think I'm on their side. Poor fools.

RaidersArriveBeforeFight_61.speaker: Player
RaidersArriveBeforeFight_61.text: I will not bring death to this sacred place, Minthara.

AD_WarehouseLooters_0.speaker: Brawler Gurd
AD_WarehouseLooters_0.text: Yeah. It's all... green. Why do druids store tree muck inside?

AD_WarehouseLooters_1.speaker: Warrior Clack
AD_WarehouseLooters_1.text: Dunno. But some of it's gotta be valuable, right?
AD_WarehouseLooters_1.context: NodeContext: Eager, hoping to make a profit

AD_WarehouseLooters_4.speaker: Warrior Clack
AD_WarehouseLooters_4.text: Maybe. Can't tell if it's for eating or smoking though.
AD_WarehouseLooters_4.context: NodeContext: A bit put out. Not sure if this raid is worth his time.

AD_WarehouseLooters_2.speaker: Brawler Gurd
AD_WarehouseLooters_2.text: *Ah-choo!* Ugh... smells funny whatever it's for. Grab as much as you can.

AD_GrumpyAndArrogant_2.speaker: Zurga
AD_GrumpyAndArrogant_2.text: We should have raided another tavern.

AD_GrumpyAndArrogant_0.speaker: Sharp-Eye Neem
AD_GrumpyAndArrogant_0.text: We should have raided a town.
AD_GrumpyAndArrogant_0.context: NodeContext: escalating from 'tavern' to town, half-joking

AD_GrumpyAndArrogant_7.speaker: Zurga
AD_GrumpyAndArrogant_7.context: NodeContext: escalating from town to 'city' as potential target for next raid - mostly joking

AD_GrumpyAndArrogant_6.speaker: Zurga
AD_GrumpyAndArrogant_6.text: Get any good scars during the raid?
AD_GrumpyAndArrogant_6.context: NodeContext: talking to another goblin, this is a fun prospect - 'scars' are like trophies

AD_GrumpyAndArrogant_8.speaker: Sharp-Eye Neem
AD_GrumpyAndArrogant_8.text: Nah. True Souls did most of the fighting.

AD_GrumpyAndArrogant_4.speaker: Zurga
AD_GrumpyAndArrogant_4.text: Oi! I was right in the thick of it.

AD_GrumpyAndArrogant_9.speaker: Zurga
AD_GrumpyAndArrogant_9.context: NodeContext: quietly incredulous - Minthara's NEVER pleased

AD_GrumpyAndArrogant_10.speaker: Sharp-Eye Neem
AD_GrumpyAndArrogant_10.context: NodeContext: smiling - he's gently mocking their boss

AD_GrumpyAndArrogant_3.speaker: Zurga
AD_GrumpyAndArrogant_3.text: If she hears you, it'll be the last.
AD_GrumpyAndArrogant_3.context: NodeContext: warning - imagine they're kids talking in class and teacher just heard

AD_GrumpyAndArrogant_11.speaker: Zurga
AD_GrumpyAndArrogant_11.text: Where do druids store their liquor?

AD_GrumpyAndArrogant_5.speaker: Sharp-Eye Neem
AD_GrumpyAndArrogant_5.text: I'm not even sure they drink liquor.
AD_GrumpyAndArrogant_5.context: NodeContext: incredulous - responding to a question about where druids store liquor, heavy emphasis on 'drink'

AD_GrumpyAndArrogant_1.speaker: Zurga
AD_GrumpyAndArrogant_1.text: If they do it's probably made of grapes or apples, or some other rubbish.
AD_GrumpyAndArrogant_1.context: NodeContext: complaining about the alcohol druids probably enjoy

AD_WarchiefAndLooters_1.speaker: Rozzak
AD_WarchiefAndLooters_1.text: What's taking you two so long? Get the goods and get moving!
AD_WarchiefAndLooters_1.context: NodeContext: Preemptively annoyed with his subordinates - they're not very smart.

AD_WarchiefAndLooters_3.speaker: Warrior Clack
AD_WarchiefAndLooters_3.text: Gurd keeps sneezing and dropping stuff.
AD_WarchiefAndLooters_3.context: NodeContext: Respectfully talking to his boss - and getting his friend in trouble

AD_WarchiefAndLooters_2.speaker: Brawler Gurd
AD_WarchiefAndLooters_2.text: Shut your mouth! I... *Ah-choo!* Feckin' leaves.
AD_WarchiefAndLooters_2.context: NodeContext: Gurd is allergic to the herbs in the storehouse he looted and keeps sneezing

AD_WarchiefAndLooters_0.speaker: Rozzak
AD_WarchiefAndLooters_0.text: You serious? Stuff something in yer nose and hurry up.

Refugee003_0.speaker: Bex
Refugee003_0.text: Still alive. Still alive. Thank you.
Refugee003_0.context: NodeContext: Relieved, breathless - reciting as if it's a mantra.

Refugee003_1.speaker: Bex
Refugee003_1.text: I knew this would come right if we just stayed positive. Not that your blade didn't help too.
Refugee003_1.context: NodeContext: Relieved, breathless - reciting as if it's a mantra.

Refugee003_2.speaker: Bex
Refugee003_2.text: This place... it's a pity we can't stay. Doubt there's this much green in the entire city.

Refugee003_3.speaker: Bex
Refugee003_3.text: Stay safe up there. Neither of us want me stitching you up.

Refugee003_4.speaker: Bex
Refugee003_4.text: Someone decided we were the best suited to see to any wounded.
Refugee003_4.context: NodeContext: Bemused, out of her depth.

Refugee003_5.speaker: Bex
Refugee003_5.text: Better all 'round if you keep everyone in one piece up there. Trust me.
Refugee003_5.context: NodeContext: Making a joke of it, but an edge of really urging to you protect everyone

Refugee003_6.speaker: Bex
Refugee003_6.text: On to Baldur's Gate! And if they slam the gate on us, we'll bloody well knock it down.

LairDoor_4.speaker: Stone Door
LairDoor_4.text: This door is staying shut - just be sensible and leave!
LairDoor_4.context: CinematicNodeContext: Only the door is seen - voice is OSNodeContext: 'Stone door' = Marcoryl voice

LairDoor_19.speaker: Stone Door
LairDoor_19.text: You people have endangered the grove for long enough. Go away!
LairDoor_19.context: CinematicNodeContext: Only the door is seen - voice is OSNodeContext: 'Stone door' = Marcoryl voice

LairDoor_21.speaker: Doni
LairDoor_21.context: CinematicNodeContext: Camera pans down to show Doni, Player and the DoorNodeContext: Worried grunt as he greets the player - trying to communicate a hopeless situation

LairDoor_23.speaker: Stone Door
LairDoor_23.text: Go away! There's nothing in here for you - for any of you.
LairDoor_23.context: CinematicNodeContext: Only the door is seen - voice is OSInternalNodeContext: This voice is supposed to be the same as Marcoryl, one of the druid servants.NodeContext: Urgent, a little frightened even. This voice is supposed to be the same as Marcoryl, one of the druid servants.

LairDoor_10.speaker: Stone Door
LairDoor_10.text: I said go away. You people have endangered this sacred place long enough.
LairDoor_10.context: CinematicNodeContext: Only the door is seen - voice is OSNodeContext: 'Stone door' = Marcoryl voice

LairDoor_22.speaker: Stone Door
LairDoor_22.text: This door is staying closed until you're gone, one way or another.
LairDoor_22.context: CinematicNodeContext: Only the door is seen - voice is OSNodeContext: 'Stone door' = Marcoryl voice

LairDoor_6.speaker: Player
LairDoor_6.text: Come on now, open up! There's people out here who need shelter.

LairDoor_9.speaker: Stone Door
LairDoor_9.text: We've been more than generous already! We have to take care of the grove's future.
LairDoor_9.context: CinematicNodeContext: Only the door is seen - voice is OSNodeContext: 'Stone door' = Marcoryl voice

LairDoor_12.speaker: Stone Door
LairDoor_12.context: CinematicNodeContext: Only the door is seen - voice is OSNodeContext: 'Stone door' = Marcoryl voice

LairDoor_17.speaker: Player
LairDoor_17.text: Coward. Innocents are going to die, thanks to you.

LairDoor_20.speaker: Stone Door
LairDoor_20.text: Then this sacred grove can be a comfort to them in their final moments.
LairDoor_20.context: CinematicNodeContext: Only the door is seen - voice is OSNodeContext: Eldath pronounced 'EL-dath' 'Stone door' = Marcoryl voice

LairDoor_24.speaker: Stone Door
LairDoor_24.text: But this door is staying closed. Now leave!
LairDoor_24.context: CinematicNodeContext: Only the door is seen - voice is OSNodeContext: 'Stone door' = Marcoryl voice

LairDoor_16.speaker: Player
LairDoor_16.text: You're a disgrace to this sacred grove. You should wither with shame.

LairDoor_7.speaker: Stone Door
LairDoor_7.text: There's no shame in ensuring the sanctity of this grove. Now leave!
LairDoor_7.context: CinematicNodeContext: Only the door is seen - voice is OSNodeContext: 'Stone door' = Marcoryl voice

LairDoor_18.speaker: Doni
LairDoor_18.context: NodeContext: resigned grunt - has been asking for help from the druids and feels abandoned

LairDoor_25.speaker: Stone Door
LairDoor_25.text: You're wasting your time. This door is staying shut.
LairDoor_25.context: CinematicNodeContext: Only the door is seen - voice is OSNodeContext: 'Stone door' = Marcoryl voice

AD_CoweringRefugee004_0.speaker: Toron
AD_CoweringRefugee004_0.context: NodeContext: Terrified, begging for his life as goblins close in.

Tiefling005_0.speaker: Pandirna
Tiefling005_0.text: The goblins... do they fight well?

Tiefling005_26.speaker: Pandirna
Tiefling005_26.text: You... mean that to be comforting, I'm sure.

Tiefling005_3.speaker: Player
Tiefling005_3.text: Well enough. But you have what they don't - something to fight for.

Tiefling005_4.speaker: Pandirna
Tiefling005_4.text: Some of us have more of that than others. I'll just be glad to live out the day.

Tiefling005_10.speaker: Player
Tiefling005_10.text: I'm just here for the show. Make it a good one, won't you?

Tiefling005_15.speaker: Player
Tiefling005_15.text: Better than a mob of undisciplined tieflings.

Tiefling005_9.speaker: Pandirna
Tiefling005_9.text: Why don't you find your own stretch of wall to die on?

Tiefling005_21.speaker: Player
Tiefling005_21.text: Like drunk children. Worse than drunk children - you'll be fine.

Tiefling005_18.speaker: Player
Tiefling005_18.text: They're a mob. Take heart - you fight with clan beside you.

Tiefling005_16.speaker: Pandirna
Tiefling005_16.text: You're right. Blood or not, the people here are family. And I won't let goblins take that away - not again.

Tiefling005_2.speaker: Player
Tiefling005_2.text: Never mind that - focus on the party we're going to have when all this is over.

Tiefling005_8.speaker: Pandirna
Tiefling005_8.text: Hah! I wish I had your confidence. But... thank you.

Tiefling005_13.speaker: Player
Tiefling005_13.text: Wrong question. You don't need to fight better than them - you just need to fight harder.

Tiefling005_30.speaker: Pandirna
Tiefling005_30.text: Heh. Damn straight - to the Nine Hells with them. We won't go down without a fight.

Tiefling005_7.speaker: Player
Tiefling005_7.text: They don't have skill, but numbers and luck can matter more.

Tiefling005_27.speaker: Pandirna
Tiefling005_27.text: Wonderful. I hope you brought both in equal measure.

Tiefling005_29.speaker: Player
Tiefling005_29.text: It doesn't matter. The true opponent is fear - and you've faced it before. Everyone has.

Tiefling005_11.speaker: Pandirna
Tiefling005_11.text: Heh, that obvious? But you're right. Can't swing a sword if I'm shaking like a leaf.

Tiefling005_1.speaker: Pandirna
Tiefling005_1.text: I had my doubts, but you came through. Thank you.

Tiefling005_5.speaker: Pandirna
Tiefling005_5.text: The goblins... look so small. Hard to believe I was ever afraid of them.

Tiefling005_12.speaker: Pandirna
Tiefling005_12.text: Take care. I'll feel better on the roads knowing you're out there somewhere.

Tiefling005_14.speaker: Pandirna
Tiefling005_14.text: Leave me alone. I don't want company.

Tiefling005_22.speaker: Pandirna
Tiefling005_22.text: All that talk of fighting... you spared us that. Thank you.

Tiefling005_23.speaker: Pandirna
Tiefling005_23.text: I'd have put good coin on you running off into the sunset, but you did it. You stopped the goblins. Thank you.

Tiefling005_24.speaker: Pandirna
Tiefling005_24.text: After that... well, I pity whatever tries us on the road to Baldur's Gate.

Tiefling005_25.speaker: Pandirna
Tiefling005_25.text: Gods, I almost wish they were here. I just want this done.

Tiefling005_28.speaker: Pandirna
Tiefling005_28.text: You again. Just when I thought today couldn't get any worse.

AD_ApprenticeLastStand_0.speaker: Nettie
AD_ApprenticeLastStand_0.text: And to think I was worried you'd transform.
AD_ApprenticeLastStand_0.context: NodeContext: shocked and in extreme anguish - she's been betrayed

AD_ApprenticeLastStand_1.speaker: Nettie
AD_ApprenticeLastStand_1.text: You were a monster the whole time.
AD_ApprenticeLastStand_1.context: NodeContext: Still in shock but resolute - she's prepared to fight, even though she'll surely die

RaidersArriveAfterFight_3.speaker: Narrator
RaidersArriveAfterFight_3.text: *A splinter of ice works its way into your mind, drowning out the goblins' battle cries.*
RaidersArriveAfterFight_3.context: CinematicNodeContext: The sound of goblins can be heard from the forest. The drow-led raiding party emerges from the forest and arrive outside the gatesNodeContext: describing an uncomfortable feeling as a drow prepares to speak with us telepathically

RaidersArriveAfterFight_2.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
RaidersArriveAfterFight_2.context: NodeContext: speaking telepathically (we do not see her, only hear her); a command

RaidersArriveAfterFight_4.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
RaidersArriveAfterFight_4.text: Exquisite work, True Soul. Now we must make sure nothing is hidden in their lair. Join me there.
RaidersArriveAfterFight_4.context: NodeContext: speaking telepathically (we do not see her, only hear her); a command

RaidersArriveAfterFight_0.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
RaidersArriveAfterFight_0.text: The way is clear. Now we can cleanse this place completely. Kill everyone.
RaidersArriveAfterFight_0.context: NodeContext: speaking telepathically (we do not see her, only hear her); a command

RaiderArrogant_0.speaker: Sharp-Eye Neem
RaiderArrogant_0.text: They'll be worg meat soon enough!

RaiderArrogant_1.speaker: Sharp-Eye Neem
RaiderArrogant_1.text: We'll rip them tiefs to shreds!

Pet004_0.speaker: Tusk
Pet004_0.text: Don't you smell it? The monsters are gone, and the air is fresh with new beginnings.
Pet004_0.context: NodeContext: Pleased and full of hope for the future.

Pet004_2.speaker: Tusk
Pet004_2.text: And speaking of new beginnings... I think it's time I found a mate.

DruidGuard003_0.speaker: Mino
DruidGuard003_0.text: Some normalcy can return to the Grove. At last.

DruidGuard003_1.speaker: Mino
DruidGuard003_1.text: I hear the goblins' leaders met their ends. Unfortunate for them, but very fortunate for the Grove.

DruidGuard003_2.speaker: Mino
DruidGuard003_2.text: Goblins at our gates. In our home. Silvanus' mercy...
DruidGuard003_2.context: NodeContext: Reacting to a goblin attack that occurred

DruidGuard003_3.speaker: Mino
DruidGuard003_3.text: Those goblins ought never to have found us. They never would have, if we'd been properly secluded.
DruidGuard003_3.context: NodeContext: Reacting to a goblin attack that occurred

DruidGuard003_4.speaker: Mino
DruidGuard003_4.text: The tieflings have gone - good. I wish them well, but they crowded us for far too long.
DruidGuard003_4.context: NodeContext: Glad to have tieflings gone. Gives an unsubtle hint to tiefling players that perhaps they should leave also.

DruidGuard003_5.speaker: Mino
DruidGuard003_5.text: Without leaders, those goblins present little threat to the Grove. Silvanus has blessed us.

Servant002_10.speaker: Marcoryl
Servant002_10.text: We cannot restore balance to the grove while you continue loitering. Please leave.

Servant002_16.speaker: Marcoryl
Servant002_16.text: I think it's high time you all left - our sacred grove has sheltered you enough.

Servant002_2.speaker: Player
Servant002_2.text: And before the attack - were you 'sheltering', or just plain cowering?

Servant002_3.speaker: Marcoryl
Servant002_3.text: The dignity of the grove comes first. It cannot be tended to if its custodians are dead.

Servant002_1.speaker: Marcoryl
Servant002_1.text: Besides, you survived. I'll not apologise for my actions.

Servant002_13.speaker: Player
Servant002_13.text: Where were you during the attack?

Servant002_11.speaker: Marcoryl
Servant002_11.text: Within the inner sanctum, of course. It is not for us to fight your battles.

Servant002_14.speaker: Player
Servant002_14.text: I'll be on my way soon.

Servant002_9.speaker: Marcoryl
Servant002_9.text: Make it quick. You're disrupting the harmony of this holy place.

Servant002_12.speaker: Marcoryl
Servant002_12.text: I assure you - the feeling is mutual.

Servant002_5.speaker: Player
Servant002_5.text: Do not presume to speak for this place - not when you did nothing to defend it.

Servant002_7.speaker: Marcoryl
Servant002_7.text: I answer to Silvanus and Silvanus only. And you are not the Oak Father.
Servant002_7.context: NodeContext: A little hesitatnt - player has shamed you and you feel terrible. You're trying ot mantain your pride but the player's words have cut deep.

Bard_30.speaker: Alfira
Bard_30.text: Get to the walls, beat the goblins back. Trust me - it's an easier job than this.

Bard_32.speaker: Alfira
Bard_32.text: Yes...? I'm pretty certain if I stop for too long they will actually eat me.
Bard_32.context: NodeContext: A whispered aside - she's worried about losing the childrens' already fading attention

Bard_37.speaker: Player
Bard_37.text: Good to see you again. How are you holding up?

Bard_25.speaker: Alfira
Bard_25.text: I'm... better, I think. Song's coming along, thanks to you.

Bard_21.speaker: Alfira
Bard_21.text: Live through the day and you might even get to hear the finished thing.

Bard_26.speaker: Player
Bard_26.text: What are you doing hiding down here?

Bard_23.speaker: Alfira
Bard_23.text: Hardly going to be much use in a battle, am I?
Bard_23.context: NodeContext: Admitting, knows her own strengths

Bard_18.speaker: Alfira
Bard_18.text: But making enough noise to keep this little mob distracted? That I can help with.

Bard_3.speaker: Player
Bard_3.text: You should play The Weeping Dawn instead.

Bard_8.speaker: Alfira
Bard_8.text: Gods, no. Can't see how a grown woman sobbing is going to lighten the mood much.
Bard_8.context: NodeContext: Horrified at the thought, self-deprecating

Bard_29.speaker: Player
Bard_29.text: Why don't you play some music instead?

Bard_24.speaker: Alfira
Bard_24.text: I only seem to know the sad ones, and, well...

Bard_6.speaker: Alfira
Bard_6.text: Now's a time for cheerful lies, as my master would say.

Bard_33.speaker: Player
Bard_33.text: The details of your story seem a little fuzzy.

Bard_22.speaker: Alfira
Bard_22.text: As a halfling's hoof, I should hope.

Bard_5.speaker: Alfira
Bard_5.text: If today's to be something worth singing about - get up there and make sure it's a happy song.
Bard_5.context: NodeContext: Thoughtful, trying to force a bit of cheer

Bard_11.speaker: Player
Bard_11.text: Do you know any stories about tiefling heroes?

Bard_1.speaker: Alfira
Bard_1.text: Huh. Plenty with tiefling villains... but not so many heroes, no.

Bard_13.speaker: Alfira
Bard_13.text: I suppose you'll just have to get up there and change that. No pressure, kin.

Bard_36.speaker: Alfira
Bard_36.text: I suppose you'll just have to get up there and change that. No pressure, kin.

Bard_15.speaker: Player
Bard_15.text: I could always scare them off. Maybe roar a little, for good measure?

Bard_39.speaker: Alfira
Bard_39.text: Hah! I'd pay good money to see you try. They're cute but deadly. Like the Realms' most terrifying bunny rabbits.
Bard_39.context: NodeContext: Cheery and delighted. Leaning like it's a secret.

Bard_27.speaker: Player
Bard_27.text: Then slay the whelps before they have the chance.

Bard_4.speaker: Alfira
Bard_4.text: I don't fancy my chances. They're cute but deadly. Like the Realms' most terrifying bunny rabbits.
Bard_4.context: NodeContext: Joking. You're messing with the player.

Bard_16.speaker: Alfira
Bard_16.text: I'd best continue with the stories, for fear of inciting a rebellion. But come back safe, all right?
Bard_16.context: NodeContext: Smiling at the beginning. A pause between last line. Sincere. she's worried about the player.

Bard_17.speaker: Player
Bard_17.text: Fascinating. I suppose trying times lead to desperate measures. Could I watch?

Bard_28.speaker: Alfira
Bard_28.text: You may, but unless you can spin a tale worthy of Milil, I suggest running while you can.
Bard_28.context: NodeContext: Joking. You're messing with the player.

Bard_14.speaker: Player
Bard_14.text: Well, they're eating up that fiction you just spun.

Bard_9.speaker: Player
Bard_9.text: I've heard a very different version of the tale of Balduran.

Bard_12.speaker: Alfira
Bard_12.text: If heroes are in short supply, then I will bloody well make one up. For them, and for me.

Bard_2.speaker: Alfira
Bard_2.text: Your job is to get up there and give me something real to sing about.

Bard_35.speaker: Alfira
Bard_35.text: On to playing for coppers on the corners of Baldur's Gate. I can hardly stand the glamour.

Bard_38.speaker: Alfira
Bard_38.text: I'm going to have to write a song about you now, aren't I?

Bard_19.speaker: Alfira
Bard_19.text: But, truly... thank you. It's nice to be done with the sad songs, for a time.

BirdSender_1.speaker: Apikusis
BirdSender_1.text: You saved a holy place from desecration. Thank you.

BirdSender_2.speaker: Apikusis
BirdSender_2.text: The goblins are gone, but so is our idol. We are exposed without it.

BirdSender_3.speaker: Apikusis
BirdSender_3.text: Safe travels. You will be remembered here.

BirdSender_5.speaker: Apikusis
BirdSender_5.text: We're free of the goblins, but the grove is changed. Wounded.

BirdSender_0.speaker: Apikusis
BirdSender_0.text: The days ahead won't be easy. I'm glad we have Halsin to guide us.

BirdSender_4.speaker: Apikusis
BirdSender_4.text: The days ahead won't be easy, but we'll manage. We have to.

BirdSender_6.speaker: Apikusis
BirdSender_6.text: Thanks to you, we have the chance to heal.

AD_BickeringTrainees_3.speaker: Ide
AD_BickeringTrainees_3.text: You can't even count to a hundred.

AD_BickeringTrainees_2.speaker: Gan
AD_BickeringTrainees_2.text: I don't have to count. I just have to hit 'em.

AD_GrieflingFriendAtGrave_0.speaker: Memnos
AD_GrieflingFriendAtGrave_0.text: Rest well, Arka. I'm sure Kanon's waiting for you.

Refugee004_0.speaker: Toron
Refugee004_0.text: Thought you'd left us to our fate, running off like you did. Glad I was wrong.

Refugee004_1.speaker: Toron
Refugee004_1.text: That was too close, Tymora smile on us.

Refugee004_2.speaker: Toron
Refugee004_2.text: The things the children are saying about you. At least when they were scared, they were quiet.
Refugee004_2.context: NodeContext: He's impressed, beneath the wry remark.

Refugee004_3.speaker: Toron
Refugee004_3.text: Let's hope our luck holds out until Baldur's Gate.
Refugee004_3.context: NodeContext: Relieved. Still a little anxious for challenges yet to come

Refugee004_4.speaker: Toron
Refugee004_4.text: We can talk after this is over - if we're alive.

Refugee004_5.speaker: Toron
Refugee004_5.text: Whatever it is, I don't have time.

ZenBear_0.speaker: Ormn
ZenBear_0.text: He's back! You brought Halsin back!

ZenBear_1.speaker: Ormn
ZenBear_1.context: NodeContext: describing a bear that is in shock after a battle

ZenBear_3.speaker: Ormn
ZenBear_3.text: He's gone... His scent is gone.

ZenBear_4.speaker: Ormn
ZenBear_4.text: Thank you for finding my master. May your hibernations be long and calm.

AD_Refugees_0.speaker: Ikaron
AD_Refugees_0.text: Look on the bright side, mother - should be fewer mouths to feed after today.
AD_Refugees_0.context: NodeContext: Surly, afraid - trying to hurt his mother's feelings.

AD_Refugees_9.speaker: Okta
AD_Refugees_9.context: NodeContext: Weary, upset - her son has been in a mood all day

AD_Refugees_13.speaker: Bex
AD_Refugees_13.text: Danis can hunt! Sharp as an elf with that bow, aren't you love?
AD_Refugees_13.context: NodeContext: Cutting in, trying to be helpful and pre-empt an argument

AD_Refugees_2.speaker: Ikaron
AD_Refugees_2.text: Then why aren't you on the wall?

AD_Refugees_5.speaker: Danis
AD_Refugees_5.text: Rabbits don't shoot back, do they?
AD_Refugees_5.context: NodeContext: Caught off-guard, trying to keep it light

AD_Refugees_1.speaker: Danis
AD_Refugees_1.text: Would you... like to pray, or something?

AD_Refugees_4.speaker: Okta
AD_Refugees_4.text: So you have experience treating the wounded?

AD_Refugees_10.speaker: Okta
AD_Refugees_10.text: Just good with a needle and thread?

AD_Refugees_6.speaker: Bex
AD_Refugees_6.text: Sure. Were you a cook in Elturel?

AD_Refugees_8.speaker: Okta
AD_Refugees_8.text: You've had my food, right? Answer's in the gruel.

Stargazer_0.speaker: Nadira
Stargazer_0.text: First druids, now goblins. Lady Doom really has it out for us, doesn't she?

Stargazer_1.speaker: Nadira
Stargazer_1.text: Hells. Maybe I should have stayed in Avernus after all.

Stargazer_2.speaker: Nadira
Stargazer_2.text: What a mess. Wonder if the goblins have anything valuable on them.

Stargazer_3.speaker: Nadira
Stargazer_3.text: I'm ready to try my luck in Baldur's Gate. I hear a lot of people make bad bets there.

Trainee002_0.speaker: Ide
Trainee002_0.text: I can't wait to go. This place is boring.

Trainee002_1.speaker: Ide
Trainee002_1.text: You can hide in here if you like. No one's getting past us.
Trainee002_1.context: NodeContext: Casual, confident, trying to impress player

Trainee002_2.speaker: Ide
Trainee002_2.text: Asharak says goblins are just little like us. Easy.
Trainee002_2.context: NodeContext: Casual, confident, trying to impress player

Trainee002_4.speaker: Ide
Trainee002_4.text: Hope we meet some monsters on the road. I want to practice.

Trainee002_5.speaker: Ide
Trainee002_5.text: I told you I wasn't afraid. Those goblins look tiny.
Trainee002_5.context: NodeContext: Insistent, almost disbelieving - now that s/he sees goblins up close s/he's definitely not afraid

Trainee002_6.speaker: Ide
Trainee002_6.text: I'm glad you killed all the goblins. I hope you made them scared.
Trainee002_6.context: NodeContext: Insistent, almost disbelieving - now that s/he sees goblins up close s/he's definitely not afraid

Sapper_002_1.speaker: 769c8964-7b9f-4040-a742-9ebcecc07ce1
Sapper_002_1.text: Plenty of tieflin' meat for the lads back at camp...
Sapper_002_1.context: CinematicNodeContext: he's carrying an explosive barrelNodeContext: with a cruel smile - talking about the corpses of the people they've just killed

Sapper_002_2.speaker: 769c8964-7b9f-4040-a742-9ebcecc07ce1
Sapper_002_2.context: CinematicNodeContext: he's carrying an explosive barrelNodeContext: with a cruel smile

Sapper_002_0.speaker: 769c8964-7b9f-4040-a742-9ebcecc07ce1
Sapper_002_0.text: ... when I hit 'em with this stuff, it'll barely leave a stain.
Sapper_002_0.context: CinematicNodeContext: he's carrying an explosive barrelNodeContext: referring to the explosives he's carrying

Adventurer2_2.speaker: Remira
Adventurer2_2.text: You. Liam said you sprung him from the goblin camp.
Adventurer2_2.context: NodeContext: She's waiting for Zevlor to open the gates since goblisn are coming.

Adventurer2_14.speaker: Remira
Adventurer2_14.text: And now you're back to stand with this lot. A right soft heart you've got, don't you?

Adventurer2_4.speaker: Player
Adventurer2_4.text: I could say the same for you.

Adventurer2_10.speaker: Remira
Adventurer2_10.text: Soft head, more like. If I were smart, I'd be back in Baldur's Gate with my feet up.

Adventurer2_12.speaker: Remira
Adventurer2_12.text: But this crowd patched Liam up when they had plenty reason not to. Might be I misjudged 'em.

Adventurer2_1.speaker: Remira
Adventurer2_1.text: Still a lost cause, mind - but if you can't live smart, you may as well die right.

Adventurer2_22.speaker: Player
Adventurer2_22.text: Better a soft heart than none at all.

Adventurer2_19.speaker: Remira
Adventurer2_19.text: Oh, bugger off. I'm here, aren't I?

Adventurer2_15.speaker: Remira
Adventurer2_15.text: I left Baldur's Gate to make some coin, not fall in with a bunch of homeless hellspawn.

Adventurer2_6.speaker: Remira
Adventurer2_6.text: Can't see to Liam's wounds myself so I best keep this crowd alive to do it for me.
Adventurer2_6.context: NodeContext: Explaining why she's still there.

Adventurer2_5.speaker: Player
Adventurer2_5.text: Soft heart, strong arm. How's Liam?

Adventurer2_3.speaker: Remira
Adventurer2_3.text: Better than he was when you found him. Bugger gets to rest while we do the work.

Adventurer2_17.speaker: Remira
Adventurer2_17.text: Still. This crowd looked after him, no questions asked. Reckon it's only fair I return the favour.

Adventurer2_9.speaker: Remira
Adventurer2_9.text: Seems you're not the only one that likes a lost cause.

Adventurer2_13.speaker: Player
Adventurer2_13.text: Soft heart, sharp mind. How's Liam?

Adventurer2_16.speaker: Player
Adventurer2_16.text: Surprised to see you here protecting 'foulbloods'.

Adventurer2_21.speaker: Remira
Adventurer2_21.text: Look... might be I've said some stupid things. No 'might' about it, actually.

Adventurer2_0.speaker: Remira
Adventurer2_0.text: But Liam said it was you sprung him from that goblin camp. Not me, not Aradin or Barth - you.

Adventurer2_18.speaker: Remira
Adventurer2_18.text: I might be thick, but I'm fair - you save one of mine, I can at least try to return the favour.

Adventurer2_7.speaker: Remira
Adventurer2_7.text: You made it - good. Reckon I've seen enough brave idiots run to their deaths for a while.
Adventurer2_7.context: NodeContext: She's waiting for Zevlor to open the gates since goblisn are coming.

Adventurer2_8.speaker: Remira
Adventurer2_8.text: Don't you have a heroic defence to lead?
Adventurer2_8.context: NodeContext: She's waiting for Zevlor to open the gates since goblisn are coming.

Adventurer2_20.speaker: Remira
Adventurer2_20.text: Might be we'll see you in Baldur's Gate. Tieflings offered us coin to guard 'em on the road.
Adventurer2_20.context: NodeContext: She's waiting for Zevlor to open the gates since goblisn are coming.

Adventurer2_11.speaker: Remira
Adventurer2_11.text: Not as much as I'd like, mind, but I'm done chasing baubles for shitey wizards.

RitualDruid003_0.speaker: Inwe
RitualDruid003_0.text: I'm tempted to leave with the rest of you... but I can't abandon my home.
RitualDruid003_0.context: NodeContext: Players are going on a quest that takes them from the grove. Inwe is tempted to leave the drama in the grove behind.

RitualDruid003_1.speaker: Inwe
RitualDruid003_1.text: I pray your road is safe. If only I could walk it myself...
RitualDruid003_1.context: NodeContext: Players are going on a quest that takes them from the grove. Inwe is tempted to leave the drama in the grove behind.

AD_CheckingBarricade_9.speaker: Lakrissa
AD_CheckingBarricade_9.text: Well. We won't be long finding out, I suppose.
AD_CheckingBarricade_9.context: NodeContext: Matter of fact, fatalistic - making a joke of it

AD_CheckingBarricade_2.speaker: Lakrissa
AD_CheckingBarricade_2.text: Goblins better bloody show up, after all this effort we're putting in.

AD_CheckingBarricade_1.speaker: Kaldani
AD_CheckingBarricade_1.text: Yup. Murderous is one thing, but late?  Beshaba pass over.
AD_CheckingBarricade_1.context: NodeContext: Ironic. 'Beshaba pass over' [Beh-SHA-ba] - said like 'God forbid' - a common phrase in this world praying that the goddess of bad luck pass you by.

AD_CheckingBarricade_4.speaker: Lakrissa
AD_CheckingBarricade_4.text: Think... I'm getting... the hang of this...
AD_CheckingBarricade_4.context: NodeContext: Said as she labours at building a barricade

AD_CheckingBarricade_5.speaker: Lakrissa
AD_CheckingBarricade_5.text: You think it'll make any difference?
AD_CheckingBarricade_5.context: NodeContext: Quietly, allowing worry to seep through. Looking for reassurance.

AD_CheckingBarricade_3.speaker: Kaldani
AD_CheckingBarricade_3.context: NodeContext: Quietly in response - doesn't know what her friend is referring to.

AD_CheckingBarricade_6.speaker: Lakrissa
AD_CheckingBarricade_6.context: NodeContext: Gesturing at the work they're carrying out on a barricade.

AD_CheckingBarricade_7.speaker: Kaldani
AD_CheckingBarricade_7.context: NodeContext: Shrugging, acknowledging that she doesn't have the confidence she pretends to.

AD_StupidAndDummy_1.speaker: Sharp-Eye Eef
AD_StupidAndDummy_1.context: NodeContext: shouting at a wooden training dummy that he's attacking

AD_StupidAndDummy_2.speaker: Tracker Azak
AD_StupidAndDummy_2.text: It ain't got eyes, you muck-skull. It ain't even alive!
AD_StupidAndDummy_2.context: NodeContext: exasperated - talking to a friend who is attacking a wooden training dummy

AD_StupidAndDummy_3.speaker: Tracker Azak
AD_StupidAndDummy_3.text: Stop messin' about and get back to work!

AD_PackingTraders_0.speaker: Meli
AD_PackingTraders_0.text: Hands off, Mattis! I earned this!

AD_PackingTraders_3.speaker: Meli
AD_PackingTraders_3.text: Well, I'm stealin' on my own when we get to Baldur's Gate.

AD_PackingTraders_2.speaker: Mattis
AD_PackingTraders_2.text: Fine by me. I bet there's plenty of adults with loose pockets there.

Servant005_2.speaker: Arron
Servant005_2.text: So it's true. You scattered the goblins. Peace can finally return to this corner of the Sword Coast. Thank you.

Servant005_3.speaker: Arron
Servant005_3.text: By the trees, I never liked the ritual, but when I saw that drow, I admit I wished we'd finished it.
Servant005_3.context: NodeContext: 'By the trees' is an exclamation mark, not him saying literally 'by the trees over there.'

Servant005_9.speaker: Arron
Servant005_9.text: I don't know what we would have done without you.

Servant005_6.speaker: Arron
Servant005_6.text: It'll take a while for us all to recover, but you've helped us take the first step.

Servant005_16.speaker: Arron
Servant005_16.text: By the trees! I don't know what I dreaded more - the goblins, or being stuck here with Kagha for the rest of my days.
Servant005_16.context: NodeContext: 'By the trees' is an exclamation mark, not him saying literally 'by the trees over there.'

Servant005_12.speaker: Arron
Servant005_12.text: But you've solved both those problems in one go.

Servant005_10.speaker: Player
Servant005_10.text: I'm just glad I could help.

Servant005_0.speaker: Arron
Servant005_0.text: As am I. And I'm sure those poor refugees would quite agree.

Servant005_17.speaker: Player
Servant005_17.text: Any excuse to gut some goblins.

Servant005_7.speaker: Player
Servant005_7.text: I want to trade, if you have anything good.

HarpyKid_0.speaker: Mirkon
HarpyKid_0.text: Shh - you need to listen or go away.

HarpyKid_1.speaker: Mirkon
HarpyKid_1.text: Shh - you have to listen to the story.

HarpyKid_7.speaker: Mirkon
HarpyKid_7.text: I'm telling a story - it's rude to interrupt.

HarpyKid_15.speaker: Mirkon
HarpyKid_15.text: The Harpy Killer! Are you here to save us? Like Baldy Ron saved the city?

HarpyKid_17.speaker: Mirkon
HarpyKid_17.text: I told everyone you'll save us. I know you will.

HarpyKid_18.speaker: Mirkon
HarpyKid_18.text: Are you here to save us? Like Baldy Ron saved the city?

HarpyKid_3.speaker: Player
HarpyKid_3.text: For all I know, I might actually be Baldy Ron.

HarpyKid_13.speaker: Mirkon
HarpyKid_13.text: Good. And after, the lady can tell us stories about you.

HarpyKid_8.speaker: Mirkon
HarpyKid_8.text: He saved Baldur's Gate and became a hero!

HarpyKid_14.speaker: Player
HarpyKid_14.text: That is exactly what I'm here for.

HarpyKid_23.speaker: Player
HarpyKid_23.text: I risked my life for you once. I'm not planning to do it again.

HarpyKid_9.speaker: Mirkon
HarpyKid_9.text: But... you can win. Goblins aren't as strong as bird women, right? They can't even fly.

HarpyKid_12.speaker: Player
HarpyKid_12.text: You're not worth the trouble, kid. You're on your own.

HarpyKid_4.speaker: Mirkon
HarpyKid_4.text: But... didn't you kill those goblins at the gate? You can win. I know you can!

HarpyKid_20.speaker: Player
HarpyKid_20.text: You mean Balduran. He sailed to the edge of the world.

HarpyKid_5.speaker: Mirkon
HarpyKid_5.text: He did? I wonder what he found...
HarpyKid_5.context: NodeContext: surprised and daydreaming - he found out something new about one of his hero;s.

HarpyKid_16.speaker: Player
HarpyKid_16.text: Do you mean Balduran, the legendary founder of Baldur's Gate?

HarpyKid_6.speaker: Mirkon
HarpyKid_6.text: What's a founder? The lady said he saved Baldur's Gate and became a hero!
HarpyKid_6.context: NodeContext: Confused at first because he doesn't understand what the player means, but then gets into the story again and gets excited retelling it.

HarpyKid_19.speaker: Mirkon
HarpyKid_19.text: I hope we get to leave soon. I'm tired of living in a cave.

HarpyKid_22.speaker: Mirkon
HarpyKid_22.text: You saved us! Just like Baldy Ron.
HarpyKid_22.context: NodeContext: little kid trying to get answers from adults who are busy

SnakeKid_0.speaker: Arabella
SnakeKid_0.text: Even if goblins get in, they can't find us here. Mum said.
SnakeKid_0.context: NodeContext: Player is interrupting a story, child is impatient.

SnakeKid_1.speaker: Arabella
SnakeKid_1.context: NodeContext: In a hushed whisper, talkibng about a storyteller. Telling you to shut up but in a sweet kiddish way.

SnakeKid_2.speaker: Arabella
SnakeKid_2.context: NodeContext: Sing-songy, a declaration of joy

SnakeKid_3.speaker: Arabella
SnakeKid_3.text: You'll be safe in here. Don't worry.
SnakeKid_3.context: NodeContext: With goodhearted concern for the player's well-being

SnakeKid_4.speaker: Arabella
SnakeKid_4.context: NodeContext: In a hushed whisper, talkibng about a storyteller. Telling you to shut up but in a sweet kiddish way.

SnakeKid_5.speaker: Arabella
SnakeKid_5.context: NodeContext: Drawing out hte vowels like an impatient kid.

Pet003_0.speaker: Topaz
Pet003_0.text: Ahh, my nest is still whole! Those monsters didn't touch it.
Pet003_0.context: NodeContext: Relieved - there was a big fight, and he thought the nest he worked so hard on got destroyed.

Pet003_1.speaker: Topaz
Pet003_1.text: No, no, no - it's gone. My coin is gone!
Pet003_1.context: NodeContext: In a panick - his precious coin disappeared.

MindMeldAfterCombat_3.speaker: Narrator
MindMeldAfterCombat_3.text: *A splinter of ice works its way into your mind.*
MindMeldAfterCombat_3.context: NodeContext: describing the sensation of a drow telepathically communicating with us

MindMeldAfterCombat_1.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
MindMeldAfterCombat_1.context: NodeContext: speaking telepathically (we do not see her, only hear her); a command

MindMeldAfterCombat_2.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
MindMeldAfterCombat_2.text: Exquisite work, True Soul. Now we must make sure nothing is hidden in their lair. Join me there.
MindMeldAfterCombat_2.context: NodeContext: speaking telepathically (we do not see her, only hear her); a command

MindMeldAfterCombat_0.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
MindMeldAfterCombat_0.text: The way is clear. Now we can cleanse this place completely. Kill everyone.
MindMeldAfterCombat_0.context: NodeContext: speaking telepathically (we do not see her, only hear her); a command

PrisonGuard_0.speaker: Tilses
PrisonGuard_0.text: Glad you're here with us. A bunch of ratty goblins aren't gonna send us running. We've been surviving long enough. Time to start living.

PrisonGuard_1.speaker: Tilses
PrisonGuard_1.text: Hope you won't miss this place. Don't think we'll be coming back any time soon.
PrisonGuard_1.context: NodeContext: A little relieved. A little bitter. Conflicted feelings.

PrisonGuard_2.speaker: Tilses
PrisonGuard_2.text: That's it. We can head to the city. Dunno about you, but I'm ready to start my life again.
PrisonGuard_2.context: NodeContext: A little relieved. A little bitter. Conflicted feelings.

PrisonGuard_3.speaker: Tilses
PrisonGuard_3.text: Good to see a familiar face. I have the strangest feeling every time you pass by. Like you're meant to be here.

Prodigy_0.speaker: Rolan
Prodigy_0.text: I nearly dispatched those goblins myself, but it seems you managed well enough.
Prodigy_0.context: NodeContext: Idle arrogance, as if he could have taken out an entire camp of enemies if it weren't beneath him

Prodigy_4.speaker: Rolan
Prodigy_4.text: And why wield a masterwork where a butcher's blade will do? My thanks, truly.
Prodigy_4.context: NodeContext: Airy condescension - you saved him a menial task, but it was perfecly suited to you.

Prodigy_1.speaker: Rolan
Prodigy_1.text: They'll sing songs about this, you know. They simply don't know any better.
Prodigy_1.context: NodeContext: As if you should be grateful - the last an aside to himself.

Prodigy_3.speaker: Rolan
Prodigy_3.text: We could've handled those goblins on our own.

Prodigy_2.speaker: Rolan
Prodigy_2.text: Nevertheless... I suppose it was decent of you to return.

Prodigy_5.speaker: Rolan
Prodigy_5.text: All that fuss and for what? I'd barely call that a fight.

Drow_18.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Drow_18.text: There are more - hunt them down!
Drow_18.context: NodeContext: In the midst of battle... enjoying herself

Drow_21.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Drow_21.text: Praise the Absolute! She will reward us well for this exquisite carnage.

Drow_45.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Drow_45.text: There were few left alive - you began the slaughter without me, I assume?

Drow_56.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Drow_56.text: You are almost worthy to live among drow, faerie.

Drow_74.context: CinematicNodeContext: Qcam's here to avoid Inclusion lines

Drow_66.speaker: Player
Drow_66.text: I met True Soul Nere in the Underdark. He warned me against working with you.

Drow_75.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Drow_75.text: Did he, now? Let me guess: the snivelling brat's failed his duty. Nothing if not expected.

Drow_1.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Drow_1.text: But you - I can see you are different. Faithful to the last.

Drow_43.speaker: Player
Drow_43.text: I've done as you asked. It's time you gave me safe passage to Moonrise.

Drow_65.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Drow_65.text: You are most eager, True Soul. All will be revealed come dawn.

Drow_76.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Drow_76.text: The Absolute knows your zeal. And She has so much more to give.

Drow_40.speaker: Player
Drow_40.text: I need to reach Moonrise. Tell me the way, and let that be my reward.

Drow_4.speaker: Player
Drow_4.text: This was murder. The only fitting reward for us is the hangman's noose.

Drow_59.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Drow_59.context: NodeContext: as if to a lover

Drow_38.speaker: Narrator
Drow_38.text: *You see the slaughter of the tieflings again, but through her eyes. The delight of blood, the symphony of screams. Glorious.*
Drow_38.context: CinematicNodeContext: My lips set in a cruel smileNodeContext: describing a sickening sensation

Drow_49.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Drow_49.text: The Absolute loves you, True Soul. And serving Her, as you have, is the path to true power.
Drow_49.context: NodeContext: unnerving, religious fervour - the 'serving' involved taking part in a massacre

Drow_55.speaker: Player
Drow_55.text: Glad to have helped - I made sure they were ready to fall.

Drow_63.speaker: Player
Drow_63.text: What a lovely afternoon! A real pleasure!

Drow_20.speaker: Player
Drow_20.text: It's been a privilege to fight alongside you.

Drow_44.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Drow_44.text: The true honour is to serve the Absolute. She loves you fiercely; I see that in the strength She has given you.
Drow_44.context: NodeContext: pleased, speaking to an ally - The Absolute is their goddess

Drow_7.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Drow_7.text: And She has so much more to give.

Drow_31.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Drow_31.text: There is a bond between us, True Soul. I can see what you are. What you want.

Drow_37.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Drow_37.text: And you can see what I want.

Drow_30.speaker: Narrator
Drow_30.text: *Through her eyes, you see yourself: skin glistening with sweat, hands bound. Ecstasy... or terror. Maybe both.*
Drow_30.context: NodeContext: describing a vision of being seduced by acruel drow

Drow_71.speaker: Narrator
Drow_71.text: *You feel her breath on your neck, her fingers running down your spine, and then... it is over.*

Drow_11.speaker: Narrator
Drow_11.text: *A flash of anger pulses across your brain. You feel cold metal at your throat - then you snap back to yourself.*
Drow_11.context: NodeContext: describing a vision of a seduction gone wrong

Drow_8.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Drow_8.text: I already know your mind - I will know your body, one way or another.
Drow_8.context: NodeContext: a threat following a seduction - the player rejected her advances

Drow_58.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Drow_58.text: I will come to your camp tonight. We will celebrate this victory. Together.
Drow_58.context: NodeContext: following a seduction - she's very dominating, practically ordering us to join her in bed

Drow_39.speaker: Player
Drow_39.text: I've done as you asked. It's time you gave me safe passage to Moonrise.

Drow_2.speaker: Player
Drow_2.text: I'd prefer to set off for Moonrise than waste time celebrating. How do I reach it?

Drow_17.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Drow_17.text: All will be revealed come dawn.

Drow_41.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Drow_41.text: Until then, let us revel. The Absolute demands no less.

Drow_24.speaker: Player
Drow_24.text: You're an abomination, and now I'm finally going to end you.

Drow_27.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Drow_27.text: Pathetic. Your blood betrays you, iblith, and I will spill every drop.

Drow_73.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Drow_73.text: The Absolute did not bring you here to assist me - She brought you here to die.

Drow_14.speaker: Player
Drow_14.text: You won't live to collect any reward, but I will collect your head.

Drow_53.speaker: Astarion
Drow_53.text: Please, it's no challenge. Just a friendly little murder between chums.

Drow_12.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Drow_12.text: You dare to challenge me? We will see who the Absolute truly loves.

Drow_54.speaker: Karlach
Drow_54.text: Are we planning to kill everyone we meet?

Drow_22.speaker: Lae'zel
Drow_22.text: Your words say nothing, woman. Prove your merit with blood!

Drow_5.speaker: Shadowheart
Drow_5.text: We needn't fight every time, you know. There's this wild notion called choosing your battles!
Drow_5.context: NodeContext: Frustrated/angry - the player's chosen to pick a fight that could've been easily avoided. Now she's going to have to join in,

Drow_57.speaker: Player
Drow_57.text: You rejected the Queen of Spiders for this Absolute - I will slay you in Lolth's name.

Drow_10.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Drow_10.text: Greater drow than you have challenged me, wael. The Underdark is thick with their blood.

Drow_35.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Drow_35.text: You won't even have the dignity of dying in your homeland. Ssussun pholor dos!

Drow_23.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Drow_23.text: A glorious day. The Absolute will be pleased.

Drow_16.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Drow_16.text: But there is more to be done. This place is home to druids - root them out and kill them.

Drow_34.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Drow_34.text: When you are done, we will celebrate our victory at your camp.

Drow_32.speaker: Player
Drow_32.text: I've done as you asked. It's time you gave me safe passage to Moonrise.

Drow_72.speaker: Player
Drow_72.text: I'd prefer to set off for Moonrise than waste time celebrating. How do I reach it?

Drow_42.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Drow_42.text: I expect great things of you - when the battle begins, show me your worth.
Drow_42.context: NodeContext: An aside to the player as she's gathering troops before setting out on a raid -

Drow_47.speaker: Player
Drow_47.text: I've done as you asked. It's time you gave me safe passage to Moonrise.

Drow_60.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Drow_60.text: We will discuss the matter later. First, we lay waste to this forsaken grove.

Drow_64.speaker: Player
Drow_64.text: I will. But first, tell me how to reach Moonrise, so I can report there when the battle is done.

Drow_52.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Drow_52.text: Praise the Absolute! She will reward us well for this exquisite carnage.
Drow_52.context: CinematicNodeContext: if possible, breathing heavily - she's just participated in a slaughted and is tired but exhileratedNodeContext: With a smile and slightly out of breath - just participated in a slaughter and enjoyed it

Drow_68.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Drow_68.text: Find the druids. Bleed them dry.

Mule2_0.speaker: Hungry Ox
Mule2_0.text: If you are afraid, hide beneath my legs - like a good calf. I will stop them.
Mule2_0.context: NodeContext: Determined - ready for a fight.

Mule2_2.speaker: Hungry Ox
Mule2_2.text: That was fun! I want to stomp more of the small, dirty two-legs.

Mule2_3.speaker: Hungry Ox
Mule2_3.text: Let us go. I wish to feel the road beneath my hooves - taste the fresh grass!

Mule2_5.speaker: Hungry Ox
Mule2_5.text: Let them come. I will bite. I will stamp.
Mule2_5.context: NodeContext: Determined - ready for a fight.

AD_CoweringRefugee003_0.speaker: Bex
AD_CoweringRefugee003_0.context: NodeContext: Shouting to her lover to run as goblins close in around them.

AD_CoweringRefugee002_0.speaker: Danis
AD_CoweringRefugee002_0.text: Oh gods, oh gods, oh gods -
AD_CoweringRefugee002_0.context: NodeContext: Repeated over and over in panic - equivalent of 'ohshitohshitohshit'

Tiefling003_1.speaker: Okta
Tiefling003_1.text: Sorry, I've got nothing to offer. What little there is has to go to the young ones.

Tiefling003_2.speaker: Okta
Tiefling003_2.text: This lot better get used to berries.

Tiefling003_3.speaker: Okta
Tiefling003_3.text: We were just about prepared for travel rations. Not a bloody siege.
Tiefling003_3.context: NodeContext: Grim - one bad thing after another.

Tiefling003_4.speaker: Okta
Tiefling003_4.text: Back to worrying about road rations it is. So many mouths to feed, but...

Tiefling003_0.speaker: Okta
Tiefling003_0.text: ... well, that's not a bad problem to have. Thank you, truly.

Kid004_0.speaker: Zaki
Kid004_0.text: It smells bad out here. I want to go home.

Kid004_1.speaker: Zaki
Kid004_1.text: You know how to fight, right? You should be out there, helping!
Kid004_1.context: NodeContext: Player is interrupting a story, child is impatient.

Kid004_2.speaker: Zaki
Kid004_2.text: Sssh, she's getting to the good part!
Kid004_2.context: NodeContext: Player is interrupting a story, child is impatient.

Kid004_3.speaker: Zaki
Kid004_3.context: NodeContext: Player is interrupting a story, child is impatient.

Kid004_4.speaker: Zaki
Kid004_4.text: You're lucky - you can go wherever you want.

Kid004_5.speaker: Zaki
Kid004_5.text: You look all tough, but you're still in here, hiding with us children.
Kid004_5.context: NodeContext: Player is interrupting a story, child is impatient.

ScoutCaptive_0.speaker: Findal
ScoutCaptive_0.text: You're starting to feel like my personal bodyguard. I wish you were.
ScoutCaptive_0.context: NodeContext: with a smile of genuine gratitude

SonOfChef_0.speaker: Ikaron
SonOfChef_0.text: Stay safe out there, you hear?

SonOfChef_1.speaker: Ikaron
SonOfChef_1.text: Leave me be. The attack could happen any moment.
SonOfChef_1.context: NodeContext: Apologetic, grim - you're trying to prepare yourself mentally for the fight.

SonOfChef_2.speaker: Ikaron
SonOfChef_2.text: We couldn't have held them back on our own. Thank you.
SonOfChef_2.context: NodeContext: Gruff but grateful - you can't believe you survived.

SonOfChef_3.speaker: Ikaron
SonOfChef_3.text: So many people left - I'm glad someone stuck around.
SonOfChef_3.context: NodeContext: Grim but grateful - you're glad the player is here.

AD_BetrayedGrieflingFriend_0.speaker: Memnos
AD_BetrayedGrieflingFriend_0.text: You backstabbing birna mrag! We trusted you!
AD_BetrayedGrieflingFriend_0.context: NodeContext: Angry and accusatory, pre-combat. Birna mrag meaning 'piece of shit' in the infernal language. Pronounced 'BIRna mRAG'

WarchiefGrumpy_0.speaker: Zurga
WarchiefGrumpy_0.text: Oi. Have you lot really got black, boilin' blood? Freaks.
WarchiefGrumpy_0.context: NodeContext: excited, practically rubbing his hands. on tiefling variant, ending with 'freaks', dismissive and insulting to player

WarchiefGrumpy_1.speaker: Zurga
WarchiefGrumpy_1.text: Ya ever kill a tieflin'? I heard they got black, boilin' blood when ya slice 'em up.
WarchiefGrumpy_1.context: NodeContext: excited, practically rubbing his hands as he prepares for a fight against tieflings

WarchiefGrumpy_2.speaker: Zurga
WarchiefGrumpy_2.text: Last one I gutted looked just like you - ain't got any long lost sisters have you?
WarchiefGrumpy_2.context: NodeContext: speaking to a tiefling with many tiefling corpses nearby - cruelly amused on last line, but not hostile

WarchiefGrumpy_3.speaker: Zurga
WarchiefGrumpy_3.text: Ever wondered what devil flesh tastes like? My bet's on stench kow.
WarchiefGrumpy_3.context: NodeContext: excited and cruel. A little contemplative/disappointed during the last line. 'kow' is pronounced just like 'cow'.

AD_GrieflingOnGate_0.speaker: Arka
AD_GrieflingOnGate_0.text: All this bloody waiting. I'll go find those goblins myself if they don't appear soon.
AD_GrieflingOnGate_0.context: NodeContext: Keyed up, ready to fight

AD_GrieflingOnGate_1.speaker: Arka
AD_GrieflingOnGate_1.text: Any moment now... come on you zurgnak cowards, attack!
AD_GrieflingOnGate_1.context: NodeContext: zurgnak = infernal for 'fucking/damned'. Pronounced zurg-NAK. Keyed up, ready to fight

AD_GrieflingOnGate_2.speaker: Arka
AD_GrieflingOnGate_2.text: When will they attack? I've a score to settle.
AD_GrieflingOnGate_2.context: NodeContext: Keyed up, ready to fight

AD_GrieflingOnGate_3.speaker: Arka
AD_GrieflingOnGate_3.text: Come on, cowards. Time to pay for what you did to Kanon...
AD_GrieflingOnGate_3.context: NodeContext: Keyed up, ready to fight

Pet002_0.speaker: Silver
Pet002_0.text: I must protect him. I must.

Pet002_1.speaker: Silver
Pet002_1.text: Blood everywhere. The smell is so strong.

Pet002_2.speaker: Silver
Pet002_2.text: Quiet at last - don't interrupt it.
Pet002_2.context: NodeContext: calm wolf, after a battle

Pet002_4.speaker: Silver
Pet002_4.context: NodeContext: The wolf doesn't want to acknowledge us.

AD_HalsinJoinsFight_0.speaker: Halsin
AD_HalsinJoinsFight_0.text: You will not desecrate this grove! Not while I draw breath!
AD_HalsinJoinsFight_0.context: NodeContext: Outraged. Joining combat to defend his home.

HalsinReturns_8.speaker: Halsin
HalsinReturns_8.text: Your path will soon take you away from the grove, I feel. Your efforts will not be forgotten.

HalsinReturns_15.speaker: Halsin
HalsinReturns_15.text: With the leadership dead, no attack will be mounted on the grove. I am in your debt, my friend.

HalsinReturns_28.speaker: Halsin
HalsinReturns_28.text: The grove stands. Nature prevails. And again, I am in your debt.
HalsinReturns_28.context: NodeContext: Content and grateful. Looks around at his surrounds in general, happy to be home,

HalsinReturns_38.speaker: Halsin
HalsinReturns_38.text: Speak to Rath - he will reward you for your efforts.
HalsinReturns_38.context: NodeContext: Referring to one of his underlings

HalsinReturns_4.speaker: Player
HalsinReturns_4.text: What about my problem? I need to get to Moonrise Towers.

HalsinReturns_64.speaker: Halsin
HalsinReturns_64.text: Soon. Remember the dangers I told you about - there'll be plenty of time to face them.

HalsinReturns_13.speaker: Halsin
HalsinReturns_13.text: Take tonight to rest, recuperate - celebrate. Tomorrow, we can strike out.

HalsinReturns_17.speaker: Halsin
HalsinReturns_17.text: Take tonight to rest, recuperate - celebrate. Tomorrow, I'll join your camp so I can help with the trials yet to come.

HalsinReturns_9.speaker: Halsin
HalsinReturns_9.text: Soon. First I must set matters to rights in the grove. And you should celebrate your victory.

HalsinReturns_25.speaker: Halsin
HalsinReturns_25.text: After being dormant for so long, your infection is unlikely to produce new symptoms spontaneously.

HalsinReturns_55.speaker: Halsin
HalsinReturns_55.text: Tomorrow morning, we shall discuss what is to come.
HalsinReturns_55.context: NodeContext: This is a much anticipated converation that he's aluding to.

HalsinReturns_65.speaker: Player
HalsinReturns_65.text: No more delays. Tell me what you know about getting to Moonrise.

HalsinReturns_7.speaker: Player
HalsinReturns_7.text: I'm afraid your pupil, Kagha, is dead.

HalsinReturns_67.speaker: Player
HalsinReturns_67.text: Kagha is dead. She was swayed by Shadow Druids. I had no choice.

HalsinReturns_27.speaker: Halsin
HalsinReturns_27.text: Kagha... poor child. The grove will be a dimmer place without her potential.
HalsinReturns_27.context: NodeContext: Bowed head. Mournful, Kagha was misguided, but he'll miss her.,

HalsinReturns_41.speaker: Halsin
HalsinReturns_41.text: But you are right - you had no choice. I failed her, long before you arrived.
HalsinReturns_41.context: NodeContext: He doesn't blame the player

HalsinReturns_5.speaker: Halsin
HalsinReturns_5.text: The shadows could not have tempted her if I had taught her as I should have.

HalsinReturns_60.speaker: Halsin
HalsinReturns_60.text: But the grove still stands even if she does not - thanks to you.

HalsinReturns_14.speaker: Player
HalsinReturns_14.text: The other druids are dead. They turned on us - we had to defend ourselves.

HalsinReturns_58.speaker: Halsin
HalsinReturns_58.text: Yes, you did. You acted according to your instincts, to nature. This is my fault.
HalsinReturns_58.context: NodeContext: Mournful, bowed head. He blames himself rather than the player.

HalsinReturns_39.speaker: Halsin
HalsinReturns_39.text: I was not here to guide them. Now they rest forever, while I carry the weight of my failings.

HalsinReturns_34.speaker: Halsin
HalsinReturns_34.text: But the grove still stands even if they do not - thanks to you.

HalsinReturns_37.speaker: Player
HalsinReturns_37.text: I hope this grove of yours is worth the bloodshed.

HalsinReturns_22.speaker: Player
HalsinReturns_22.text: I found evidence that Kagha was going to betray this circle to the Shadow Druids.

HalsinReturns_45.speaker: Halsin
HalsinReturns_45.text: This goes some way to explaining her actions. But she has been punished already, and the Shadow Druids have no power over her now - time to let the wound heal.

HalsinReturns_57.speaker: Halsin
HalsinReturns_57.text: And thank you, for your dilligence.

HalsinReturns_24.speaker: Player
HalsinReturns_24.text: I found this letter that shows Kagha was working with the Shadow Druids.

HalsinReturns_44.speaker: Player
HalsinReturns_44.text: I hope this grove of yours was worth the bloodshed.

HalsinReturns_61.speaker: Halsin
HalsinReturns_61.text: Believe me, it is. The span of a mortal life isn't enough to grasp the importance of this place. Its roots touch everything.

HalsinReturns_20.speaker: Player
HalsinReturns_20.text: There's something else I wanted to ask about getting to Moonrise Towers.

HalsinReturns_36.speaker: Halsin
HalsinReturns_36.text: The journey to Moonrise Towers, and all the dangers that that entails.

HalsinReturns_63.speaker: Halsin
HalsinReturns_63.text: But that's tomorrow's problem. Take some time for yourself tonight - rest, celebrate. Come morning, I'll be by your side.

HalsinReturns_12.speaker: Halsin
HalsinReturns_12.text: Rest. Heal. Celebrate if you wish. Mourn if you must. Come morning, we shall discuss delivering you from your parasite.
HalsinReturns_12.context: NodeContext: 'We've been through a lot. Take some time to gather yourself'

HalsinReturns_48.speaker: Halsin
HalsinReturns_48.text: The grove stands. Nature prevails. I owe you my thanks - and an introduction.
HalsinReturns_48.context: NodeContext: Grateful. this is the first time Halsin has met you (if you missed him in the goblin camp)

HalsinReturns_2.speaker: Halsin
HalsinReturns_2.text: I am Halsin - First Druid of the Emerald Grove... and I sense you have a problem you seek my help with.
HalsinReturns_2.context: NodeContext: Knowing - referring to the player's tadpole problem

HalsinReturns_10.speaker: Player
HalsinReturns_10.text: I might go mad... I might be mad...

HalsinReturns_21.speaker: Halsin
HalsinReturns_21.text: Oakfather... a mind flayer spawn. You should be far gone by now.

HalsinReturns_47.speaker: Player
HalsinReturns_47.text: Yes. I have a mind flayer parasite inside my head. I want your help removing it.

HalsinReturns_35.speaker: Player
HalsinReturns_35.text: I don't know what you mean. What problem?

HalsinReturns_1.context: CinematicNodeContext: Halsin raises a hand to your head, magically connecting with you (no contact). He gives an alarmed look - he knows what’s inside you

HalsinReturns_56.speaker: Halsin
HalsinReturns_56.text: ...That problem. You're infected with the mind flayer spawn, aren't you? Oakfather preserve you, child.

HalsinReturns_3.speaker: Halsin
HalsinReturns_3.text: ...It's true. I can feel it right now. Oakfather preserve you, child.

HalsinReturns_62.speaker: Halsin
HalsinReturns_62.text: But... something's different. You're aware of the monster inside you. You don't bow to the Absolute, like the True Souls do...

HalsinReturns_42.speaker: Player
HalsinReturns_42.text: I can't remember anything... All my life before the parasite...

HalsinReturns_59.speaker: Halsin
HalsinReturns_59.text: It sounds as if you've been done a world of harm. Cling onto the life you yet have.

HalsinReturns_19.speaker: Player
HalsinReturns_19.text: I escaped from an illithid ship after being infected. Maybe the process was interrupted.

HalsinReturns_23.speaker: Halsin
HalsinReturns_23.text: Perhaps... but I wouldn't want to place all my faith in blind luck.

HalsinReturns_30.speaker: Halsin
HalsinReturns_30.text: It's no coincidence that we found each other, I'll wager? You're after a cure for this parasite.

HalsinReturns_43.speaker: Halsin
HalsinReturns_43.text: There's a chokehold of magic, binding the creature to you. Any efforts to remove it would almost certainly kill you - or worse.

HalsinReturns_53.speaker: Halsin
HalsinReturns_53.text: As for what you've done for the grove, speak to Rath. He will see to your reward.

HalsinReturns_52.speaker: Player
HalsinReturns_52.text: Wait - how did you get here?

HalsinReturns_31.speaker: Halsin
HalsinReturns_31.text: I was an unwilling guest of the goblins - but your efforts left them in disarray and I was able to escape.

HalsinReturns_50.speaker: Halsin
HalsinReturns_50.text: Enjoy the respite. Come morning, we have matters to discuss.

Servant004_0.speaker: Elwyn
Servant004_0.text: I didn't think we'd survive the goblins. I kept imagining the screams, the blood...
Servant004_0.context: NodeContext: She let fear get the better of her, and she's ashamed.

Servant004_1.speaker: Elwyn
Servant004_1.text: I feel like we can finally breathe. Thank you.
Servant004_1.context: NodeContext: The grove is no longer under attack. She can finally relax.

DruidOpposed_0.speaker: Rath
DruidOpposed_0.text: By your efforts, Silvanus' grace can be restored to the grove. May he always share your stride.

DruidOpposed_14.speaker: Rath
DruidOpposed_14.text: Nature is an endless cycle of death and rebirth. Silvanus' grace will return to us one day.

DruidOpposed_15.speaker: Rath
DruidOpposed_15.text: You've done it. You brought Halsin back. Thank you.
DruidOpposed_15.context: InternalNodeContext: NO HASMET, GIVE REWARDNodeContext: Deep, serious gratitude.

DruidOpposed_7.speaker: Rath
DruidOpposed_7.text: No, thanks is not enough. May Silvanus bless you for all your days.

DruidOpposed_2.speaker: Rath
DruidOpposed_2.text: I cannot imagine taking on a camp full of goblins was a simple task.

DruidOpposed_8.speaker: Player
DruidOpposed_8.text: For someone like me? It was pretty simple, actually.

DruidOpposed_16.speaker: Rath
DruidOpposed_16.text: Fair enough. I should not have underestimated you.

DruidOpposed_41.speaker: Player
DruidOpposed_41.text: Think nothing of it. I'm glad Halsin is safe.

DruidOpposed_9.speaker: Rath
DruidOpposed_9.text: As am I. The grove will be whole again.

DruidOpposed_27.speaker: Rath
DruidOpposed_27.text: And I promised you a reward, didn't I?

DruidOpposed_31.speaker: Player
DruidOpposed_31.text: It was a hell full of blood and ash.

DruidOpposed_10.speaker: Rath
DruidOpposed_10.text: To be expected. I am glad you survived intact.

DruidOpposed_39.speaker: Player
DruidOpposed_39.text: I'm just here for the reward.

DruidOpposed_12.speaker: Rath
DruidOpposed_12.text: Let me show you on your map where you can find the cache. Take this rune - you'll need it.
DruidOpposed_12.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gestures towards the player, offering a rune.NodeContext: Offering a rune-like key to the player for a reward.

DruidOpposed_5.speaker: Rath
DruidOpposed_5.text: Place it among the pedestals inside our library. When the wolf glows brightest, everything in the vault below will be yours.

DruidOpposed_13.speaker: Rath
