DruidOpposed_13.text: Where is the rune? My apologies. It seems to have been... taken.
DruidOpposed_13.context: CinematicNodeContext: Rath searching his clothes for the rune

DruidOpposed_42.speaker: Rath
DruidOpposed_42.text: Forgive me. I can only offer my gratitude, and pray Silvanus protects you on your journey.
DruidOpposed_42.context: CinematicNodeContext: Rath bowing his head respectfully.

DruidOpposed_18.speaker: Rath
DruidOpposed_18.text: May he rest in Summeroak forever. I...
DruidOpposed_18.context: InternalNodeContext: HALSIN IS DEADNodeContext: Grieving for Halsin, his mentor and close friend. Voice tapers off as his composure cracks.

DruidOpposed_11.speaker: Rath
DruidOpposed_11.text: ...I apologise. I must have some time to myself.
DruidOpposed_11.context: NodeContext: Grieving for Halsin, his mentor and close friend

DruidOpposed_21.speaker: Rath
DruidOpposed_21.text: With Halsin's return, you can feel the change in the air.
DruidOpposed_21.context: InternalNodeContext: HASMET, KAGHA DIED BECAUSE SHE BECAME A SHADOW DRUID

DruidOpposed_17.speaker: Rath
DruidOpposed_17.text: All the pain Kagha caused will heal with the season's turn, as it should be.

DruidOpposed_29.speaker: Rath
DruidOpposed_29.text: I am glad the goblins are no longer a threat. But where... where is Halsin?
DruidOpposed_29.context: InternalNodeContext: HALSIN WAS NEVER FOUNDNodeContext: Glad the goblins are gone, but still worried about his missing friend.

DruidOpposed_32.speaker: Rath
DruidOpposed_32.text: You've done it. You brought Halsin back.
DruidOpposed_32.context: InternalNodeContext: Deep, serious gratitude. But with extreme sadness since all other druids are dead.

DruidOpposed_20.speaker: Rath
DruidOpposed_20.text: I... I wish it did not feel too late. This grove is corrupt, its shepherds drowned in blood.

DruidOpposed_1.speaker: Rath
DruidOpposed_1.text: Forgive me. You triumphed over the goblins, and that cannot have been an easy task.

DruidOpposed_28.speaker: Player
DruidOpposed_28.text: After cutting through a grove of druids, goblins were simple.

DruidOpposed_36.speaker: Rath
DruidOpposed_36.text: They were people, not weeds. We all suffered under Kagha's wicked leadership.

DruidOpposed_47.speaker: Player
DruidOpposed_47.text: If it makes you feel any better, I found proof Kagha was allied with Shadow Druids.

DruidOpposed_26.speaker: Rath
DruidOpposed_26.text: That explains... a great deal, although I suppose her true allegiances no longer matter.

DruidOpposed_46.speaker: Rath
DruidOpposed_46.text: You have my deepest gratitude. I promised you a reward, did I not?

DruidOpposed_19.speaker: Player
DruidOpposed_19.text: I'm glad Halsin made it here, but I wish I could have helped more.

DruidOpposed_40.speaker: Rath
DruidOpposed_40.text: Seeing Halsin gives me the strength to endure everything else. You did the right thing.

DruidOpposed_33.speaker: Player
DruidOpposed_33.text: What will you do now? You're basically the only druid left.

DruidOpposed_37.speaker: Rath
DruidOpposed_37.text: I cannot abandon this place. By Silvanus' grace, I will remain here to serve as Halsin sees fit.

DruidOpposed_45.speaker: Player
DruidOpposed_45.text: It wasn't. So where's my reward?

DruidOpposed_34.speaker: Rath
DruidOpposed_34.text: Thanks to you, the grove is whole again.
DruidOpposed_34.context: InternalNodeContext: HASMET, KAGHA WAS CONFRONTED AND PERSUADEDNodeContext: Deep, serious gratitude.

DruidOpposed_35.speaker: Rath
DruidOpposed_35.text: Halsin will guide us forward, and Kagha's heart will heal. I have full faith in that.

DruidOpposed_48.speaker: Rath
DruidOpposed_48.text: Now that Halsin is here, Kagha will surely see sense.
DruidOpposed_48.context: InternalNodeContext: HASMET, KAGHA WAS NEVER CONFRONTED ABOUT THE SHADOW DRUID AGENDANodeContext: Relieved.

DruidOpposed_6.speaker: Rath
DruidOpposed_6.text: I hope whatever rot was lurking in her heart can be swiftly cut away.

DruidOpposed_30.speaker: Player
DruidOpposed_30.text: Kagha was allied with Shadow Druids. I have proof.

DruidOpposed_44.speaker: Rath
DruidOpposed_44.text: That... explains a great deal. To think that Kagha could fall to their corruption under Silvanus' gaze.
DruidOpposed_44.context: NodeContext: Shocked, but then turning to frustration.

DruidOpposed_24.speaker: Rath
DruidOpposed_24.text: But I will leave that for Halsin to judge. He is First Druid, and I will not gainsay him as Kagha has done.

AD_HideoutLeaderInstructions_4.speaker: Mol
AD_HideoutLeaderInstructions_4.text: We're not in the clear yet. Keep sharp until we're standing on cobbles in Baldur's Gate.

AD_HideoutLeaderInstructions_5.speaker: Mol
AD_HideoutLeaderInstructions_5.text: What's this? Mattis, this is junk! Waste of effort hauling it with us.

AD_HideoutLeaderInstructions_2.speaker: Mattis
AD_HideoutLeaderInstructions_2.text: No, there's collectors in the city! They'll pay good coin for it, I swear!

AD_HideoutLeaderInstructions_3.speaker: Mol
AD_HideoutLeaderInstructions_3.text: Fine, but you're carrying it yourself.

AD_HideoutLeaderInstructions_7.speaker: Mol
AD_HideoutLeaderInstructions_7.text: Right, all of our takings stashed away for the journey?

AD_HideoutLeaderInstructions_6.speaker: Mol
AD_HideoutLeaderInstructions_6.text: Better be sure. We need every last copper piece to get started in Baldur's Gate.

TorturedAdventurer_0.speaker: Narrator
TorturedAdventurer_0.text: *Despite the chaos in the camp, the adventurer sleeps soundly, wounds expertly bandaged.*

RitualDruid002_0.speaker: Karrik
RitualDruid002_0.text: After everything that's happened, you still fought beside us.
RitualDruid002_0.context: NodeContext: Players were antagonised initially by the druids, yet still fought alongside them against a horde of attacking goblins.

RitualDruid002_2.speaker: Karrik
RitualDruid002_2.text: I don't know if we deserved your help, but I'm glad we got it.
RitualDruid002_2.context: NodeContext: Players were antagonised initially by the druids, yet still fought alongside them against a horde of attacking goblins.

RitualDruid002_1.speaker: Karrik
RitualDruid002_1.text: I hope we learn from this. We have to.
RitualDruid002_1.context: NodeContext: The grove was nearly destroyed by infighting and goblins - Karrik doesn't want it to happen again.

AD_Prodigies_0.speaker: Rolan
AD_Prodigies_0.text: My powers are being wasted back here! I could repel any attack in the blink of an eye.

AD_Prodigies_3.speaker: Lia
AD_Prodigies_3.text: Or wipe us out in the blink of an eye. Best you stay right here.

AD_Prodigies_1.speaker: Rolan
AD_Prodigies_1.text: Ridiculous. Someone of my skill should choose their own vantage point.

AD_Prodigies_2.speaker: Cal
AD_Prodigies_2.text: She just means you're our last hope, Rolan. We, eh, may need you to save the day.

Sapper_003_0.speaker: Sapper Dextor
Sapper_003_0.text: Don't be nickin' the best loot for yerself.
Sapper_003_0.context: NodeContext: they just massacred their enemies - he's being cheeky rather than hostile

Sapper_003_1.speaker: Sapper Dextor
Sapper_003_1.context: NodeContext: YELLING AS HE PREPARES TO CHARGE

AD_TrainerAtBarricade_4.speaker: Asharak
AD_TrainerAtBarricade_4.text: I suppose it's a pity to tear down trees for this.
AD_TrainerAtBarricade_4.context: NodeContext: Surveying a barricade she's made to protect against goblins.

AD_TrainerAtBarricade_1.speaker: Kaldani
AD_TrainerAtBarricade_1.text: Seems a good use of them, to me.

AD_TrainerAtBarricade_2.speaker: Asharak
AD_TrainerAtBarricade_2.text: Don't think Halsin'd fancy us pulling up his grove.
AD_TrainerAtBarricade_2.context: NodeContext: Vague guilt, concern - Halsin sheltered them and they're destroying his home to survive

AD_TrainerAtBarricade_0.speaker: Kaldani
AD_TrainerAtBarricade_0.text: Ah. Hadn't actually thought of that.
AD_TrainerAtBarricade_0.context: NodeContext: Caught by surprise, realising the implications.

AD_TrainerAtBarricade_8.speaker: Asharak
AD_TrainerAtBarricade_8.text: Torm spare me, that thing looks fearsome.

AD_TrainerAtBarricade_3.speaker: Asharak
AD_TrainerAtBarricade_3.text: Depends which side of it you're standing on, I suppose.

Trainer_12.speaker: Asharak
Trainer_12.text: On to the city. After what you showed us, I damn well pity any who try and keep us out.

Trainer_20.speaker: Asharak
Trainer_20.text: Well - are we ready? Tymora's spun her coin, and I would see which way it lands.

Trainer_53.speaker: Player
Trainer_53.text: As we'll ever be. Let's go.

Trainer_32.speaker: Asharak
Trainer_32.text: Let the bastards know we're waiting for them.

Trainer_10.speaker: Player
Trainer_10.text: Hold on - what's the plan again?

Trainer_6.speaker: Asharak
Trainer_6.text: Simplest strategy there is: draw them in and burn them faster than they can burn us.

Trainer_100.speaker: Asharak
Trainer_100.text: Sound the horn - let the bastards know we're waiting for them.

Trainer_36.speaker: Player
Trainer_36.text: Give me a moment. I have more to do.

Trainer_72.speaker: Asharak
Trainer_72.text: Aye, fair enough. Just don't take too long.

Trainer_43.speaker: Asharak
Trainer_43.text: I'd sooner start this on our terms than theirs.

Trainer_31.speaker: Asharak
Trainer_31.text: Won't pretend I expected to see you back again. Bloody glad, mind.

Trainer_95.speaker: Asharak
Trainer_95.text: People are scared. Zevlor's doing what he can, but...

Trainer_96.speaker: Asharak
Trainer_96.text: Well. Seeing you on the walls might put the steel in their spines. Mine, too.

Trainer_33.speaker: Asharak
Trainer_33.text: We're ready to celebrate. Are you?

Trainer_108.speaker: Player
Trainer_108.text: I'm ready to go to camp now.

Trainer_18.speaker: Asharak
Trainer_18.text: Best news I've heard all day.

Trainer_71.speaker: Player
Trainer_71.text: I'll let you know when I'm ready.

Trainer_59.speaker: Asharak
Trainer_59.text: Gods, thought I was seeing a bloody ghost. How did you survive the goblin camp?

Trainer_106.speaker: Asharak
Trainer_106.text: More importantly - what happened? We've spotted them massing in the woods.

Trainer_41.speaker: Asharak
Trainer_41.text: My students are down in the cave. With wooden bloody swords, Torm spare me.
Trainer_41.context: NodeContext: Resigned - never thought he'd be training children to fight.

Trainer_47.speaker: Asharak
Trainer_47.text: We've just got word - the goblins have cleared out. And I hear it's you we have to thank.
Trainer_47.context: NodeContext: Delighted - impressed and proud of you.

Trainer_30.speaker: Asharak
Trainer_30.text: Here - it's not much, but it's yours. Zevlor ordered a collection, before...
Trainer_30.context: NodeContext: Giving us a reward, and being reminded that his leader is either dead or disappeared. Trailing off to a painful memory (pulling himself back to the present in his next lines)

Trainer_83.speaker: Asharak
Trainer_83.text: Before he passed. But the time for mourning's done. I mean to celebrate.
Trainer_83.context: NodeContext: First sentence stating a painful truth about their leader having died, but firmly pulling himself back to be pragmatic and positive.

Trainer_84.speaker: Asharak
Trainer_84.text: Though - you might want to speak to Halsin first. He turned up a short while ago.

Trainer_56.speaker: Asharak
Trainer_56.text: He's having words with Kagha. Reckon you don't want to miss that, but come find us after.

Trainer_70.speaker: Asharak
Trainer_70.text: My people would be honoured to join your camp tonight, if you'll have us. We're ready to go when you are.

Trainer_69.speaker: Asharak
Trainer_69.text: Watching gods - while I was training children, you were out cutting down an entire goblin camp.

Trainer_74.speaker: Asharak
Trainer_74.text: Wyll told me you gave us up to the goblins - bloody glad he had it wrong.
Trainer_74.context: NodeContext: Grimly relieved - he's found out you're on his side. Wyll = Will

Trainer_54.speaker: Asharak
Trainer_54.text: We'll need every blade if we're to make a fight of this.

Trainer_75.speaker: Asharak
Trainer_75.text: You've cleared the way for us - as clear as it gets, anyway. Thank you.

Trainer_76.speaker: Asharak
Trainer_76.text: Watching gods, but you're a prettier sight than any I expected to see today.
Trainer_76.context: NodeContext: He's relieved to see you, but warning of the impending attack - player might just have jumped out of the frying pan and into the fire.

Trainer_24.speaker: Asharak
Trainer_24.text: I'd given you up for dead at the goblin camp - and our hopes along with you.

Trainer_14.speaker: Asharak
Trainer_14.text: What happened?! We've spotted goblins massing in the woods.

Trainer_66.speaker: Player
Trainer_66.text: I met the drow commanding them - and led her here.

Trainer_62.speaker: Asharak
Trainer_62.text: A... a drow? Why the hells would you bring her here?

Trainer_46.speaker: Player
Trainer_46.text: She tricked me. But I mean to make up for it.

Trainer_60.speaker: Asharak
Trainer_60.text: 'Make up for it'? How the bloody hells -

Trainer_29.speaker: Asharak
Trainer_29.text: Gods damn it, I'm sorry. I know you wouldn't draw her on us.

Trainer_90.speaker: Asharak
Trainer_90.text: Not after you've already saved us once before. We'll need your help again now.

Trainer_28.speaker: Player
Trainer_28.text: All part of the plan. I'll give the signal and she'll march into our trap.

Trainer_81.speaker: Asharak
Trainer_81.text: Trap a drow? Easier trap a spider in its own damned web!

Trainer_79.speaker: Player
Trainer_79.text: It's a trap - and she's waiting for my signal. Don't quibble with me now.

Trainer_27.speaker: Asharak
Trainer_27.text: A trap? We're the ones backed into a corner here, I'd say.

Trainer_78.speaker: Asharak
Trainer_78.text: But... aye, I trust you, Torm spare me. You've seen us right once before.

Trainer_68.speaker: Asharak
Trainer_68.text: If we've got any chance at all, it'll be with you on our side.

Trainer_17.speaker: Player
Trainer_17.text: To burn the grove, of course. For the glory of the Absolute.

Trainer_89.speaker: Player
Trainer_89.text: It's a full war-band, led by a drow.

Trainer_37.speaker: Asharak
Trainer_37.text: ...A drow. Right - I'd say I'm surprised, but Beshaba's had her mark on us since Elturel.
Trainer_37.context: NodeContext: You've just told him he's facing insurmountable odds, and he's reacting with fear but resigned pragmatism. His outlook tends to be of the 'Murphy's Law' variety

Trainer_19.speaker: Asharak
Trainer_19.text: No two ways about it, now - a fight it'll have to be.
Trainer_19.context: NodeContext: Fatalistic, discarding any hope of escape but steeling himself for the fight

Trainer_98.speaker: Asharak
Trainer_98.text: You helped us throw them back once before - fancy doing it again?
Trainer_98.context: NodeContext: Forced lightness, camraderie - he needs you to say yes

Trainer_88.speaker: Player
Trainer_88.text: Their drow commander found the grove - and she means to take it.

Trainer_109.speaker: Asharak
Trainer_109.text: ...A drow. Right - I'd say I'm surprised, but Beshaba's had her mark on us since Elturel.
Trainer_109.context: NodeContext: You've just told him he's facing insurmountable odds, and he's reacting with fear but resigned pragmatism. His outlook tends to be of the 'Murphy's Law' variety

Trainer_80.speaker: Asharak
Trainer_80.text: You don't owe us any apologies - but I'll take your help, if you're offering.

Trainer_2.speaker: Player
Trainer_2.text: No, you don't get it. I'm with them.

Trainer_1.speaker: Wyll
Trainer_1.text: No - you can't! I trusted you!
Trainer_1.context: NodeContext: Upset, the player has given up the entire tiefling grove for slaughter.

Trainer_93.speaker: Wyll
Trainer_93.text: Traitor. The Blade now comes for you.

Trainer_91.speaker: Asharak
Trainer_91.context: NodeContext: It takes him a moment to realise what he's being told - that the player has betrayed them and sided with the goblins.

Trainer_77.speaker: Asharak
Trainer_77.text: You've turned on us? Hells, why?

Trainer_39.speaker: Player
Trainer_39.text: I have a god to please, and Bhaal loves murder.

Trainer_44.speaker: Player
Trainer_44.text: I have a god to please, and Myrkul loves a slaughter.

Trainer_67.speaker: Player
Trainer_67.text: I have a god to please, and Bhaal loves murder.

Trainer_23.speaker: Player
Trainer_23.text: I have a god to please, and Myrkul loves a slaughter.

Trainer_50.speaker: Asharak
Trainer_50.text: Well to the hells with you - and your god and all. Guards! Weapons!

Trainer_65.speaker: Player
Trainer_65.text: Simple - the goblins are a lot more useful to me.

Trainer_16.speaker: Player
Trainer_16.text: For the glory of the Absolute. Why else?

Trainer_64.speaker: Asharak
Trainer_64.text: Well to the hells with you, then. Guards - weapons!

Trainer_4.speaker: Player
Trainer_4.text: What do you think? Ready for battle - and leave the drow to me.

Trainer_104.speaker: Asharak
Trainer_104.text: ...A drow. Right - I'd say I'm surprised, but Beshaba's had her mark on us since Elturel.
Trainer_104.context: NodeContext: You've just told him he's facing insurmountable odds, and he's reacting with fear but resigned pragmatism. His outlook tends to be of the 'Murphy's Law' variety

Trainer_25.speaker: Asharak
Trainer_25.text: But if you're willing to spit in Lady Doom's eye along with us, I won't turn you down.

Trainer_13.speaker: Asharak
Trainer_13.text: Who knows - with your help, might be we can even make a fight of it.

Trainer_61.speaker: Player
Trainer_61.text: Of course. Tell me what you need.

Trainer_15.speaker: Asharak
Trainer_15.text: Hah! Enough warriors to make this a fair fight. Failing that, we've got the means to make it unfair.
Trainer_15.context: NodeContext: Faint, joking - forced humour but knows no-one is buying it

Trainer_7.speaker: Asharak
Trainer_7.text: That's why our every ounce of anything that goes boom is buried out in front of that gate.

Trainer_107.speaker: Asharak
Trainer_107.text: Once we're ready, we'll draw 'em in to that spot. Then it's down to fire-arrows and prayer.

Trainer_102.speaker: Player
Trainer_102.text: We'll have to lure them in first.

Trainer_86.speaker: Asharak
Trainer_86.text: You said it's a drow in charge, yeah? They ain't stupid, so I hear - but they are proud.

Trainer_5.speaker: Player
Trainer_5.text: A bold plan - but a risky one.

Trainer_58.speaker: Asharak
Trainer_58.text: Not so risky. Drow are cunning buggers, aye - but proud too, the way I hear it.

Trainer_22.speaker: Asharak
Trainer_22.text: That horn can be heard half the world away - let's issue a challenge, eh?
Trainer_22.context: NodeContext: Acknowledging his plan is terrible but knows it's the only option.

Trainer_82.speaker: Player
Trainer_82.text: That's it? Please tell me you've thought of another option.

Trainer_57.speaker: Asharak
Trainer_57.text: Burning drow sounds a pretty good option to me - but we'll have to get her here first.
Trainer_57.context: NodeContext: Firm. He's reached a decision, even if it is a dangeorus one.

Trainer_0.speaker: Asharak
Trainer_0.text: That horn can be heard half the world away - let's issue a challenge, shall we?

Trainer_85.speaker: Asharak
Trainer_85.text: She's expecting to find us broken - let's show her just what a mistake she's made.

Trainer_55.speaker: Wyll
Trainer_55.text: Come. It's time to paint the place red.

Trainer_8.speaker: Player
Trainer_8.text: That's the stupidest damn plan I've ever heard.

Trainer_97.speaker: Asharak
Trainer_97.text: No doubt - but thick as I might be, I reckon this drow is likely twice as proud.
Trainer_97.context: NodeContext: Smiling, laughing, acknowledging his plan is terrible but knows it's the only option.

Trainer_40.speaker: Asharak
Trainer_40.text: Fact is, we can't beat 'em - not in a fair fight. So best make it as unfair as possible, eh?

Trainer_92.speaker: Player
Trainer_92.text: You've reinforced the place - those barricades might even hold.

Trainer_73.speaker: Asharak
Trainer_73.text: Oh aye, we've been busy. Fact is, we won't win in a fair fight - so best make it as unfair as we can.

Trainer_87.speaker: Asharak
Trainer_87.text: To think I was scared of a bloody drow. Should've known better - we had you.

Trainer_34.speaker: Asharak
Trainer_34.text: Gods, they're going to want a bloody speech, aren't they?

Trainee003_0.speaker: Gan
Trainee003_0.text: Just shout if you need help up there.
Trainee003_0.context: NodeContext: Confident, takes self very seriously

Trainee003_1.speaker: Gan
Trainee003_1.text: I know people are hurt, but don't worry. I'll guard them on the road.

Trainee003_3.speaker: Gan
Trainee003_3.text: I hate you. You killed all the goblins and now we can't practise swords anymore.

Trainee003_4.speaker: Gan
Trainee003_4.text: I wanted to fight, like you. Now they're just going to make me feed the animals again.

Trainee003_5.speaker: Gan
Trainee003_5.text: You should be manning the wall. I wanted to, but Asharak says I'm needed here.

Trainee003_6.speaker: Gan
Trainee003_6.text: Everyone looks so tired. You should have let me help.

LockdownDrow_2.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
LockdownDrow_2.text: The druids' enchantment is impassable. You should have killed them before they sealed their grove.

LockdownDrow_5.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
LockdownDrow_5.text: You are alive? Not for long.
LockdownDrow_5.context: NodeContext: first phrase with slight surprise, second with a sneer

LockdownDrow_8.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
LockdownDrow_8.text: Your overeagerness to spill blood has led the inhabitants to cower behind this enchantment.

LockdownDrow_7.speaker: Player
LockdownDrow_7.text: You can't blame me for this - the druids' magic is stronger than I expected.

LockdownDrow_6.speaker: Player
LockdownDrow_6.text: I'm sorry - what can I do to make this right?

LockdownDrow_13.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
LockdownDrow_13.text: Die quickly. I have squandered enough time on you already.
LockdownDrow_13.context: NodeContext: disgusted - responding to a player asking how they can get her forgiveness. She's about to order the player's execution

LockdownDrow_9.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
LockdownDrow_9.text: Your orders were to infiltrate this place so we could purge it together.
LockdownDrow_9.context: NodeContext: Military commander style, quietly furious, expecting an explanation

LockdownDrow_0.speaker: Player
LockdownDrow_0.text: An enchantment seals the gates - the druids are stronger than I expected.

LockdownDrow_3.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
LockdownDrow_3.text: And you are weaker than I hoped.

LockdownDrow_1.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
LockdownDrow_1.context: NodeContext: with a shrug - about to order our execution

LockdownDrow_12.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
LockdownDrow_12.context: CinematicNodeContext: turns back and walks away from player as she gives the orderNodeContext: raised voice, projecting to surrounding goblins as she walks away from the player

RaiderBossy_0.speaker: Goblin Sharp-Eye
RaiderBossy_0.text: I see a lot o' red blades around; the Absolute'll be chuffed.

RaiderBossy_1.speaker: Goblin Sharp-Eye
RaiderBossy_1.text: That's the last of 'em! Ground's sopping with heretic blood!

DruidLeader_10.speaker: Kagha
DruidLeader_10.text: This is only the beginning. An army soon crosses the coast.
DruidLeader_10.context: NodeContext: Kagha still evil or evil-ish.

DruidLeader_13.speaker: Kagha
DruidLeader_13.text: This is only the beginning. An army soon crosses the coast.
DruidLeader_13.context: NodeContext: Kagha still evil or evil-ish.

DruidLeader_14.speaker: Kagha
DruidLeader_14.text: This is only the beginning. An army soon crosses the coast.
DruidLeader_14.context: NodeContext: Kagha still evil or evil-ish.

DruidLeader_0.speaker: Kagha
DruidLeader_0.text: I've cancelled the rite. The circle must heal.

DruidLeader_24.speaker: Kagha
DruidLeader_24.text: But I won't sacrifice our future to the screaming horde. While I still breathe, this grove will not come to harm.

DruidLeader_20.speaker: Kagha
DruidLeader_20.text: This is only the beginning. An army soon crosses the coast.

DruidLeader_12.speaker: Kagha
DruidLeader_12.text: If only Halsin were still here to guide us. Silvanus willing, we might heal without him.

DruidLeader_21.speaker: Kagha
DruidLeader_21.text: This is only the beginning. An army soon crosses the coast.

DruidLeader_16.speaker: Kagha
DruidLeader_16.text: Silvanus willing, we might heal before then.

DruidLeader_25.speaker: Kagha
DruidLeader_25.text: This is only the beginning. An army soon crosses the coast.

DruidLeader_26.speaker: Kagha
DruidLeader_26.text: This is only the beginning. An army soon crosses the coast.
DruidLeader_26.context: NodeContext: Kagha still evil or evil-ish.

DruidLeader_2.speaker: Kagha
DruidLeader_2.text: Halsin's cancelled the rite. The brood is exposed. And we've you to thank, Silvanus have pity.
DruidLeader_2.context: NodeContext: Sarcastic "and we've YOU to thank"

DruidLeader_5.speaker: Player
DruidLeader_5.text: Enough of the act. I've learned of your alliance with Shadow Druids.

DruidLeader_8.speaker: Kagha
DruidLeader_8.text: Have you now? And you thought you should tell me?

DruidLeader_17.speaker: Kagha
DruidLeader_17.text: We will execute the Rite of Thorns, and you will give no more complaint. In fact...

DruidLeader_19.speaker: Kagha
DruidLeader_19.text: ...you will be gone before the sun next sets on the grove.

DruidLeader_23.speaker: Player
DruidLeader_23.text: As you will. I'll go in peace.

DruidLeader_27.speaker: Kagha
DruidLeader_27.text: This is only the beginning. An army soon crosses the coast.

DruidLeader_11.speaker: Kagha
DruidLeader_11.text: With Halsin back, at least the grove might stand a chance. And we've you to thank.

PAD_DeadKids_0.speaker: Player
PAD_DeadKids_0.text: Butchered. They didn't stand a chance.
PAD_DeadKids_0.context: NodeContext: Shadowheart - her actions led to these childrens' deaths and her background as a dark priestess would suggest she'd feel triumphant, but her reaction is instead deflated and betays conflicted emotions (while not being entirely despairing). She got what she thought she wanted, but it feels hollow. / Astarion - bitterly. He's a little surprised that he's unhappy about it.

AD_LootingGoblins_0.speaker: Sharp-Eye Zami
AD_LootingGoblins_0.text: Nah. Raggedy bastards ain't got anythin' worth stealin'. 'Cept their horns.
AD_LootingGoblins_0.context: NodeContext: annoyed at lack of good loot - the 'horns' are the horns of tiefling characters these goblins just murdered

AD_LootingGoblins_2.speaker: Skrut
AD_LootingGoblins_2.text: I'll swap you six kiddy horns for that big one you carved off the old fella.
AD_LootingGoblins_2.context: NodeContext: malicious; talking about the horns of dead tieflings

AD_LootingGoblins_3.speaker: Skrut
AD_LootingGoblins_3.text: Nah. Gonna use that for a flagon.
AD_LootingGoblins_3.context: NodeContext: brushing off his friend's barter - the thing he's talking about is a tiefling horn

EntranceMeeting_5.speaker: Asharak
EntranceMeeting_5.context: NodeContext: Shouting drill sergeant style to archers along the wall.

EntranceMeeting_4.speaker: Asharak
EntranceMeeting_4.text: Are you bloody mad? We nearly -
EntranceMeeting_4.context: NodeContext: Shouting down to player, relieved at the near miss but irritated all the same

EntranceMeeting_6.speaker: Asharak
EntranceMeeting_6.text: Never mind. Get up here. I want that gate closed when the goblins arrive.

EntranceMeeting_0.speaker: Zevlor
EntranceMeeting_0.context: CinematicNodeContext: to guards on wall (behind and at same level)NodeContext: Shouting to guards on wall (behind and at same level)

EntranceMeeting_1.speaker: Zevlor
EntranceMeeting_1.text: Gods above, we took you for a goblin. Get up here.

EntranceMeeting_3.speaker: Zevlor
EntranceMeeting_3.text: I want that gate sealed before they arrive - and we need to talk.
EntranceMeeting_3.context: NodeContext: Quickly back to his usual, restrained self.

Griefling_0.speaker: Arka
Griefling_0.text: I'm ready for this - I'd rather die fighting than with an arrow in my back.
Griefling_0.context: NodeContext: Deep breath at beginning of line - pysching herself up

Griefling_1.speaker: Arka
Griefling_1.text: Wish I'd been with you - would have killed a few goblins myself.
Griefling_1.context: NodeContext: mournful - Kanon (pronounced 'canon') died during a previous raid

Griefling_2.speaker: Arka
Griefling_2.text: It won't bring the dead back... but that felt good.
Griefling_2.context: NodeContext: relieved - the fight's over. they won.

Griefling_3.speaker: Arka
Griefling_3.text: You killed the goblins? Hope you made them suffer.
Griefling_3.context: NodeContext: relieved - the fight's over. they won.

Griefling_4.speaker: Arka
Griefling_4.context: NodeContext: mournful - Kanon (pronounced 'canon') died during a previous raid

OpenGateBetrayal_4.speaker: Asharak
OpenGateBetrayal_4.context: NodeContext: Shouted to the player, who has opened a gate during a siege, allowing the attackers to get inside. The speaker is the leader of the defense, who thought the player was on his side.

OpenGateBetrayal_2.speaker: Asharak
OpenGateBetrayal_2.text: Oh, mrag. You sold us out? To the bloody drow?
OpenGateBetrayal_2.context: NodeContext: The player has just betrayed him during a battle, and the realisation hits him. He's doomed and still trying to deny it to himself. Pronounced mRAG

OpenGateBetrayal_3.speaker: Asharak
OpenGateBetrayal_3.text: Birna mrag. May the crows feed on you, you godsdamned turncoat!
OpenGateBetrayal_3.context: CinematicNodeContext: Speaking to the other tieflings defending the grove rather than to the playerNodeContext: Speaking to the defenders during a siege and referring to the player characters as 'traitors'. He's in the middle of a fight and the player just switched sides and betrayed him. Pronounced BIRna mRAG

OpenGateBetrayal_5.speaker: Zevlor
OpenGateBetrayal_5.text: Are you mad?! Close the gate before -
OpenGateBetrayal_5.context: NodeContext: incredulous - speaking to the player, who just opened the gate during a siege, effectively letting the attackers swam in and kill him and the people he's trying to protect

OpenGateBetrayal_0.speaker: Zevlor
OpenGateBetrayal_0.context: NodeContext: incredulous - speaking to the player, who just opened the gate during a siege, effectively letting the attackers swam in and kill him and the people he's trying to protect. At this moment, realising this was a betrayal of the worst sort, and he's doomed. Second line is delivered to alert other guards rather than shouted to self.

OpenGateBetrayal_1.speaker: Zevlor
OpenGateBetrayal_1.text: Birna mrag. May the crows feed on you, you godsdamned zurgnak bastard!
OpenGateBetrayal_1.context: NodeContext: The player has just betrayed him during a siege, allowing the attackers to swarm in. At this point, he knows he's probably going to die, but he's determined to take the player with him. Pronounce ZURg-NAK

AD_BetrayedLeader_0.speaker: Zevlor
AD_BetrayedLeader_0.context: NodeContext: Terrified but furious - player has just betrayed him and let monsters in to attack innocent civilians. He's normally reserved but is determined to kill you for this.

RaiderViolent_0.speaker: Goblin Sharp-Eye
RaiderViolent_0.text: Geroff. These're my music boxes - find yer own.

RaiderViolent_1.speaker: Goblin Sharp-Eye
RaiderViolent_1.text: Get ready. Or the fun'll be over before you get any of it.

RitualDruid001_0.speaker: Aelar
RitualDruid001_0.text: None of this feels real. Not yet.
RitualDruid001_0.context: NodeContext: So much has happened in such a short time - infighting among the druids, her first druid disappearing, goblins attacking the grove - it's all a bit surreal.

RitualDruid001_1.speaker: Aelar
RitualDruid001_1.text: Goblins at our gates... you spared us a nightmare.
RitualDruid001_1.context: NodeContext: Player has just defeated a horde of goblins that attacked the grove.

RaiderHardy_0.speaker: Brawler Gurd
RaiderHardy_0.context: NodeContext: charging into combat or actively participating in combat. A warcry.

RaiderHardy_1.speaker: Brawler Gurd
RaiderHardy_1.text: Drow'll be pleased with us - proper good raid, that was.
RaiderHardy_1.context: NodeContext: Standing over the corpses of slaughtered enemies - pleased with himself, and his squad. Deferential toward the drow who was their commander

ElevatorBear_0.speaker: Tuffet
ElevatorBear_0.context: CinematicNodeContext: She has a very big yawn between finally and quiet. She's still half asleep.NodeContext: She has a very big yawn between finally and quiet. She's still half asleep.

AD_WarchiefAndPotions_2.speaker: Rozzak
AD_WarchiefAndPotions_2.text: Oi! That stuff ain't for you!
AD_WarchiefAndPotions_2.context: NodeContext: sees minions drinking potions, annoyed with them

AD_WarchiefAndPotions_1.speaker: Booyahg Benta
AD_WarchiefAndPotions_1.text: We only drank one! And it churned up our guts somethin' rotten.
AD_WarchiefAndPotions_1.context: NodeContext: wincing in pain, trying to make excuses

EntranceMeetingWyll_7.speaker: Narrator
EntranceMeetingWyll_7.context: CinematicNodeContext: | *The men turned towards player, hand at their swords.* |

EntranceMeetingWyll_18.speaker: Wyll
EntranceMeetingWyll_18.text: Give me one reason why they shouldn't slay you where you stand.

EntranceMeetingWyll_21.speaker: Player
EntranceMeetingWyll_21.text: You need all the help you can get. Now stand down before I put you down.

EntranceMeetingWyll_0.speaker: Wyll
EntranceMeetingWyll_0.text: Fine - one last chance. See that you don't waste it.

EntranceMeetingWyll_16.speaker: Wyll
EntranceMeetingWyll_16.text: Inside, and hurry. I want that gate closed when the goblins get here.

EntranceMeetingWyll_22.speaker: Wyll
EntranceMeetingWyll_22.text: You had your chance, and you wasted it.

EntranceMeetingWyll_19.speaker: Wyll
EntranceMeetingWyll_19.text: In the name of the Blade, attack!

EntranceMeetingWyll_14.speaker: Player
EntranceMeetingWyll_14.text: I'm here to help. But not afraid to fight.

EntranceMeetingWyll_13.speaker: Player
EntranceMeetingWyll_13.text: The goblins are on their way. I've led them right into your trap.

EntranceMeetingWyll_4.speaker: Wyll
EntranceMeetingWyll_4.context: NodeContext: Slightly angry, but coming around.

EntranceMeetingWyll_3.speaker: Wyll
EntranceMeetingWyll_3.text: I hate to admit it, but... it's a good plan. Looks like the team's back together.

EntranceMeetingWyll_9.speaker: Narrator
EntranceMeetingWyll_9.context: CinematicNodeContext: | *The men turned towards player, hand at their swords.* |

ProdigyBrother_0.speaker: Cal
ProdigyBrother_0.text: Glad to see some goblin blood spilled for a change. I was sick of running from those rats.

ProdigyBrother_1.speaker: Cal
ProdigyBrother_1.text: The roads ought to be safer now there's a few less goblins skulking about.

RaiderCrafty_0.speaker: Warrior Trunk
RaiderCrafty_0.text: All these horns'll make fer good trophies... uh, no offence.
RaiderCrafty_0.context: NodeContext: The horns referred to are on the heads of recently slaughtered tiefling refugees, killed in a goblin raid. He's standing among the dead, pleased with the victory - his second phrase is an embarrassed acknowledgement of the fact he's talking to a tiefling ally

RaiderCrafty_1.speaker: Warrior Trunk
RaiderCrafty_1.context: NodeContext: The horns referred to are on the heads of a group of tiefling refugees that the goblin is rushing into battle against. This is a war cry

RaiderCrafty_2.speaker: Warrior Trunk
RaiderCrafty_2.text: All these horns'll make fer good trophies.
RaiderCrafty_2.context: NodeContext: The horns referred to are on the heads of recently slaughtered tiefling refugees, killed in a goblin raid. He's standing among the dead, pleased with the victory.

VoloBear_0.speaker: Bosk
VoloBear_0.text: You smell like blood. Like fighting. Be gone.
VoloBear_0.context: NodeContext: The bear smells the blood from the battlefield on you.

VoloBear_1.speaker: Bosk
VoloBear_1.text: It smells like blood. Like thick, tainted blood. We should leave. We should all leave.

AD_RaidersAtPool_3.speaker: Goblin Sharp-Eye
AD_RaidersAtPool_3.context: CinematicNodeContext: Goblins ready themselves at the pool.

AD_RaidersAtPool_2.speaker: Goblin Sharp-Eye
AD_RaidersAtPool_2.context: CinematicNodeContext: Futzing around with his pants.

AD_RaidersAtPool_7.speaker: Sharp-Eye Sneem
AD_RaidersAtPool_7.context: CinematicNodeContext: Hopping around a bit - he very much has to pee, and the sound of the waterfall is making it all the more urgent.

AD_RaidersAtPool_12.speaker: Sharp-Eye Sneem
AD_RaidersAtPool_12.context: CinematicNodeContext: He starts peeing before the others.NodeContext: Half pain and half relief. Finally, he can pee.

AD_RaidersAtPool_5.speaker: Goblin Sharp-Eye
AD_RaidersAtPool_5.context: CinematicNodeContext: The rest of the goblins begin to pee.

AD_RaidersAtPool_8.speaker: Sharp-Eye Sneem
AD_RaidersAtPool_8.context: CinematicNodeContext: Dancing around a bit as he fastens up the pants.

AD_RaidersAtPool_0.speaker: Goblin Sharp-Eye
AD_RaidersAtPool_0.text: Cheat! You was sneakin' ale the whole time!
AD_RaidersAtPool_0.context: CinematicNodeContext: Turns and points at his mate accusatorily.

AD_RaidersAtPool_13.speaker: Sharp-Eye Sneem
AD_RaidersAtPool_13.context: CinematicNodeContext: Puts his hands on his hips defensively.NodeContext: Sounding rather haughty.

AD_RaidersAtPool_9.speaker: Goblin Sharp-Eye
AD_RaidersAtPool_9.text: It don't count. It don't count!
AD_RaidersAtPool_9.context: CinematicNodeContext: Stomping. He is mad.NodeContext: Frustrated.

AD_RaidersAtPool_14.speaker: Goblin Sharp-Eye
AD_RaidersAtPool_14.text: How's about we make this a competition, boys?
AD_RaidersAtPool_14.context: CinematicNodeContext: Goblins are standing in a circle around the sacred pool. Their 'leader' is addressing them.

AD_RaidersAtPool_1.speaker: Warrior Trunk
AD_RaidersAtPool_1.text: What're we talkin'? Time or amount?
AD_RaidersAtPool_1.context: NodeContext: Trying to sound smarter than he is.

AD_RaidersAtPool_11.speaker: Warrior Trunk
AD_RaidersAtPool_11.text: Are we goin' by amount o' piss or not?
AD_RaidersAtPool_11.context: NodeContext: A bit irked that his friend is too dumb to understand what he's asking.

AD_RaidersAtPool_15.speaker: Warrior Trunk
AD_RaidersAtPool_15.context: NodeContext: Realizing his question was stupid.

LeaderKid_9.speaker: Mol
LeaderKid_9.text: What? I've said thank you. Should I write you a poem, too?

LeaderKid_15.speaker: Mol
LeaderKid_15.text: If any of your stuff goes missing, just let me know. You're family now.

LeaderKid_19.speaker: Mol
LeaderKid_19.text: Zaki told me about you, toad-lady. Your kind scared Zorru real bad.

LeaderKid_49.speaker: Player
LeaderKid_49.text: Quiet, hatchling. What are you doing down here?

LeaderKid_17.speaker: Mol
LeaderKid_17.text: Listening to stories - I think you're a little old for them. Or are you looking for a place to hide when the end comes?

LeaderKid_18.speaker: Mol
LeaderKid_18.text: Brave words when you're hiding down here with the rest of us. Listening to stories and waiting for the end like the rest of the children?

LeaderKid_24.speaker: Mol
LeaderKid_24.text: Yes? I've got places to be - I'm sure you do, too.

LeaderKid_25.speaker: Mol
LeaderKid_25.text: You're a little old for story-time. Looking for a place to hide when the end comes?
LeaderKid_25.context: NodeContext: gently mocking of an adult

LeaderKid_50.speaker: Player
LeaderKid_50.text: You look a little old for this yourself.

LeaderKid_34.speaker: Mol
LeaderKid_34.text: Take it up with Zevlor. Apparently I'm 'too young' to fight on the wall.

LeaderKid_8.speaker: Mol
LeaderKid_8.text: Take it up with Asharak. Apparently I'm 'too young' to fight on the wall.

LeaderKid_29.speaker: Mol
LeaderKid_29.text: Doesn't matter. The fight will come to us, no matter what he says.

LeaderKid_30.speaker: Player
LeaderKid_30.text: The end's not coming today. I promise.

LeaderKid_14.speaker: Mol
LeaderKid_14.text: If you honestly believe that, maybe it's best you hide down here with the other children.

LeaderKid_45.speaker: Player
LeaderKid_45.text: You're never too old for stories. The plots just get a bit more... complicated.

LeaderKid_27.speaker: Mol
LeaderKid_27.text: Mirkon keeps telling the other kids they'll all be safe if they stay hidden.

LeaderKid_1.speaker: Mol
LeaderKid_1.text: The singer keeps telling us that if we're good and quiet, we'll all be safe.

LeaderKid_5.speaker: Mol
LeaderKid_5.text: Just another fairy tale though, isn't it?

LeaderKid_26.speaker: Mol
LeaderKid_26.text: Come to say your goodbyes before the end comes? Wish I could fight with you.

LeaderKid_43.speaker: Player
LeaderKid_43.text: Are you any good with those knives? We need every blade.

LeaderKid_31.speaker: Mol
LeaderKid_31.text: Somebody stole the idol. If I find out who it was... I'll recruit 'em.
LeaderKid_31.context: NodeContext: exasperated on first line, as she tells us something we gave her was stolen. Beat before final phrase and delivered with a smile - it's a fun line but she's serious about recruiting good thieves

LeaderKid_32.speaker: Mol
LeaderKid_32.text: Still here? The smart ones ran a long while back.

LeaderKid_42.speaker: Mol
LeaderKid_42.text: You were stupid to come back.
LeaderKid_42.context: NodeContext: relieved but doesn't want to admit it - we 'came back' to help in a battle that she just survived thanks to us

LeaderKid_39.speaker: Mol
LeaderKid_39.context: NodeContext: hesitant thanks relieved but doesn't want to admit it -  she just survived a battle  thanks to us

LeaderKid_54.speaker: Mol
LeaderKid_54.text: You do good work. If you can handle more than goblins, might be I'll have use of you in Baldur's Gate.

LeaderKid_36.speaker: Mol
LeaderKid_36.text: Thanks. See you in Baldur's Gate, I hope. Now scram, before I get emotional.

LeaderKid_52.speaker: Player
LeaderKid_52.text: I don't have the idol you were after.

LeaderKid_4.speaker: Player
LeaderKid_4.text: I couldn't get the idol you asked about.

LeaderKid_46.speaker: Mol
LeaderKid_46.text: Damn it. Having that stashed away would have made life a lot easier.
LeaderKid_46.context: NodeContext: Frustrated, disappointed. Possible stamp of the foot on 'damn it'. Clenched fists.

LeaderKid_12.speaker: Mol
LeaderKid_12.text: You're a terrible liar. We had a deal.
LeaderKid_12.context: NodeContext: Frustrated, disappointed - player just lied to her and she saw right through it.

LeaderKid_21.speaker: Mol
LeaderKid_21.text: Fine. Hope the damn thing's cursed.
LeaderKid_21.context: NodeContext: frustrated, but not shouting, as she's dismissed. The 'damn thing' is an idol the player stole and refused to give to her

LeaderKid_53.speaker: Player
LeaderKid_53.text: Some advice - if you want something, don't ask. Just take.

LeaderKid_16.speaker: Mol
LeaderKid_16.text: Sounds more like a challenge than advice. Keep an eye on your pack.
LeaderKid_16.context: NodeContext: frustrated but with a hint of admiration. Last line is a threat to rob us in the future (pack is backpack). We just conned her, but she learned something from us.

LeaderKid_11.speaker: Mol
LeaderKid_11.text: Always a deal to be done - even now.
LeaderKid_11.context: NodeContext: Casually referring to the impending battle.

LeaderKid_44.speaker: Mol
LeaderKid_44.text: Try not to die up there.

AD_CaringForOx_0.speaker: Eramas
AD_CaringForOx_0.text: They're not getting in. Keep calm, now.
AD_CaringForOx_0.context: NodeContext: Soothing nonsense - to an ox. Calming herself more than it.

AD_CaringForOx_2.speaker: Eramas
AD_CaringForOx_2.text: Going to miss the grass here, girl? Druid grass - makes you good and strong.
AD_CaringForOx_2.context: NodeContext: Soothing nonsense to an ox.

AD_CaringForOx_3.speaker: Eramas
AD_CaringForOx_3.text: We'll be back on the road soon, girl.
AD_CaringForOx_3.context: NodeContext: Soothing nonsense to an ox.

AD_CaringForOx_4.speaker: Eramas
AD_CaringForOx_4.text: Easy now! Not going to let the goblins get you.
AD_CaringForOx_4.context: NodeContext: Soothing nonsense - to an ox. Calming herself more than it.

AD_CaringForOx_1.speaker: Eramas
AD_CaringForOx_1.text: Unless they get me first, I suppose.

ProdigySister_0.speaker: Lia
ProdigySister_0.text: I don't think there's a bit of me that isn't hurting after that fight. Worth it, though.

ProdigySister_1.speaker: Lia
ProdigySister_1.text: Looks like we're good to go. I'm glad.

ProdigySister_2.speaker: Lia
ProdigySister_2.text: It was you, right? Who took care of the goblins? I knew you were a good one.

ProdigySister_4.speaker: Lia
ProdigySister_4.text: The road to Baldur's Gate will be easy compared to that.

ProdigySister_3.speaker: Lia
ProdigySister_3.text: Thanks - for keeping these people safe. For keeping us safe.

AD_RikkaAndDoni_1.speaker: Rikka
AD_RikkaAndDoni_1.text: There you are! Thank the gods. Enjoyed your little adventure, did you?
AD_RikkaAndDoni_1.context: NodeContext: A child she's been worried sick looking for has returned. She's relieved but still her normal composed self. Child is non-verbal but she's speaking with him as if it's a back and forth.

AD_RikkaAndDoni_2.speaker: Rikka
AD_RikkaAndDoni_2.text: Let's get you below. You can tell everyone about it, hm?
AD_RikkaAndDoni_2.context: NodeContext: A child she's been worried sick looking for has returned. She's wry and relieved. Child is non-verbal but she's speaking with him as if it's a back and forth.

ChefAndSon_1.speaker: Ikaron
ChefAndSon_1.text: I suppose we'll have to make do.

ChefAndSon_6.speaker: Okta
ChefAndSon_6.text: We will, son. Don't worry about it.
ChefAndSon_6.context: NodeContext: Gruff but kind - you're trying to calm your son.

ChefAndSon_23.speaker: Ikaron
ChefAndSon_23.text: I can't believe they just left!
ChefAndSon_23.context: NodeContext: Outraged - you're furious with your kin.

ChefAndSon_19.speaker: Okta
ChefAndSon_19.context: NodeContext: Stern - you know there is no point complaining. You want your son to focus on getting ready for the fight.

ChefAndSon_8.speaker: Ikaron
ChefAndSon_8.text: No! Our so-called kin fled the moment their tails were in danger!
ChefAndSon_8.context: NodeContext: Angry and aghast - you would never do this to your kin. You can't believe they left you behind.

ChefAndSon_11.speaker: Ikaron
ChefAndSon_11.text: Even that cursed wizard took off. Rolan's magic could have made all the difference, you know!

ChefAndSon_12.speaker: Okta
ChefAndSon_12.text: Ikaron! We're in for a hell of a fight - focus on the matters at hand, not the ones you can't fix!
ChefAndSon_12.context: NodeContext: You snap at your son - but gently. This is beyond your control and you have bigger problems.

ChefAndSon_30.speaker: Okta
ChefAndSon_30.text: Some of the others took off in the middle of the night. Left their own kin to fend for themselves.
ChefAndSon_30.context: NodeContext: Resigned with a note of sadness - you wished they hadn't gone, but it's outside of your control.

ChefAndSon_20.speaker: Ikaron
ChefAndSon_20.text: The fools - they'll never make it to Baldur's Gate on their own.

ChefAndSon_17.speaker: Okta
ChefAndSon_17.text: Which is their problem now, not ours.
ChefAndSon_17.context: NodeContext: Snapping back at Ikaron - you need him to calm down.

ChefAndSon_27.speaker: Player
ChefAndSon_27.text: She's right. The coming battle won't be easy.

ChefAndSon_26.speaker: Okta
ChefAndSon_26.text: Exactly! And look: we're not on our own, are we? Not anymore.
ChefAndSon_26.context: NodeContext: Gesturing to the player - trying to reassure Ikaron - make him see all is not lost.

ChefAndSon_24.speaker: Ikaron
ChefAndSon_24.text: I know. Thank you - for not running like the others.
ChefAndSon_24.context: NodeContext: Resigned but thanking the player - trying to be hopeful. You feel like an ass for losing your temper.

ChefAndSon_34.speaker: Player
ChefAndSon_34.text: Running's a smart move. Especially for a tiefling.

ChefAndSon_21.speaker: Ikaron
ChefAndSon_21.context: NodeContext: Snapping at the player - you want to fight someone - you don't care who.

ChefAndSon_5.speaker: Ikaron
ChefAndSon_5.text: Exactly. Bloody traitors - the lot of them.
ChefAndSon_5.context: NodeContext: Player has agreed with you - you're vindicated in your anger.

ChefAndSon_14.speaker: Okta
ChefAndSon_14.text: Cut it out, Ikaron! All this grousing is useless.
ChefAndSon_14.context: NodeContext: Snapping at Ikaron - he's been complaining non-stop and you intend to end it.

ChefAndSon_29.speaker: Player
ChefAndSon_29.text: Clan is everything. Those tieflings gave up their honour.

ChefAndSon_33.speaker: Player
ChefAndSon_33.text: Sad thing, if that's the state of 'kin' these days.

ChefAndSon_32.speaker: Player
ChefAndSon_32.text: I'd be devastated if one of my own betrayed me.

ChefAndSon_2.speaker: Player
ChefAndSon_2.text: The past can't be changed. Focus on your future before that too is set in stone.

ChefAndSon_35.speaker: Ikaron
ChefAndSon_35.text: We might die because a bunch of traitors cared more about saving their hides then they did about us.
ChefAndSon_35.context: NodeContext: Player has disagreed with you. You're angry and happy to pick a fight.

ChefAndSon_31.speaker: Player
ChefAndSon_31.text: Rage is fuel. Use it for the fight ahead, not to complain.

ChefAndSon_9.speaker: Ikaron
ChefAndSon_9.text: You're right. Lingering on this won't do much good.
ChefAndSon_9.context: NodeContext: Player has agreed with you - you calm down - resigned in your anger.

ChefAndSon_15.speaker: Okta
ChefAndSon_15.text: Finally! Now can we all get back to work? Idle chatter isn't going to defeat those goblins.
ChefAndSon_15.context: NodeContext: Relieved your son has calmed down. All business-like as you try to get everyone back on track.

ChefAndSon_13.speaker: Player
ChefAndSon_13.text: Your kin's probably bleeding out on a goblin pike right now. What a waste.

ChefAndSon_4.speaker: Ikaron
ChefAndSon_4.context: NodeContext: Leaning forward - preparing to punch the player. Almost snarling with anger.

ChefAndSon_3.speaker: Okta
ChefAndSon_3.text: Enough! I will knock both of your heads together unless you cut it out.
ChefAndSon_3.context: NodeContext: Intervenes, looking for player to her son - in full no nonsense mode - she's had enough of this and she's putting a stop to it - right now.

ChefAndSon_7.speaker: Okta
ChefAndSon_7.text: Not another word! Back to work - all of you! We've a battle to prepare for!
ChefAndSon_7.context: NodeContext: a firm dismissal as you snap at both player and Ikaron. Gruff.

GoblinLush_0.speaker: Tracker Azak
GoblinLush_0.text: If the Absolute wants 'em dead, we'll massacre 'em!
GoblinLush_0.context: NodeContext: preparing for a raid - eager

GoblinLush_2.speaker: Tracker Azak
GoblinLush_2.text: You see what I did? The Absolute's gonna recognise me, make me a True Soul, I tell ya.

AD_BossyAtPool_1.speaker: Goblin Sharp-Eye
AD_BossyAtPool_1.text: Maybe I should take one of these statues back with me to camp...

AD_BossyAtPool_2.speaker: Goblin Sharp-Eye
AD_BossyAtPool_2.text: Grove's kinda pretty when you look at it.

AD_BossyAtPool_3.speaker: Goblin Sharp-Eye
AD_BossyAtPool_3.text: Nah. Just the light reflectin' I guess.

Wyll_0.speaker: Wyll
Wyll_0.text: Blow the horn - the trap has been set. Today, we write our own legends!

Wyll_1.speaker: Narrator
Wyll_1.text: *You know this man's face - but you can't quite place it. He knows you too, judging from his quizzical expression.*

Wyll_2.speaker: Wyll
Wyll_2.text: Blow the horn - the trap has been set.

Wyll_4.speaker: Wyll
Wyll_4.text: Ah - a familiar face. Didn't think I'd see you again!

Wyll_5.speaker: Wyll
Wyll_5.text: I've never been more thrilled to be wrong.

Wyll_3.speaker: Wyll
Wyll_3.text: Blow the horn - the trap has been set. Today, we write our own legends!

PickpocketTrader_7.speaker: Mattis
PickpocketTrader_7.text: Need anything before the fighting starts? All that coin will just slow you down.

PickpocketTrader_11.speaker: Player
PickpocketTrader_11.text: What about a discount? I'm about to risk my life.

PickpocketTrader_10.speaker: Mattis
PickpocketTrader_10.text: Huh. Fair enough. Can always get my money back when you're dead.

PickpocketTrader_20.speaker: Mattis
PickpocketTrader_20.text: A big hero like you, with no gold? Best go pluck some from a goblin, then.

PickpocketTrader_22.speaker: Player
PickpocketTrader_22.text: Fair enough. Let's see what you're selling.

PickpocketTrader_12.speaker: Mattis
PickpocketTrader_12.context: NodeContext: sincere, but not very optimistic

PickpocketTrader_18.speaker: Player
PickpocketTrader_18.text: Is this really the time to worry about coin?

PickpocketTrader_3.speaker: Mattis
PickpocketTrader_3.text: You think my sister and I will last long in the city with no money?
PickpocketTrader_3.context: NodeContext: Incredulous - as if the player's stupid.

PickpocketTrader_25.speaker: Mattis
PickpocketTrader_25.text: It's your job to make sure we get that far. So why don't you go take care of that?
PickpocketTrader_25.context: NodeContext: Putting player in their place.

PickpocketTrader_21.speaker: Mattis
PickpocketTrader_21.context: NodeContext: Not entirely optimistic about player's chances.

PickpocketTrader_14.speaker: Mattis
PickpocketTrader_14.text: Finally. A city full of real coin.

PickpocketTrader_17.speaker: Mattis
PickpocketTrader_17.text: I'm... glad you didn't die. No discounts once I'm running the Wide in Baldur's Gate, mind.

PickpocketTrader_19.speaker: Mattis
PickpocketTrader_19.text: Need anything before the fighting starts? No tricks this time, promise.

RaiderStupid_0.speaker: Sharp-Eye Eef
RaiderStupid_0.text: You'd think devil spawn would put up a better fight, wouldn't ya? It's like they didn't even wanna live.

RaiderStupid_1.speaker: Sharp-Eye Eef
RaiderStupid_1.text: Remember, you'll be worg food if you drop 'ere. Don't matter if yer friend or foe.
RaiderStupid_1.context: NodeContext: A little nervous before the fight, but trying to hide it.

Mule1_0.speaker: Bored Ox
Mule1_0.text: Please - don't let the evil ones in.

Mule1_1.speaker: Bored Ox
Mule1_1.text: The younglings are a nuisance, but the road would not be the same without them. Thank you.

Mule1_3.speaker: Bored Ox
Mule1_3.text: I yearn for fresh grass and a clear sky. I hope we can leave this place soon.
Mule1_3.context: NodeContext: Sighing as you think of blue skies and the road

Mule1_4.speaker: Bored Ox
Mule1_4.context: NodeContext: Under attack - yelling for the player to protect the children

Tiefling001_3.speaker: Rikka
Tiefling001_3.text: Go to the barricades. I can hold this place, if a few goblins slip through.

Tiefling001_6.speaker: Rikka
Tiefling001_6.text: It won't be easy in Baldur's Gate, but I hope it'll be better than here, at least.

Tiefling001_8.speaker: Rikka
Tiefling001_8.text: Thanks for finding Doni. Knowing the children are safe makes all this a little easier.

Tiefling001_9.speaker: Rikka
Tiefling001_9.context: NodeContext: Half-joking - the missing child has her very worried but she knows it's not his fault

Tiefling001_11.speaker: Rikka
Tiefling001_11.text: Please. Have you seen Doni anywhere? Young boy, doesn't talk?

Tiefling001_12.speaker: Rikka
Tiefling001_12.text: We need to get him into the cave before the goblins come.

Tiefling001_7.speaker: Player
Tiefling001_7.text: No - but I'll keep an eye out for him.

Tiefling001_13.speaker: Rikka
Tiefling001_13.text: I appreciate it. He's the one who showed us the cave to begin with.

Tiefling001_0.speaker: Rikka
Tiefling001_0.text: We won't seal it up until he's safe with the rest.

Tiefling001_4.speaker: Rikka
Tiefling001_4.text: The kids found a hidden cave. We're going to hide them there.

Tiefling001_16.speaker: Rikka
Tiefling001_16.text: But we can't seal it up until we find Doni.

Tiefling001_1.speaker: Player
Tiefling001_1.text: There's a battle coming - I have slightly more pressing concerns.

Tiefling001_17.speaker: Rikka
Tiefling001_17.text: Then stop wasting my time. I have a child to find.

Tiefling001_10.speaker: Player
Tiefling001_10.text: Hmm. Perhaps he slipped into a pocket plane - happened to an uncle of mine.

Tiefling001_14.speaker: Rikka
Tiefling001_14.text: I don't have time for this. We can't seal up without him.
Tiefling001_14.context: NodeContext: Firm - concerned for the child who is missing.

Tiefling001_15.speaker: Rikka
Tiefling001_15.text: Elturel didn't want us, and those druids sure as hells didn't either, but you... you risked your life for us.
Tiefling001_15.context: NodeContext: Relieved, grateful the attack is over.

Apprentice_13.speaker: Nettie
Apprentice_13.text: This place... this place means everything to me.

Apprentice_30.speaker: Nettie
Apprentice_30.text: Thank you for saving it. For saving Master Halsin. For everything.

Apprentice_46.speaker: Nettie
Apprentice_46.text: I don't know if I can ever restore Silvanus' peace to this place.

Apprentice_43.speaker: Nettie
Apprentice_43.text: But I'll have the chance - thanks to you.

Apprentice_57.speaker: Player
Apprentice_57.text: Damn right. If not for me, you'd all be dead.

Apprentice_18.speaker: Nettie
Apprentice_18.text: I was sure we wouldn't live to see the morrow.

Apprentice_37.speaker: Player
Apprentice_37.text: Thanks are fine. A reward is better.

Apprentice_7.speaker: Nettie
Apprentice_7.text: If you're looking for coin, you're out of luck. I'm a healer, not a moneylender.

Apprentice_52.speaker: Nettie
Apprentice_52.text: But here - to mend any hurts.

Apprentice_39.speaker: Player
Apprentice_39.text: It was a glorious fight! One to be relished.

Apprentice_49.speaker: Nettie
Apprentice_49.text: I'm glad you were on our side.

Apprentice_0.speaker: Player
Apprentice_0.text: It's your home. It's worth protecting.

Apprentice_5.speaker: Nettie
Apprentice_5.text: Too right. Home is where you belong, not where you're born. This - this is where I belong.

Apprentice_56.speaker: Player
Apprentice_56.text: I fought for the refugees, not for you.

Apprentice_41.speaker: Nettie
Apprentice_41.text: Whatever your motives, my home is still standing - because of you. I'll always be grateful for that.

Apprentice_54.speaker: Player
Apprentice_54.text: It was a pleasure to crush some goblin skulls.

Apprentice_24.speaker: Nettie
Apprentice_24.text: Well, you certainly took out more than your fair share.

Apprentice_26.speaker: Player
Apprentice_26.text: This is a sacred place - it had to be protected.

Apprentice_3.speaker: Nettie
Apprentice_3.text: Still, there would be little more than ashes left of the grove without you.

Apprentice_1.speaker: Player
Apprentice_1.text: Every death was in service of my god.

Apprentice_17.speaker: Nettie
Apprentice_17.text: I... hoped you'd had other motives, but I'll take what I can get.

Apprentice_21.speaker: Player
Apprentice_21.text: Of course, it's my duty to help those in need.

Apprentice_50.speaker: Nettie
Apprentice_50.text: And bloody hells, did we need it.

Apprentice_23.speaker: Nettie
Apprentice_23.text: Silvanus be with you, my friend.
Apprentice_23.context: NodeContext: in awe of what we've done for her and slightly tearful

Apprentice_31.speaker: Nettie
Apprentice_31.text: I was certain your parasite had taken hold.
Apprentice_31.context: InternalNodeContext: Nettie returns to the grove. She is talking to the player who revealed the truth about their tadpole

Apprentice_32.speaker: Nettie
Apprentice_32.text: Thank you for saving Master Halsin. For saving my home. For everything.

Apprentice_47.speaker: Nettie
Apprentice_47.text: Thank you for saving my home.

Apprentice_8.speaker: Player
Apprentice_8.text: I'm still waiting for an apology for trying to kill me.

Apprentice_15.speaker: Nettie
Apprentice_15.text: I am sorry for that, but the whole grove was at risk.

Apprentice_9.speaker: Player
Apprentice_9.text: You're just lucky I didn't swig that poison.

Apprentice_28.speaker: Nettie
Apprentice_28.text: Hah! Look, I'm sorry. I didn't know what to do when you told me about that tadpole.

Apprentice_38.speaker: Nettie
Apprentice_38.text: The goblins may be gone, but it cost Master Halsin his life...

Apprentice_48.speaker: Nettie
Apprentice_48.text: I'm sorry neither of us could save you from that tadpole. I hope it ends well for you.

Apprentice_58.speaker: Nettie
Apprentice_58.text: I don't know how we'll go on, but we must. For him.

Apprentice_40.speaker: Nettie
Apprentice_40.text: Whatever about the grove, I won't be at peace until Master Halsin returns.

Apprentice_44.speaker: Nettie
Apprentice_44.text: Blessed day, I was worried I'd never see Master Halsin again.

Apprentice_22.speaker: Nettie
Apprentice_22.text: You kept your word. Thank you.

Apprentice_25.speaker: Nettie
Apprentice_25.text: I'm still not comfortable with your tadpole, but I owe you a chance. Thank you.

Apprentice_20.speaker: Nettie
Apprentice_20.text: Thank you for everything you've done.

Apprentice_53.speaker: Nettie
Apprentice_53.text: I'll stay here until Master Halsin returns. I still believe he's out there somewhere.

Apprentice_61.speaker: Nettie
Apprentice_61.text: May Master Halsin rest in the Deep Forest.

AD_ChefAndSonPacking_1.speaker: Okta
AD_ChefAndSonPacking_1.text: What do you think of opening a cart in Baldur's Gate?

AD_ChefAndSonPacking_5.speaker: Ikaron
AD_ChefAndSonPacking_5.text: A cart? Like on the street?

AD_ChefAndSonPacking_12.speaker: Okta
AD_ChefAndSonPacking_12.text: Exactly. Noble types won't want a tiefling cookin' for them, but common folk...

AD_ChefAndSonPacking_2.speaker: Ikaron
AD_ChefAndSonPacking_2.text: A cart sounds fine, but do I have to haul it around?

AD_ChefAndSonPacking_9.speaker: Okta
AD_ChefAndSonPacking_9.text: Until we make the coin for a proper ox, maybe.

AD_ChefAndSonPacking_4.speaker: Ikaron
AD_ChefAndSonPacking_4.text: Do you think we'll stay in Baldur's Gate long?

AD_ChefAndSonPacking_0.speaker: Okta
AD_ChefAndSonPacking_0.text: Of course. It's a big city, lots of opportunity.

AD_ChefAndSonPacking_6.speaker: Okta
AD_ChefAndSonPacking_6.text: Don't let that place cast a shadow on your head forever.

AD_ChefAndSonPacking_10.speaker: Ikaron
AD_ChefAndSonPacking_10.text: I guess things are already better. I've learned a lot.

AD_ChefAndSonPacking_13.speaker: Okta
AD_ChefAndSonPacking_13.text: There we go, boy. Now back to packing.

AD_ChefAndSonPacking_17.speaker: Okta
AD_ChefAndSonPacking_17.context: CinematicNodeContext: Okta is messing with whatever is already packed on the cart.

AD_ChefAndSonPacking_15.speaker: Ikaron
AD_ChefAndSonPacking_15.context: CinematicNodeContext: Ikaron is trying to get a heavy crate onto the cart.

AD_ChefAndSonPacking_16.speaker: Okta
AD_ChefAndSonPacking_16.text: Don't be breaking your back before we get to Baldur's Gate.

AD_ChefAndSonPacking_3.speaker: Ikaron
AD_ChefAndSonPacking_3.text: I won't. I'm not ten anymore.

AD_ChefAndSonPacking_11.speaker: Okta
AD_ChefAndSonPacking_11.text: Don't I know it. But there's two more boxes after this one.

AD_ChefAndSonPacking_7.speaker: Ikaron
AD_ChefAndSonPacking_7.context: NodeContext: Groaning at the thought of having to lift more boxes

Gatekeeper_0.speaker: Elegis
Gatekeeper_0.text: I still can't believe you cleared the roads. Expect I won't until the city gates swing shut behind us.
Gatekeeper_0.context: NodeContext: shaken, voice breaking - has just survived an attempted massacre

Gatekeeper_1.speaker: Elegis
Gatekeeper_1.text: I expected goblins at our gate any moment. Glad to say that you made a prettier sight.
Gatekeeper_1.context: NodeContext: Tearing up a little - we just saved her life and the lives of her friends

Gatekeeper_2.speaker: Elegis
Gatekeeper_2.text: You didn't have to come back. Thank you.
Gatekeeper_2.context: NodeContext: Tearing up a little - we just saved her life and the lives of her friends

Gatekeeper_3.speaker: Elegis
Gatekeeper_3.text: We'd be dead if you hadn't been here...
Gatekeeper_3.context: NodeContext: shaken, voice breaking - has just survived an attempted massacre

Gatekeeper_4.speaker: Elegis
Gatekeeper_4.text: I knew they'd find us - I knew it!
Gatekeeper_4.context: NodeContext: scared and annoyed - doesn't feel like anyone listened to her

Gatekeeper_5.speaker: Elegis
Gatekeeper_5.text: Gods... I feel sick. We're not ready for this.
Gatekeeper_5.context: NodeContext: on the verge of breaking down, terrified but almost numb with shock

AD_CoweringStargazer_0.speaker: Nadira
AD_CoweringStargazer_0.text: Blood and fire. It's the Hells all over again.
AD_CoweringStargazer_0.context: NodeContext: Exhausted and a bit afraid.

BackupVictory_1.speaker: Cerys
BackupVictory_1.text: We've lost people today. But we are alive, and the dead have bought us a chance.

BackupVictory_5.speaker: Cerys
BackupVictory_5.text: The greatest honour we can do them is to use it - so make yourselves ready.

BackupVictory_3.speaker: Cerys
BackupVictory_3.text: The road waits - and beyond it, Baldur's Gate.

BackupVictory_0.speaker: Cerys
BackupVictory_0.text: You. I won't pretend to know why, but you've been a friend to us when we needed it most.

BackupVictory_6.speaker: Cerys
BackupVictory_6.text: Here. It's faint thanks compared to what you've done for us, but it's what we have.
BackupVictory_6.context: CinematicNodeContext: She hands you something off-screen. Not defined.NodeContext: She hands you something off-screen. Not defined.

BackupVictory_4.speaker: Cerys
BackupVictory_4.text: Gods above - that's the druid. Some timing you have, Halsin.

BackupVictory_8.speaker: Cerys
BackupVictory_8.text: Go on. He'll want to speak to the one who saved his grove, I expect.

BackupVictory_7.speaker: Cerys
BackupVictory_7.text: All the more reason to find us when you get to the city, eh?

Trainee001_1.speaker: Umi
Trainee001_1.text: I'm not fighting anymore. Not even if someone calls me names.

Trainee001_3.speaker: Umi
Trainee001_3.text: I left my sword in the cave. Don't tell, but... I don't want to touch it again.

Trainee001_6.speaker: Lae'zel
Trainee001_6.text: Bah! At your age, I'd already spilled my own cousin's blood. Face your fear, or it will devour you.

Trainee001_5.speaker: Wyll
Trainee001_5.text: It's all right. Don't tell anyone - but I was afraid, too.

Trainee001_4.speaker: Umi
Trainee001_4.text: I don't want to fight goblins. You can't make me!

Trainee001_7.speaker: Umi
Trainee001_7.text: Go away. Please, make them all just go away!

AD_BetrayedTrainer_0.speaker: Asharak
AD_BetrayedTrainer_0.text: I'll kill you, you bloody coward!
AD_BetrayedTrainer_0.context: NodeContext: Afraid but mostly furious - the player has just betrayed him and everyone he's trying to protect after pretending to be a friend.

RaiderBold_0.speaker: Warrior Clack
RaiderBold_0.context: NodeContext: Warcry - said either while rushing into battle, or in the thick of it

RaiderBold_1.speaker: Warrior Clack
RaiderBold_1.context: NodeContext: goblin language - victory cry (rawl-TOOSH) long oo, like soon, not foot

RaiderBold_2.speaker: Warrior Clack
RaiderBold_2.text: Come on, lads! This'll be a slaughter.
RaiderBold_2.context: NodeContext: Talking to friends preparing for a raid - with delighted malice on the final word

AD_KidMurderers_2.speaker: Warrior Rua
AD_KidMurderers_2.text: One of the little bastards tried to fight me with a wooden sword!
AD_KidMurderers_2.context: NodeContext: laughing, incredulous on last phrase

AD_KidMurderers_1.speaker: Sharp-Eye Sneem
AD_KidMurderers_1.text: I saw. You was laughin' so hard he managed to clonk you on the head!

AD_KidMurderers_0.speaker: Warrior Rua
AD_KidMurderers_0.text: Yeah. Then I split him in half.
AD_KidMurderers_0.context: NodeContext: still laughing before 'yeah' and then suddenly grim and vicious

Sapper_001_0.speaker: Sapper Moke
Sapper_001_0.text: Back off! Got enough powder to blow us all to bits!
Sapper_001_0.context: CinematicNodeContext: he's carrying an explosive barrel - possibly waving the player backNodeContext: carrying an explosive barrel into combat

Sapper_001_1.speaker: Sapper Moke
Sapper_001_1.context: NodeContext: sinister, just participated in a slaughter and is relishing the victory

Weaponsmith_1.speaker: Dammon
Weaponsmith_1.text: I hope you're here to fight. You look a sight tougher than the others.

Weaponsmith_8.speaker: Dammon
Weaponsmith_8.text: Need a weapon? I still have a few left.

Weaponsmith_2.speaker: Dammon
Weaponsmith_2.text: I wish I had better but this is all I have.

Weaponsmith_3.speaker: Dammon
Weaponsmith_3.text: May Tymora's luck twist your way.

Weaponsmith_6.speaker: Dammon
Weaponsmith_6.text: Who do I pray to for a real forge? Moradin? He... probably wouldn't listen to me.

Weaponsmith_10.speaker: Dammon
Weaponsmith_10.text: You're back. Nice to see a familiar face.

Weaponsmith_11.speaker: Dammon
Weaponsmith_11.text: You saved us. I wasn't sure we'd make it through.

RaiderCunning_0.speaker: Sharp-Eye Nass
RaiderCunning_0.text: Hope we weren't s'posed to take any prisoners...
RaiderCunning_0.context: NodeContext: standing over slaughtered enemies - pleased with himself, but slightly worried they might have gone overboard in killing EVERYONE

RaiderCunning_1.speaker: Sharp-Eye Nass
RaiderCunning_1.context: NodeContext: warcry, as he prepares to charge into battle

AD_HalsinAndDruidLeader_6.speaker: Kagha
AD_HalsinAndDruidLeader_6.text: And the outlanders? What of them?

AD_HalsinAndDruidLeader_2.speaker: Halsin
AD_HalsinAndDruidLeader_2.text: They are our guests until they wish to leave - as I said as the day they arrived.

AD_HalsinAndDruidLeader_1.speaker: Kagha
AD_HalsinAndDruidLeader_1.text: Have they blinded you to truth? Outsiders bring only chaos.

AD_HalsinAndDruidLeader_13.speaker: Halsin
AD_HalsinAndDruidLeader_13.text: And what have you brought? Harmony? Balance?

AD_HalsinAndDruidLeader_8.speaker: Halsin
AD_HalsinAndDruidLeader_8.text: You imperilled the grove. I'm surprised you dare show your face.

AD_HalsinAndDruidLeader_19.speaker: Halsin
AD_HalsinAndDruidLeader_19.context: NodeContext: 'You're not off the hook yet'

AD_HalsinAndDruidLeader_9.speaker: Kagha
AD_HalsinAndDruidLeader_9.text: And what of my future, Master Halsin?
AD_HalsinAndDruidLeader_9.context: NodeContext: 'So, do I have a chance (of redeeming myself)?'

AD_HalsinAndDruidLeader_5.speaker: Halsin
AD_HalsinAndDruidLeader_5.text: Perhaps you will prove yourself worthy of forgiveness. Perhaps not.
AD_HalsinAndDruidLeader_5.context: NodeContext: authoritative, paternal. Not letting her off the hook entirely

AD_HalsinAndDruidLeader_12.speaker: Kagha
AD_HalsinAndDruidLeader_12.text: I sought strength in the shadows. May Silvanus forgive me.
AD_HalsinAndDruidLeader_12.context: NodeContext: Trying to explain how she strayed

AD_HalsinAndDruidLeader_7.speaker: Halsin
AD_HalsinAndDruidLeader_7.text: At least you recognise your mistake. This is a beginning - a small one.
AD_HalsinAndDruidLeader_7.context: NodeContext: A hint of softening in his tone, but still firm

AD_HalsinAndDruidLeader_14.speaker: Halsin
AD_HalsinAndDruidLeader_14.text: You will make peace with all who seek shelter here. It is the will of Silvanus.
AD_HalsinAndDruidLeader_14.context: NodeContext: 'This is what's going to happen - no arguments' Sil-VANN-us

AD_HalsinAndDruidLeader_4.speaker: Kagha
AD_HalsinAndDruidLeader_4.text: Silvanus would not command us to invite rot into our midst.

AD_HalsinAndDruidLeader_3.speaker: Halsin
AD_HalsinAndDruidLeader_3.text: Oh child. You have drifted far from the Oak Father's teachings.
AD_HalsinAndDruidLeader_3.context: NodeContext: Resignation and a little pity

AD_HalsinAndDruidLeader_15.speaker: Kagha
AD_HalsinAndDruidLeader_15.text: With the shadows vanquished, healing can begin.

AD_HalsinAndDruidLeader_11.speaker: Halsin
AD_HalsinAndDruidLeader_11.text: Do not forget who invited those shadows. You have much to learn still.

AD_HalsinAndDruidLeader_16.speaker: Kagha
AD_HalsinAndDruidLeader_16.text: Then banish me. When the coming army marches, there will be none to protect you.

AD_HalsinAndDruidLeader_18.speaker: Halsin
AD_HalsinAndDruidLeader_18.text: You imperilled the grove - how dare you even look me in the eye.

AD_HalsinAndDruidLeader_20.speaker: Kagha
AD_HalsinAndDruidLeader_20.text: I did what I had to. A pity you don't see that.

AD_HalsinAndDruidLeader_0.speaker: Halsin
AD_HalsinAndDruidLeader_0.text: I thought I had been a good teacher to you. Clearly not.

AD_LoversOverTortured_1.speaker: Danis
AD_LoversOverTortured_1.text: Beshaba pass over, look what they did to him.

AD_LoversOverTortured_3.speaker: Bex
AD_LoversOverTortured_3.text: Aye. Goblins know a damn sight more about doing harm than I do about healing it.

AD_LoversOverTortured_9.speaker: Danis
AD_LoversOverTortured_9.text: You did well, love. At least he'll wake up to some friendly faces.

AD_LoversOverTortured_6.speaker: Danis
AD_LoversOverTortured_6.text: Is there something more we should be doing for him?

AD_LoversOverTortured_5.speaker: Bex
AD_LoversOverTortured_5.text: Like what? We need to keep what supplies we have. We might need them before the fighting's done.

AD_LoversOverTortured_10.speaker: Danis
AD_LoversOverTortured_10.text: I should be up on the wall.

AD_LoversOverTortured_0.speaker: Bex
AD_LoversOverTortured_0.text: Why? You'd just be in the way.

AD_LoversOverTortured_2.speaker: Danis
AD_LoversOverTortured_2.text: I'm in the way down here too.

AD_LoversOverTortured_7.speaker: Bex
AD_LoversOverTortured_7.text: Nonsense. I'll need you to hold any wounded down while I poke at them.

Tiefling010_7.speaker: Lakrissa
Tiefling010_7.text: Almost time for the killing to start again. Hooray.

Tiefling010_8.speaker: Lakrissa
Tiefling010_8.text: See you in Baldur's Gate. Looking forward to that drink.

Tiefling010_14.speaker: Lakrissa
Tiefling010_14.text: It looks I might have to pay you after all. Once we get to the city, of course.

Tiefling010_2.speaker: Player
Tiefling010_2.text: Buy me a drink and we'll call it even.

Tiefling010_18.speaker: Lakrissa
Tiefling010_18.text: You know, that actually sounds pretty good.

Tiefling010_21.speaker: Lakrissa
Tiefling010_21.text: If you drink as well as you fight, we'll have a lot of fun.

Tiefling010_27.speaker: Lakrissa
Tiefling010_27.text: Let's stick with gold. I hate to mix business and pleasure.

Tiefling010_5.speaker: Player
Tiefling010_5.text: Forget about the gold. You survived, that's all that matters.

Tiefling010_39.speaker: Lakrissa
Tiefling010_39.text: No no! A bet's a bet. I'll see you in Baldur's Gate.

Tiefling010_23.speaker: Player
Tiefling010_23.text: Good. I'll be there to collect.

Tiefling010_38.speaker: Lakrissa
Tiefling010_38.text: I'll see you in Baldur's Gate, then.

Tiefling010_4.speaker: Lakrissa
Tiefling010_4.text: Assuming something else doesn't kill me first.

Tiefling010_37.speaker: Lakrissa
Tiefling010_37.text: Should've taken that bet, my friend. I'd owe you big once we got to Baldur's Gate.

Tiefling010_13.speaker: Lakrissa
Tiefling010_13.text: Only the long road to Baldur's Gate to worry about now. Let's hope our luck holds out.

Tiefling010_17.speaker: Lakrissa
Tiefling010_17.text: I'd tell you to stay safe out there, but after today, I doubt there's anything you can't handle.

Tiefling010_29.speaker: Lakrissa
Tiefling010_29.text: Came back to join our heroic last stand?

Tiefling010_12.speaker: Lakrissa
Tiefling010_12.text: Or are you just keeping me alive to win that bet?

Tiefling010_1.speaker: Lakrissa
Tiefling010_1.text: And I'll take either one. Good to have you here.

Tiefling010_25.speaker: Player
Tiefling010_25.text: They won't take the grove. Not while I can still hold a weapon.

Tiefling010_24.speaker: Lakrissa
Tiefling010_24.text: You know, whatever happens, I'm glad we've got you on our side.

Tiefling010_0.speaker: Lakrissa
Tiefling010_0.text: It'd be even better if we won, of course. But still.

Tiefling010_3.speaker: Player
Tiefling010_3.text: Don't flatter yourself. I'm here for me.

Tiefling010_31.speaker: Player
Tiefling010_31.text: Buy me a drink and we'll call it even.

Tiefling010_9.speaker: Lakrissa
Tiefling010_9.text: You know, that actually sounds pretty good.

Tiefling010_28.speaker: Lakrissa
Tiefling010_28.text: If you drink as well as you fight, we'll have a lot of fun.

Tiefling010_10.speaker: Lakrissa
Tiefling010_10.text: Let's stick with gold. I hate to mix business and pleasure.

Tiefling010_6.speaker: Lakrissa
Tiefling010_6.text: Doesn't look like any of us are going to make it to Baldur's Gate.

Tiefling010_30.speaker: Lakrissa
Tiefling010_30.text: I'm not forgetting that drink in Baldur's Gate. Dying doesn't get you off the hook.

Tiefling010_32.speaker: Lakrissa
Tiefling010_32.text: With the goblins dead, we might actually make it to Baldur's Gate...
Tiefling010_32.context: NodeContext: Shock and hope piecing through your cynicism.

Tiefling010_19.speaker: Lakrissa
Tiefling010_19.text: ...I'd best see you there. I owe you a drink.
Tiefling010_19.context: NodeContext: Friendly, perhaps with a little wink (hinting at the drink you're gonna buy the player)

Tiefling010_33.speaker: Lakrissa
Tiefling010_33.text: You're all right. Don't die, if you can avoid it.
Tiefling010_33.context: NodeContext: You're all right as in 'you're pretty cool'. Hint of flirtation

Tiefling010_35.speaker: Lakrissa
Tiefling010_35.text: You didn't die. I didn't die. Seems we're destined for that drink.

Tiefling010_36.speaker: Lakrissa
Tiefling010_36.text: May I never see this place again. Gods.
Tiefling010_36.context: NodeContext: You can't wait to get out of the den - you've had enough of the pain and bloodshed, but are hiding it with cynicism and an eye roll.

RaiderFunny_0.speaker: Sharp-Eye Sneem
RaiderFunny_0.text: All this killin'... for the Absolute!
RaiderFunny_0.context: NodeContext: standing over corpses after a slaughter - praising his god, the Absolute

RaiderFunny_1.speaker: Sharp-Eye Sneem
RaiderFunny_1.context: NodeContext: a warcry as he prepares for battle

RaiderChieftain_1.speaker: Skrut
RaiderChieftain_1.text: Drow sez they've got kids in there...

RaiderChieftain_0.speaker: Skrut
RaiderChieftain_0.text: ... gonna try an' catch one. Be a nice plaything for my little 'uns.

RaiderChieftain_2.speaker: Skrut
RaiderChieftain_2.text: Meant to keep one alive fer a pet - they broke too easy.
RaiderChieftain_2.context: NodeContext: disappointed - just slaughtered the inhabitants of a refuge and wishing it had been a harder fight

AD_GrieflingFriendAtGate_4.speaker: Memnos
AD_GrieflingFriendAtGate_4.text: We did it. We actually did it!

AD_GrieflingFriendAtGate_3.speaker: Arka
AD_GrieflingFriendAtGate_3.context: NodeContext: Relief and resolve. Honouring the memory of a dead comrade.

AD_GrieflingFriendAtGate_0.speaker: Memnos
AD_GrieflingFriendAtGate_0.text: He'd be proud of you. I know he would.
AD_GrieflingFriendAtGate_0.context: NodeContext: He being the dead comrade, Kanon.

AD_GrieflingFriendAtGate_2.speaker: Memnos
AD_GrieflingFriendAtGate_2.text: I'm... I'm sorry I wasn't there to help. That'll change from now on, I promise.
AD_GrieflingFriendAtGate_2.context: NodeContext: Memnos didn't join in the fighting in this instance - efforts to encourage him failed.

AD_GrieflingFriendAtGate_1.speaker: Memnos
AD_GrieflingFriendAtGate_1.text: We'll raise a bottle in his name, first chance we get.
AD_GrieflingFriendAtGate_1.context: NodeContext: Memnos joined in the defences, thanks to a pep talk from the players.

RaiderHefty_1.speaker: Sharp-Eye Zami
RaiderHefty_1.text: Thought their horns would be bigger. What's the use if ya can't even drink from 'em?

RaiderHefty_2.speaker: Sharp-Eye Zami
RaiderHefty_2.text: Oh look, we missed a teef in all the slaughter!
