RaiderHefty_2.context: NodeContext: Mock surprise/joy at the prospect of more killing - but he knows you're an ally, you just LOOK like the enemy.

RaiderHefty_0.speaker: Sharp-Eye Zami
RaiderHefty_0.text: Just funnin', mate. We know you're one of us. Cold-blooded killer.
RaiderHefty_0.context: NodeContext: As if thumping you on the arm playfully, a joke between friends. Last line is said with respect - you're complicit in the slaughter of your own kind.

RaiderHefty_3.speaker: Sharp-Eye Zami
RaiderHefty_3.text: Drow says we can do what we want with the corpses. Gonna take their horns as trophies!

Servant001_0.speaker: 300edf9c-c71a-43db-925e-a2953a4e6203
Servant001_0.text: This is a holy sanctuary, not a bazaar. Please leave.

Servant001_1.speaker: 300edf9c-c71a-43db-925e-a2953a4e6203
Servant001_1.text: You've exhausted the goodwill of this place. Leave, before you bring more danger.

AD_PotionRaiders_2.speaker: Booyahg Benta
AD_PotionRaiders_2.text: I don't think that were a healing potion, mate. You don't look good.

Melee_001_0.speaker: Warrior Jawn
Melee_001_0.context: NodeContext: Goblin language battle cry - translates as "ATTACK!". Shouted while running into battle.  (Ke-wreck-NOR)

Melee_001_1.speaker: Warrior Jawn
Melee_001_1.context: NodeContext: After a great victory in which many civilians were slaughtered. Exalting their new god, the Absolute. Believes the player is also a follower of their faith

AD_Sappers_0.speaker: Sapper Moke
AD_Sappers_0.text: Are we gonna blow this place to bits or wot?

AD_Sappers_1.speaker: Sapper Dextor
AD_Sappers_1.text: Not unless the drow tells us to.
AD_Sappers_1.context: NodeContext: annoyed with the friend he's talking to - wishes he'd just shut up

AD_Sappers_2.speaker: Sapper Gald
AD_Sappers_2.text: Let's just keep out of her way. She's smiling. I get scared when she smiles.
AD_Sappers_2.context: NodeContext: talking about Minthara, their drow commander who just won a battle. Genuinely scared.

AD_TrainerAndGatekeeper_10.speaker: Elegis
AD_TrainerAndGatekeeper_10.text: I'm fine. You don't have to keep checking.

AD_TrainerAndGatekeeper_3.speaker: Asharak
AD_TrainerAndGatekeeper_3.text: It's this, or sitting and waiting. So I'll be back, if it's all the same to you.

AD_TrainerAndGatekeeper_1.speaker: Elegis
AD_TrainerAndGatekeeper_1.context: NodeContext: Standing on a wall before a battle, repeating as if a mantra. She's not a soldier and is trying to focus on the basics.

AD_TrainerAndGatekeeper_5.speaker: Elegis
AD_TrainerAndGatekeeper_5.context: NodeContext: Holding back tears of fear towards the end, powering through.

AD_TrainerAndGatekeeper_7.speaker: Elegis
AD_TrainerAndGatekeeper_7.text: You've actually fought goblins before, haven't you?

AD_TrainerAndGatekeeper_9.speaker: Asharak
AD_TrainerAndGatekeeper_9.text: So have you, if I'm not mistaken.

AD_TrainerAndGatekeeper_11.speaker: Elegis
AD_TrainerAndGatekeeper_11.text: That wasn't - that's not the same. I was terrified the whole time.

AD_TrainerAndGatekeeper_8.speaker: Asharak
AD_TrainerAndGatekeeper_8.text: Hah - sounds exactly the same, then.

AD_TrainerAndGatekeeper_12.speaker: Asharak
AD_TrainerAndGatekeeper_12.text: Fine day for it, I reckon.

AD_TrainerAndGatekeeper_6.speaker: Asharak
AD_TrainerAndGatekeeper_6.text: Not a notion. Talking beats thinking, though.

AD_TrainerAndGatekeeper_2.speaker: Elegis
AD_TrainerAndGatekeeper_2.text: Yeah. Yeah, fine day for it.

AD_GrieflingFriend_0.speaker: Memnos
AD_GrieflingFriend_0.context: NodeContext: A prayer. Afraid of the attack to come.

AD_GrieflingFriend_1.speaker: Memnos
AD_GrieflingFriend_1.context: NodeContext: A prayer. Afraid of the attack to come.

AD_GrieflingFriend_2.speaker: Memnos
AD_GrieflingFriend_2.context: NodeContext: A prayer. Afraid of the attack to come.

AD_GrieflingFriend_3.speaker: Memnos
AD_GrieflingFriend_3.context: NodeContext: A prayer. Afraid of the attack to come.

RaiderThirsty_0.speaker: Warrior Kramp
RaiderThirsty_0.text: Must be getting soft - almost felt bad for 'em.
RaiderThirsty_0.context: NodeContext: he's just killed a bunch of tiefling children and is feeling kind of bad about it. Which is an unusual sensation for him.

AD_DrowCommanderKneelingOverTiefling_0.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
AD_DrowCommanderKneelingOverTiefling_0.text: Hm. So many cuts. The goblins were eager with this one.

AD_DrowCommanderKneelingOverTiefling_1.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
AD_DrowCommanderKneelingOverTiefling_1.text: To flee the fires of Avernus only to fall here - this is the power of the Absolute.

AD_DrowCommanderKneelingOverTiefling_2.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
AD_DrowCommanderKneelingOverTiefling_2.text: So young. But then, weren't they all?

AD_DrowCommanderKneelingOverTiefling_3.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
AD_DrowCommanderKneelingOverTiefling_3.text: So much blood. So easily spilled.

ParentA_0.speaker: Locke
ParentA_0.text: My horns for a normal day.

ParentA_2.speaker: Locke
ParentA_2.text: One sorrow ended. The next soon to begin.

Refugee001_0.speaker: Eramas
Refugee001_0.text: We made it, somehow. Now we just need to get to Baldur's Gate.
Refugee001_0.context: NodeContext: suprised and determinated, still reeling from the attack that has happened.

Refugee001_2.speaker: Eramas
Refugee001_2.text: Told you to get out while you could, didn't I?

Refugee001_1.speaker: Eramas
Refugee001_1.text: Should've taken my own bloody advice.

Refugee001_3.speaker: Eramas
Refugee001_3.text: I would run if I were you. Though it's probably too late for that already.

Refugee001_4.speaker: Eramas
Refugee001_4.text: I shouldn't have doubted you. Or the others.

Refugee001_5.speaker: Eramas
Refugee001_5.text: This place will be a death trap if the goblins breach the wall. Mark my words.

Refugee001_6.speaker: Eramas
Refugee001_6.text: You were a fool to come back here.

AD_GettingArmed_0.speaker: Guex
AD_GettingArmed_0.text: The more weapons we have on show, the less likely anyone'll give us trouble.

AD_GettingArmed_1.speaker: Guex
AD_GettingArmed_1.text: Pick something realistic. If you can't swing a sword, take a dagger.

AD_GettingArmed_2.speaker: Guex
AD_GettingArmed_2.text: Arm yourselves. Better to have a weapon and not need it.

AD_GettingArmed_3.speaker: Guex
AD_GettingArmed_3.text: C'mon, you're not picking a gift for your sweetheart - grab a blade!

WarchiefBrave_0.speaker: Rozzak
WarchiefBrave_0.text: One of 'em was prayin' when I slit its throat. Who do devils even pray to?
WarchiefBrave_0.context: NodeContext: just finished slaughtering civilians, guards and refugees hiding in a druid grove - pondering a specific killing. Amused.

WarchiefBrave_1.speaker: Rozzak
WarchiefBrave_1.text: Enjoy killin' yer own kind, do ya?
WarchiefBrave_1.context: NodeContext: Rushing into battle - the 'horns an' a tail' refers not to monsters, but to tiefling refugees. A warcry. Alternative line "enjoying killin' yer own kind" is a wry comment; the player is also a tiefling participating in a raid on his/her own kind

TieflingLeader_5.speaker: Zevlor
TieflingLeader_5.text: I think... I think that's the last of them.
TieflingLeader_5.context: NodeContext: Elated but trembling, in shock - he'd hoped they would survive but never fully believed it.

TieflingLeader_17.speaker: Zevlor
TieflingLeader_17.text: Gods, it's done. It's over. Just... just give me a moment.
TieflingLeader_17.context: NodeContext: His first true sign of vulnerability - he's presented a facade of calm and control to the people he leads, and he's letting it go for just a moment.

TieflingLeader_10.speaker: Zevlor
TieflingLeader_10.text: Gods above, you're alive. A little light, just as the day seems darkest.
TieflingLeader_10.context: NodeContext: He's relieved to see you, but warning of the impending attack - player might just have jumped out of the frying pan and into the fire.

TieflingLeader_45.speaker: Zevlor
TieflingLeader_45.text: I'd given you up for dead at the goblin camp - I'm damn glad to be wrong.

TieflingLeader_28.speaker: Zevlor
TieflingLeader_28.text: Gods! You have a habit of turning up where you're least expected - but no less welcome for that.

TieflingLeader_64.speaker: Zevlor
TieflingLeader_64.text: But what happened? We've seen them massing in the woods.

TieflingLeader_20.speaker: Zevlor
TieflingLeader_20.text: We've spotted goblins in the woods - what happened at their camp?

TieflingLeader_100.speaker: Player
TieflingLeader_100.text: They are my horde. Together, we shall feast upon you.

TieflingLeader_71.speaker: Player
TieflingLeader_71.text: I met the drow leading them - and led her here.

TieflingLeader_82.speaker: Zevlor
TieflingLeader_82.text: You led the drow here? By the Nine Hells, why?

TieflingLeader_73.speaker: Player
TieflingLeader_73.text: I want to see droves, piles, heaps of dead. I want to climb a corpsed mountain.

TieflingLeader_2.speaker: Player
TieflingLeader_2.text: She tricked the location out of me. It was a mistake - but I mean to make up for it.

TieflingLeader_39.speaker: Zevlor
TieflingLeader_39.text: A mistake? It's a damned - gods damn it, we're not ready for this.

TieflingLeader_38.speaker: Player
TieflingLeader_38.text: Trust me - she thinks we're on the same side.

TieflingLeader_53.speaker: Zevlor
TieflingLeader_53.text: Our trap? I can't help but feel that we're the ones backed into a corner.

TieflingLeader_58.speaker: Zevlor
TieflingLeader_58.text: But... if you say you're a match for this drow, I suppose that's the best chance we have.

TieflingLeader_85.speaker: Zevlor
TieflingLeader_85.text: The horn. If you seek to draw her in, that damned thing's loud as thunder. It'll give our people a chance to take shelter, too.

TieflingLeader_44.speaker: Player
TieflingLeader_44.text: Relax - this is a trap, and now she's walking right into it.

TieflingLeader_8.speaker: Zevlor
TieflingLeader_8.text: So... what? We're to be bait for this drow? Gods above, I...

TieflingLeader_101.speaker: Zevlor
TieflingLeader_101.text: If this is what it has come to, then... so be it. You'll need to draw her attention.

TieflingLeader_24.speaker: Zevlor
TieflingLeader_24.text: The horn - damn thing's loud as thunder. It'll give our people a chance to take shelter, too.

TieflingLeader_36.speaker: Player
TieflingLeader_36.text: Simple. This grove belongs to the Absolute now.

TieflingLeader_51.speaker: Player
TieflingLeader_51.text: The goblins are coming - and they're led by a drow.

TieflingLeader_81.speaker: Zevlor
TieflingLeader_81.text: Truly? Hells, I didn't expect her to... We were almost ready to leave.
TieflingLeader_81.context: NodeContext: Quietly - he's usually polite and pragmatic, but you've just confirmed that they're facing overwhelming odds. Rare moment of vulnerabilty before the mask is restored in the next node.

TieflingLeader_4.speaker: Zevlor
TieflingLeader_4.text: Well. There's nothing for it, now - a fight it will have to be.
TieflingLeader_4.context: NodeContext: Fatalistic - he usually respects the gods but praying has availed him nothing. He appreciates your will to act.

TieflingLeader_22.speaker: Zevlor
TieflingLeader_22.text: We threw them back once. If you're with us... perhaps we can do it again.

TieflingLeader_83.speaker: Player
TieflingLeader_83.text: No point waiting around then. What do you need?

TieflingLeader_47.speaker: Zevlor
TieflingLeader_47.text: We need to thin the goblin numbers quickly if we're to have any chance of survival.
TieflingLeader_47.context: NodeContext: Grim - the next few lines are him explaining a course of action he'd rather not take, but emphasising that there's no choice.

TieflingLeader_16.speaker: Zevlor
TieflingLeader_16.text: Every ounce of oil that we could spare has been buried out in front of the gate.

TieflingLeader_35.speaker: Zevlor
TieflingLeader_35.text: We'll blow the horn to draw them in, and pray our fire-arrows strike true.

TieflingLeader_79.speaker: Player
TieflingLeader_79.text: A challenge for all to witness. She'll have a hard time resisting.

TieflingLeader_96.speaker: Zevlor
TieflingLeader_96.text: Good. She's expecting to find us weak and desperate - and she's not wrong.

TieflingLeader_12.speaker: Zevlor
TieflingLeader_12.text: But she'll find you waiting, too.

TieflingLeader_37.speaker: Zevlor
TieflingLeader_37.text: See to your preparations and then sound the horn. Let's have this done.

TieflingLeader_63.speaker: Player
TieflingLeader_63.text: We'll get through this, I swear to you.

TieflingLeader_29.speaker: Player
TieflingLeader_29.text: She'll take the bait - and with the defences ready, we'll win the day.

TieflingLeader_87.speaker: Zevlor
TieflingLeader_87.text: Your courage is catching, it seems. Or perhaps I've finally lost my reason.

TieflingLeader_33.speaker: Zevlor
TieflingLeader_33.text: Make what preparations you deem necessary, and then sound the horn. Let's have this done.

TieflingLeader_92.speaker: Player
TieflingLeader_92.text: I can't tell if that's a really good plan or an awful one.

TieflingLeader_75.speaker: Zevlor
TieflingLeader_75.text: Believe me, I've prayed to find one - but the gods have seen fit to stay out of this.
TieflingLeader_75.context: NodeContext: Firm. He's reached a decision, even if it is a dangeorus one.

TieflingLeader_21.speaker: Zevlor
TieflingLeader_21.text: You haven't - and so we place our faith in you instead.
TieflingLeader_21.context: NodeContext: He's settling into state of fatalistic resolve - he's tried everything else to keep these people safe, but there's no reasoning with goblins.

TieflingLeader_62.speaker: Zevlor
TieflingLeader_62.text: Hah. What I have is no choice - we need to thin their numbers quickly if we're to survive.
TieflingLeader_62.context: NodeContext: Grim - the next few lines are him explaining a course of action he'd rather not take, but emphasising that there's no choice.

TieflingLeader_23.speaker: Player
TieflingLeader_23.text: You've fortified the place well - we're ready for them.

TieflingLeader_55.speaker: Zevlor
TieflingLeader_55.text: We have the barricades - just not the warriors to man them. If we're to survive, we'll need to thin the goblin numbers quickly.

TieflingLeader_42.speaker: Player
TieflingLeader_42.text: I am just here for the show. I want to see you all die.

TieflingLeader_88.speaker: Wyll
TieflingLeader_88.text: No - you can't! I trusted you!
TieflingLeader_88.context: NodeContext: Upset, the player has given up the entire tiefling grove for slaughter.

TieflingLeader_70.speaker: Zevlor
TieflingLeader_70.context: NodeContext: It takes him a moment to realise what he's being told - that the player has betrayed them and sided with the goblins.

TieflingLeader_74.speaker: Zevlor
TieflingLeader_74.text: You've turned on us? Hells, why?

TieflingLeader_91.speaker: Player
TieflingLeader_91.text: It's who I am. Sin incarnate.

TieflingLeader_77.speaker: Player
TieflingLeader_77.text: I... don't know. I'm sorry. I wanted to save you, but it seems I'm too weak.

TieflingLeader_69.speaker: Player
TieflingLeader_69.text: I follow a god of death. That requires the occasional offering.

TieflingLeader_14.speaker: Player
TieflingLeader_14.text: I didn't turn on anyone. I look out for myself.

TieflingLeader_98.speaker: Wyll
TieflingLeader_98.text: Traitor. The Blade now comes for you.

TieflingLeader_6.speaker: Player
TieflingLeader_6.text: Don't look for reasons - it's nothing personal.

TieflingLeader_27.speaker: Player
TieflingLeader_27.text: Why? For the glory of the Absolute, of course!

TieflingLeader_48.speaker: Player
TieflingLeader_48.text: With you? You misunderstand - I'm with them.

TieflingLeader_18.speaker: Player
TieflingLeader_18.text: Take heart. My god is watching over us.

TieflingLeader_25.speaker: Zevlor
TieflingLeader_25.text: I suspect we'll need it before the day is done. The fact is, we cannot withstand a siege.

TieflingLeader_54.speaker: Zevlor
TieflingLeader_54.text: If it's to be battle, sooner is better than later. We need to ready ourselves and goad this drow into attacking.

TieflingLeader_86.speaker: Player
TieflingLeader_86.text: Take heart. My god is watching over us.

TieflingLeader_7.speaker: Player
TieflingLeader_7.text: Their drow leader found the grove. I couldn't stop it - I'm sorry.

TieflingLeader_41.speaker: Zevlor
TieflingLeader_41.text: Mrag. It... it doesn't matter now, I suppose. You have nothing to apologise for.

TieflingLeader_65.speaker: Zevlor
TieflingLeader_65.text: If it must be bloodshed after all, I'm glad to have you with us.

TieflingLeader_31.speaker: Zevlor
TieflingLeader_31.text: We're ready to head to your camp - are you?

TieflingLeader_50.speaker: Zevlor
TieflingLeader_50.text: Well, are you ready? Are we?
TieflingLeader_50.context: NodeContext: A hint of impatience, but acknowledging that you're the one calling the shots.

TieflingLeader_57.speaker: Zevlor
TieflingLeader_57.text: From what little I've learned of goblins, they won't resist an invitation like that.

TieflingLeader_19.speaker: Player
TieflingLeader_19.text: Take me through the plan again.

TieflingLeader_49.speaker: Zevlor
TieflingLeader_49.text: I wish it were as complicated as all that.
TieflingLeader_49.context: NodeContext: Nervous and afraid, but still a little humour - their plan is a foolish one.

TieflingLeader_1.speaker: Zevlor
TieflingLeader_1.text: This drow is no fool - she knows the smart thing is to be patient, starve us out.

TieflingLeader_60.speaker: Zevlor
TieflingLeader_60.text: I mean to prick at her pride - give her no choice but to be stupid. Sound the horn - let's have this done.

TieflingLeader_95.speaker: Player
TieflingLeader_95.text: Not yet - I need more time.

TieflingLeader_68.speaker: Zevlor
TieflingLeader_68.text: Do what you must, but quickly. Once you sound the horn, they'll come running.

TieflingLeader_15.speaker: Zevlor
TieflingLeader_15.text: I'd sooner start this on our terms than theirs.

TieflingLeader_89.speaker: Zevlor
TieflingLeader_89.text: You can understand why we've had to be cautious at the gates.

TieflingLeader_40.speaker: Zevlor
TieflingLeader_40.text: When the Blade told me of what you'd done, I was loathe to believe it.

TieflingLeader_59.speaker: Zevlor
TieflingLeader_59.text: I'm glad to see his fears weren't as bad as he imagined.

TieflingLeader_43.speaker: Zevlor
TieflingLeader_43.text: I know we can make a stand here. We have to. Your help will be welcome.

DruidGuard001_0.speaker: Jeorna
DruidGuard001_0.text: I wasn't sure about you at first. Thought you might be trouble. I was very wrong.

DruidGuard001_1.speaker: Jeorna
DruidGuard001_1.text: Peace in the Grove once again. It's been too long.

DruidGuard001_2.speaker: Jeorna
DruidGuard001_2.text: Safe travels. Wherever they may take you.

DruidGuard001_3.speaker: Jeorna
DruidGuard001_3.text: The tieflings have moved on. We can restore the harmony of the Grove now.

Ranged_001_1.speaker: Booyahg Benta
Ranged_001_1.text: Uff. Absolute has me feelin' pow'ful enough to run over that shitey gate.
Ranged_001_1.context: NodeContext: Guttural grunt at start. Brimming with adrenaline, he's gearing himself up for slaughter and he's barely keeping a lid on the violence.

Ranged_001_2.speaker: Booyahg Benta
Ranged_001_2.text: Rhaal'tuuch! Grab the meat while it's fresh, mate!
Ranged_001_2.context: NodeContext: Still in the grip of bloodlust/victory, urging you to join in. Rhaal-tuuch is rawl-TOOSH, screamed

Ranged_001_4.speaker: Booyahg Benta
Ranged_001_4.text: Hey, good-lookin'. Betcha killed your share with that face alone, eh?
Ranged_001_4.context: NodeContext: Insulting your looks (you're an alien race she hasn't seen before) - but in a friendly way

Ranged_001_0.speaker: Booyahg Benta
Ranged_001_0.text: Only 'avin a laugh - ain't to be messed with, your kind. Whatever you are.
Ranged_001_0.context: NodeContext: She's being friendly, impressed by your fighting skills - but she has no idea what 'your kind' actually are because you're a strange-looking alien race she's never seen.

AD_CraftyAtPool_0.speaker: Warrior Trunk
AD_CraftyAtPool_0.text: Think we could get more beer?

AD_CraftyAtPool_1.speaker: Warrior Trunk
AD_CraftyAtPool_1.text: Glad I had all that beer before the raid. Heh.

AD_CraftyAtPool_2.speaker: Warrior Trunk
AD_CraftyAtPool_2.text: That's what the Absolute would want, I bet.

AD_CraftyAtPool_3.speaker: Warrior Trunk
AD_CraftyAtPool_3.text: Could stretch the camp all the way through this little grove.

AD_CharmedKidStory_1.speaker: Mirkon
AD_CharmedKidStory_1.text: And they're going to kill the goblins, too.

AD_CharmedKidStory_14.speaker: Mirkon
AD_CharmedKidStory_14.text: We'll get out of here. You'll see.

AD_CharmedKidStory_13.speaker: Mirkon
AD_CharmedKidStory_13.text: And all the grown-ups and everyone will be all right.

AD_CharmedKidStory_7.speaker: Mirkon
AD_CharmedKidStory_7.text: And the beach was empty, but there was this... soft music.

AD_CharmedKidStory_16.speaker: Mirkon
AD_CharmedKidStory_16.text: It was really beautiful. And a voice was saying that everything would be all right.

AD_CharmedKidStory_2.speaker: Mirkon
AD_CharmedKidStory_2.text: I wasn't hungry anymore. And I couldn't feel that scab I got from that gnoll at all.

AD_CharmedKidStory_6.speaker: Mirkon
AD_CharmedKidStory_6.text: Everything felt so nice. I just wanted to get closer.

AD_CharmedKidStory_8.speaker: Mirkon
AD_CharmedKidStory_8.text: You know how there's this big nest on one of the cliffs?

AD_CharmedKidStory_0.speaker: Mirkon
AD_CharmedKidStory_0.text: And Mol saw something glimmering in there?

AD_CharmedKidStory_15.speaker: Mirkon
AD_CharmedKidStory_15.text: So when I saw there was nobody on the beach, I snuck over.

AD_CharmedKidStory_3.speaker: Mirkon
AD_CharmedKidStory_3.text: 'Cause I can climb the cliffs no problem.

AD_CharmedKidStory_9.speaker: Mirkon
AD_CharmedKidStory_9.text: And the voice started screaming - saying that I was hers!

AD_CharmedKidStory_5.speaker: Mirkon
AD_CharmedKidStory_5.text: And when I looked up, there was a harpy, ready to tear me to shreds.

AD_CharmedKidStory_11.speaker: Mirkon
AD_CharmedKidStory_11.text: I was so scared I just hid.

AD_CharmedKidStory_12.speaker: Mirkon
AD_CharmedKidStory_12.text: But when I looked up, the harpy was gone!

AD_CharmedKidStory_4.speaker: Mirkon
AD_CharmedKidStory_4.text: Because that person was a monster hunter, and they killed it!

TieflingVictory_4.speaker: Zevlor
TieflingVictory_4.text: That's... that's the last of them. Tymora smile on me... they're dead.
TieflingVictory_4.context: CinematicNodeContext: Custom cameras neededNodeContext: Stunned, elated

TieflingVictory_0.speaker: Zevlor
TieflingVictory_0.text: We did it! Watching gods, you did it.
TieflingVictory_0.context: NodeContext: Ecstatic and grateful to player

TieflingVictory_11.speaker: Zevlor
TieflingVictory_11.text: They name us outcasts. Hellspawn. Foulblood.

TieflingVictory_8.speaker: Zevlor
TieflingVictory_8.text: But the blood of those who fell today ran as pure as any hero's - so I call us by another name.

TieflingVictory_13.speaker: Zevlor
TieflingVictory_13.text: We are survivors. We are family. The road to Baldur's Gate is a long one yet.

TieflingVictory_15.speaker: Zevlor
TieflingVictory_15.text: But you have earned every stride so far. Make your preparations - we leave as soon as we're able.
TieflingVictory_15.context: NodeContext: Reminding of danger but reassuring

TieflingVictory_9.speaker: Zevlor
TieflingVictory_9.text: You. I don't know if you were sent here by gods, or fate, or sheer bloody luck.
TieflingVictory_9.context: CinematicNodeContext: Turns to look at player.NodeContext: Normal tone of voice as he turns to address us. He's been reserved before, but now he is absolutely earnest and grateful

TieflingVictory_6.speaker: Zevlor
TieflingVictory_6.text: I don't care. You were a friend when we needed it, and we won't forget that.

TieflingVictory_3.speaker: Zevlor
TieflingVictory_3.text: Should you ever need it, you have family in Baldur's Gate.

TieflingVictory_2.speaker: Zevlor
TieflingVictory_2.text: But we need not speak of departures just yet. We have time - the road is clear.

TieflingVictory_14.context: CinematicNodeContext: Cinematic of Halsin approaching the gate, Zevlor spotting him

TieflingVictory_7.speaker: Zevlor
TieflingVictory_7.text: By all the watching gods... that's Halsin.
TieflingVictory_7.context: NodeContext: Mute astonishment - someone they all thought long dead has just appeared. Wry amusement at the end, still a bit shocked.

TieflingVictory_10.speaker: Zevlor
TieflingVictory_10.text: He'll have some hard words for Kagha, I expect.

TieflingVictory_12.speaker: Zevlor
TieflingVictory_12.text: Go speak to him. You're the reason he has a grove to return to at all. We'll be here when you're ready to travel.

TieflingVictory_5.speaker: Zevlor
TieflingVictory_5.text: Go! Speak to him. Return when you wish to travel to your camp. We have twice the reason to celebrate.
TieflingVictory_5.context: NodeContext: Gently urging you on - someone has to be catch Halsin up on what happened, and he's probably not going to like it

TieflingVictory_16.speaker: Zevlor
TieflingVictory_16.text: And I, for one, could use a bloody drink. We'll join your camp tonight, if you'll have us.

AD_InstructionsForKids_0.speaker: Rikka
AD_InstructionsForKids_0.text: If there's fighting, you run and you do not stop. For anything.

AD_InstructionsForKids_1.speaker: Rikka
AD_InstructionsForKids_1.text: If we get separated or need to break camp fast, remember - find the river and follow it downstream.

AD_InstructionsForKids_2.speaker: Rikka
AD_InstructionsForKids_2.text: Remember - stay near the centre of the group, all right? No wandering off.

Tiefling007_2.speaker: Guex
Tiefling007_2.text: Now it's back to the road, I suppose. It never ends, does it?

Tiefling007_5.speaker: Guex
Tiefling007_5.text: I'm glad you came through it alive. We owe you, more than we can repay.

Tiefling007_7.speaker: Guex
Tiefling007_7.text: Don't spare the fire-arrows. Let's see if goblins are prettier with a coat of burning oil on.

Tiefling007_9.speaker: Guex
Tiefling007_9.text: Don't worry - we'll be ready when they come.
Tiefling007_9.context: NodeContext: Nervous, trying to reassure himself as much as you

Tiefling007_11.speaker: Guex
Tiefling007_11.text: Don't spare the fire-arrows. Let's see if goblins are prettier with a coat of burning oil on.

Tiefling007_1.speaker: Player
Tiefling007_1.text: You want to use flaming arrows? In a wood grove?

Tiefling007_3.speaker: Guex
Tiefling007_3.text: What I want is to kill goblins. This place is better off a pile of ash than their latrine pit.

Tiefling007_6.speaker: Player
Tiefling007_6.text: I've seen death by fire before. Not a pleasant way to go.

Tiefling007_0.speaker: Guex
Tiefling007_0.text: Sounds a fine one to me, so long as it's goblins doing the dying.
Tiefling007_0.context: NodeContext: Bravado. A little bit of over-compensating

Tiefling007_8.speaker: Player
Tiefling007_8.text: Those barrels make a fine target - one strike could set you alight.

Tiefling007_10.speaker: Guex
Tiefling007_10.text: I'm not afraid of fire. They call us 'hellspawn' - maybe it's time they face a bit of hell in return.
Tiefling007_10.context: NodeContext: Bravado. A little bit of over-compensating
